loans.name: Veang

texts.en:
T., a 31-year-old mother of four children, all young, is married to Hung, 34, who sells meatballs and other foods. T. has operated a door-to-door nail decoration service for the surrounding neighbors since 2005, earning a good income. Because her husband's business is doing so well, and in order to meet the growing financial needs of her family, T. is requesting a loan of $300 to buy more meatballs for Hung's enterprise.

T.'s husband is in the photo

loans.use: To buy more meatballs.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a 41-year-old lady. She is a widow and the mother of two who are aged 23 and 4 years. She sells used clothes such as boys' tracksuits in Nairobi. She has been in this business for five years and employs two people. She describes her business as busy and hopes to grow her business to a larger scale. 

Evalyne has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 to increase her stock of boys' tracksuits and to introduce ladies' tracksuits for sale in her business. She hopes to create jobs for many jobless youth and describes herself as humble and friendly.

loans.use: To increase her stock of boys' tracksuits and to introduce ladies' tracksuits

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene dos puestos en el mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad de ayacucho en donde vende frutas al por mayor y menor, su día inicia en la madrugada hasta las 6 de la tarde, sus productos los adquiere de los productores que le traen a su puesto, Dolores tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 son estudiantes y cuenta con el apoyo de ellos en la venta de sus productos.
Dolores tiene 54 años y es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida hace 121 años, lo que mas le agrada de Finca es el ahorro programado y el préstamo rápido que otorgan. Dolores necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano.
Dolores sueña con tener mas capital, educar a sus hijos e implementar otro negocio de especerías por mayor.
texts.en:
Dolores has two stalls in the wholesale fruit market in the city of Ayacucho. She sells wholesale and retail fruit there. Her workday starts at dawn and lasts until 6pm. She acquires her products from the producers who bring the fruit to her stall. Dolores has 7 children, 3 of whom are students, and she counts on their support in selling her products. Dolores is 54 years old and has been a member of the Communal Bank Nueva Vida for 12 years. What she likes best about Finca is the scheduled savings program and the quick granting of the loans. Dolores needs a loan of 3000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of bananas. Dolores hopes to have more capital, to educate her children, and to start another business in wholesale spices.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es:
El Señor Aurelio Núñez J. es cliente de nuestra entidad desde el año 2.008, está casado con la Señora Juliana Martínez, son padres de siete hijos, los mismos están domiciliados en el centro de Ciudad del Este. 
El señor Aurelio posee un local de ventas en un lugar estratégico ubicado en el  microcentro de la ciudad hace mas de 10 años, cuenta con casa propia.
Son personas trabajadoras, honestas, y responsables, y se refleja en los logros de la familia.
El señor Aurelio solicita el préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, harina, enlatados, fideos, panificados, y etc.
texts.en:
Aurelio Núñez J. has been a client of ours since 2008. He’s married to Juliana Martínez and they are the parents of 7 children; they all live in Ciudad del Este. Aurelio has had a strategically located store in a mini-mall in the city for over 10 years; he also owns his own home. They are hard-working, honest and responsible people, a fact that is reflected in the family’s accomplishments. Aurelio needs a loan to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, canned goods, pasta, baked goods, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, canned goods, pasta, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Pura Vida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pura Vida inicia su ciclo 37 con 22 socias que realiza diferentes actividades.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Ana A. que es presidenta del Banco Comunal por primera vez y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo del ahorro, Ana es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 hijos estudian, Ana viaja a las ferias D. las provincias D. Huanta y Cangallo en donD. venD. articulos D. ferreteria, con la ayuda eventual D. sus hermanos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima, actividad que realiza los días domingos y los demás días se dedica a la atención D. sus hijos. Sus sueños son apoyar a sus hijos para que culminen sus estudios y ampliar su negocio.
Ana solicita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. linternas, pilas, candados.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Pura Vida” (Pure Life) is its 37th loan cycle with 22 members who are involved in different business activities.

Such is the case with Sra. Ana A., who is serving as President of the Communal Bank for the first time. What she enjoys most is having the incentive to save. Ana is married and has four children, three of whom are students. She travels to the fairs in the provinces of Huanta and Cangallo to sell hardware products with the occasional help of her siblings. Ana acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima. She engages in her business on Sundays and spends the rest of the week taking care of her children. Her dreams incluD. helping her children finish their studies and expanding her business.

Ana is requesting a loan of 900 PEN to invest in the purchase of flashlights, batteries, and padlocks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flashlights, batteries, and padlocks

loans.name: Era

texts.en: Era M. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga. She is 53 years old and is married with five school-aged children. Era owns and operates a general store, selling dry goods (products such as textiles, ready-to-wear clothing, and sundries) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Era joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Era is requesting a new loan of 12,500 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Rosa Maribelt

texts.es: Rosa Maribelt tiene 43 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos para sus hijos y familia, los créditos anteriores han sido muy gratificantes para su negocio. Ella indica que le ha ido bien en el negocio pero siempre está buscando la forma de cómo atraer a sus clientes. Solicita este crédito para poder comprar una amplia variedad de productos como pintura de uñas, lápiz labial, tratamientos, ropa usada y perfumes. Siempre sueña con tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Rosa Maribelt is 43 years old. She sells general merchandise. She is always looking for a way to generate income for her children and her family. The previous loans have been very rewarding for her business. She indicates that it has been going well in her business. Nevertheless, she is always looking for a way to attract more customers. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy an ample variety of products like nail polish, lipstick, treatments, used clothes, and perfumes. She always dreams of having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe L. G. de 54 años de edad, reside en Colonia Los naranjos, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, los cuales son dos estudiantes muy responsables. Guadalupe se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de elote, los cuales realiza cada tarde y así posteriormente salir a comercializar de forma ambulante por su colonia y otras aledañas. Los tamales de elote son un platillo muy típico de este país y cuentan con muy buena demanda por parte de las personas. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar mayor cantidad de tamales, ingredientes como: maíz, manteca, leña para cocinarlos y otros más. Gracias a este negocio ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos, brindándoles todo lo necesario para que ellos puedan estudiar y que siempre cuenten con su ropa y alimentos, por lo que el mayor deseo de Guadalupe es el de poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 54, lives in Colonia Los Navajos, located in the region of Usulután. She lives together with her husband and two children, who are both very responsible students. Guadalupe works preparing corn tamales, which she makes every afternoon and later sells throughout her neighborhood and surrounding communities. Corn tamales are a very typical dish in this country and they are in high demand. Guadalupe requests a loan with which she can buy all the items necessary to make more tamales, ingredients like corn, butter, firewood for cooking and other items. Thanks to this business, Guadalupe has been able to take care of her children, providing them with all that is necessary so they can study and always have food and clothing. Guadalupe’s greatest desire is to improve sales.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Ingredients to Prepare Tamales

loans.name: Haidie

texts.en:
Haidie R. is from the village of Dicoyong. She is 51 years old and married with five children. To make a living, Haidie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Haidie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 750 PHP a week for these activities.

In 2009, Haidie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haidie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase ingredients needed for food production. Haidie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will also be used to purchase ingredients. This will be his third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to support his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed in food production

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Maricel is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Maricel owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Maricel has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maricel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jumagul's Group

texts.en: Jumagul T. is the leader of the group. She is 21 and not married. After having finished school, she decided to support her mother by selling cotton-seed oil. Out of the business profits, she has managed to purchase a cow. In order to expand the business, Jumagul wants to purchase more oil (300 kg) for its further resale; with the rest of the money she wants to open a canteen. For this reason, she hopes to get a loan. In the future, the young girl is planning to open a foodstuffs shop in the village and to marry. Alisher E., 56, is married. His wife is an obstetrician-gynecologist by profession. The couple has three children. The sons work in Russia and the daughter is married and lives separately from her parents. Since 2000, Alisher has been working as a builder and besides that, he harvests rice. Out of his earnings, he has managed to arrange his children’s weddings. His loan purpose is to purchase hardware for building. In the future, his family is planning to build a house and to obtain a car. Aichurek K., 25, is married. Her spouse raises money by working as an information-science teacher in the local school. The couple brings up two small children. The family runs its own business, which consists of cultivating and harvesting rice. This year, it is expected to be a 5-ton crop of rice. Out of business profits, the family has managed to build a house. The loan's purpose is to purchase necessary equipment for harvesting (20 liters of petroleum-based fuels with the rest of the money for workers). The next season, Aichurek’s family is planning to widen the land for rice cultivating and to start breeding cattle. Soorbai S., 61, is married. His family has five children. The elder sons work in Bishkek, while the youngest one makes his bread by working as a teacher. His daughters are married and live separately from their parents. The family runs its own business: fruits and vegetables reselling, with the youngest son transporting the goods. The profits made it possible to purchase a lot and to build a house. The loan purpose is to purchase more vegetables and fruits for enlarging the assortment and increasing turnover. In the nearer future, Soorbai is planning to obtain a minibus for goods transportation. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase oil for resale

loans.name: Shamsudin

texts.en:
S. Shamsudin is an entrepreneur from Kumsangir, Southern Tajikistan. He runs a small business selling men’s clothing and shoes in one of the local markets. He started his business ten years ago. His business is characterized by stable expansion and profitability. Shamsudin is the only breadwinner in the family. He has to put much effort in this business to make it sustainable and profitable.

Shamsudin would like to receive a loan of $3000 to increase his inventory. Shamsudin has promptly repaid all loans from IMON International. We believe his integrity, responsibility and strong will can help him succeed and to repay the current loan without any problems. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new clothing in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Pel's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers who are taking this loan together, and all of them make their living through fishing. The group's leader, Mrs. Pel H., is 35 years old and married. 

Mrs. Pel H. makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband catches or that she buys from other fishermen. This couple currentL. earns an average of US $6 a day, and they have been running their business for more than ten years. They have given birth to four children. All four are single, and one of them works in the fishing business as well. 

Mrs. Pel H. will be using her loan from Kiva to purchase nets for her fishing business. The other borrowers also will be using their loans to buy nets.

loans.use: To purchase nets for fishing business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 50 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Emilio de 58 años que es taxista, y de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo uno es  menor pues los otros son mayores y trabajan independientes. Cada día es de trabajo constante para esta empeñosa dama que se esfuerza por salir adelante, ella es profesora de educación inicial y comparte durante todas las mañanas con sus pequeños alumnos, además le gusta mucho la labor pues los educa con mucho amor. También paralelamente a esta labor también comercializa durante sus ratos libres diversos productos de belleza, de varias marcas reconocidas, a sus amigas y conocidas, y con las ventas por catálogo obtiene regulares ganancias sin mucho esfuerzo. Le gusta mucho trabajar en sus 2 labores para ayudar  a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar, de esta manera espera salir adelante, pues quiere concretar su mayor anhelo que es instalar su propio centro educativo, pero sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación lo concretará. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza pues quiere abastecerse para la campaña navideña que ya esta próxima.
texts.en:
María, 50, lives in her own house with her husband Emilio, 58, who is a taxi driver and their three children only one of whom is still a minor; the others are adults and work independently.

Every day is a day of constant work for this dedicated woman who makes the effort to get ahead.  She is an early education teacher and teaches her young pupils every morning; she enjoys her work very much because she educates them with lots of love.  During her free time she sells various brands of beauty products to friends and acquaintances.  With these catalogue based sales she earns regular income with little effort.  She enjoys working in both her occupations very much to help her husband meet the constant household expenses and get ahead because she’d like to make her greatest dream, to open her own school, a reality.  She knows that with much dedication and effort she will accomplish this.

This is her 6th loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the money that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress possible.

María plans to use the requested loan to buy a quantity of beauty products to have stock available for the approaching Christmas season.

loans.use: To stock up on beauty products for the approaching Christmas season.

loans.name: Samira

texts.ru:
Samira Z. 28 let. Ona vishla zamuj i seychas imeyet 1 rebonka. Samira yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjara, ranshe ona projivala v Baku qorode no seychas posle zamujestva ona jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy.

Samira uje 4 qoda zanimayetsya konsalting biznessom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Samiri v perviy raz ona brala $ 1200 i ona ochen blagodarna lenderam za ssudu. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  novuyu pechatnuyu mashinu i printerniy apparat dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Samira Z. is 28 years old, married with one child.  Recently, she moved from Baku and lives with her family close to Kalbajar in the Absheron district. For four years, she has been in the consulting business. This is her second loan and with her first loan borrowed $1,200 and she is very thankful for the help. Currently, she needs $2,000 AZN to purchase a computer with printer.

loans.use: Purchase new computer and printer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose W., age 23, is a farmer from Tala. She is married to Elijah Kioko and together they have one son, Mbisi, age 4 years old. Rose has been farming for 3 years and her monthly income is 6,000 Kenyan shillings. She was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. This loan of 5,500 KES is her first loan with KADET which she intends to use to buy seedlings and fertilizers. If the loan boosts her business, Rose will save some money and expand her farm. Rose describes herself as hardworking and hopes to become a great farmer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Mercedes Del Rocio

texts.en:
Mercedes is 40 years old and married with four children ages 23, 21, sixteen and fourteen. She lives in Primavera de Duran and her husband is a fisherman. Mercedes has a small business selling clothes and beauty products. Some of her family members have similar businesses and that is how she started out. She was able to invest a small amount of capital into her products and little by little her business grew.  Mercedes works alone from 8am until 5pm. Her business challenges include competition and insecurity. 

Mercedes has requested a $900 USD loan to buy more merchandise to sell. She will also use part of her loan to make improvements to her house. In the future, Mercedes hopes to have a stable business and to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to make home improvements

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 31 años, vive al lado de su esposa Ada de 29 años y su pequeña hija en la casa de sus suegros, juntos luchan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la venta de ropa, junto a su esposa. Esta muy satisfecho pues les va bien ya que compran la ropa a mayoristas de la ciudad y la llevan al lugar donde viven para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, así la venden a un poco más del precio real y obtienen regulares ganancias. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a dictar charlas pastorales en su iglesia cristiana, por lo que recibe un sueldo regular que le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de mejorar la infraestructura de la casa donde vive pues aunque es de sus suegros, ya le cedieron una parte a su esposa; ya que quiere instalar ahí un negocio. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carlos tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción, pues quiere empezar con la refacción de su casa, para continuar vendiendo sus prendas de vestir  sin problemas en la comodidad de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 31, lives with his wife Ada, age 29, and their small daughter in the home of his parents-in-law. Together they fight to get ahead every day. For two years, this enterprising man has sold clothing with his wife. He is very satisfied, since it is going well for them. The buy the clothing from the city wholesalers and bring it to the area where they live in order to fill their customers' orders. This way, they sell it for a little more than the real price and obtain regular earnings. In addition to this activity, he also gives sermons in his Christian church, for which he receives a regular salary which allows him to offer his family a good quality of life.
He has many plans for the future, such as improving the structure of their house--even though it is his in-laws' house, they gave part of it to him and his wife. He wants to open a business there. This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his quotas punctually since he does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. This loan will allow him to continue working in the search of progress.
Carlos plans to invest this loan in the purchase of construction materials, since he wants to start refurbishing his house in order to continue selling his garments without problems in the comfort of his own home.

loans.use: to purchase materials for finishing building his home.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married and has a grown son and a daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye.  Tatyana sells office supplies, dishware and umbrellas in the local market called ‘Yubileinyi’. She owns three vending locations in the same marketplace.  She launched her enterprise thirteen years ago. Currently, Tatyana has over 80,000 UAH in inventory. Her gross income is approximately 24,000 UAH a month. 

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 15,000 UAH to increase her turnover capital and purchase assorted merchandise. In particular, she is planning to buy dishware for further retail sale in her kiosks. Tatyana decided to work in this sphere of trade because there is less competition, and this type of merchandise always sells well.

loans.use: To buy dishware to sell

loans.name: Renan

texts.es: El señor Renán nacido el 9 de Agosto de 1981 en Santa Cruz convive con la Sra. Rosa tienen 3 hijos que s encuentran en edad escolar, el es  agricultor tiene su tierra en San Pedro distante a 10 km de la carretera, el siembra maíz y papa pero su fuerte es la sacada de madera para vender a las carpinterías tiene su propio camión para llevar su madera y entregar a las carpinterías, le va muy bien con las dos actividades, con el dinero del crédito comprara una motosierra para facilitarle el trabajo, su esposa le ayuda en la venta de los productos que el Sr. renan siembra, ella lo comercializa en el mercado de el torno, el sr. Renan es una persona joven trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Renán was born on August 9, 1981 in Santa Cruz.  He lives with Mrs. Rosa and they have three school-aged children.  He farms land he owns in San Pedro which is 10 km from the road.  He grows corn and potatoes, but his main business is selling lumber to carpentries.  He has his own delivery truck.

Both of his activities are going well.  He plans to use the loan to buy a buzz-saw to help him in his work.  His wife helps him by selling their crops at the local market.  

Mr. Renán is a hard-working man and very grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: To buy a buzz-saw

loans.name: Paulina Doris

texts.es:
Paulina, tiene 60 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Zurite provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. Paulina es mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de leche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Paulina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar queso como por ejemplo leche, sal y otros ingredientes. 

Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Paulina, age 60, has two children and lives in the city of Zurite in Anta Province, Department of Cusco. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who succeeds on behalf of her family. Paulina is a merchant who sells milk. She has been in this business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Paulina is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies for making cheese such as milk, salt, and other ingredients.

Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making cheese.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Pag-asa, Salawagan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Evelyn is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & instant noodles in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods to sell

loans.name: Erik Ernesto

texts.es:
El cliente Erik Ernesto M. E.. Vive en la Comarca La perla del municipio de Achuapa del departamento de león, tiene 1 hijo bajo su cargo y la actividad de la que el cliente se dedica principal mente es a la ganadería donde produce la leche y la vende, es de esa forma que sobre vive, ya que cuenta con su propio inventario ganadero, donde tiene su propia finca, para abastecerlo en la alimentación de su ganado. 

 La cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia, su propia finca de 32 manzanas de terreno en total. 
 
El destino del crédito fue la compra de una vaca parida, con el objetivo de obtener una mayor producción de leche y abastecer a su familia en sus gastos familiares. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su finca y llegar a producir más producto lácteo, para el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Erik Ernesto M. E. lives in the La Perla district of the town of Achuapa in the department of León.  He has a son in his care and mainly works in livestock farming to produce and sell milk.  He has his own cattle and a ranch that provides their feed.  He owns his home and 58 acres of land.

Erik plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow to produce more milk and increase his income to cover family expenses.  He will also be able to improve his ranch and produce more dairy products for his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene la edad D. 31 años, ella estudio hasta el segundo D. primaria porque le daba miedo ir a la escuela por que una vez que su mama la llevo a la escuela la atropellaron y a ella le dio miedo y decidió no regresar por temor que a ella también le pasara lo mismo. Doña Eusebia se dedica a cultivar diferentes flores comenta que en temporada naviD.ña ella cultiva la flor D. noche buena, y en los demás meses cultiva flores como geranio, aretillos, magones, velos D. novia y diferentes flores D. ornato mas. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para a compra D. tierra, abonos, macetas para vender sus flores, ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 3 años y dice que empezó con este tipo D. negocio porque su hermano y su concuño fue que le enseñaron a como cultivar las flores. Ella compre sus macetas y abonos en la cuidad D. Morelia Michoacán y dice que sale a venderlas en una carretilla por toda la carretera D. su localidad y poblaciones aledañas a su pueblito. Comenta “me gusta mucho cultivar las flores platicarles, cuidarlas ya que desD. que era pequeña mis padres me inculcaron el amor por la naturaleza. Doña Eusebia esta casada con el señor Crescencio el cual es jornalero ellos tienen 4 niños estudiantes D. primaria. La meta que tiene doña Eusebia es ahorrar un poco D. dinero para hacer mas granD. el vivero que tienen para cultivar un poco mas D. flor.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 31 years old. She only completed the second graD. because she got run over after her mother took her took to school, so she became afraid and decided not to return. Doña Eusebia cultivates different types of flowers. She says that during the Christmas season she grows poinsettias. In other months she grows geraniums, fuchsia shrubs, poppies, baby’s breath, and other ornamental flowers.

Eusebia is requesting a loan to purchase soil, compost, and pots for selling flowers. She has been in business for approximately three years and says she started it because her brother and brother-in-law taught her how to cultivate flowers. Eusebia buys her pots and compost in the city of Morelia Michoacán and says that she sells the flowers from a cart situated across from the highway in her town as well as in the surrounding neighborhoods. She says, “I enjoy talking about flowers and how to take care of them. At a young age, my parents instilled in me a love of nature.”

Doña Eusebia is married to Sr. Crescencio, who is a day laborer. They have four children who are elementary school students. Her goal is to save a little bit of money so that she can have a larger nursery for cultivating more flowers.

loans.use: to purchase soil, compost, and pots for cultivating ornamental flowers.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 38 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He provides photography service to earn a living and has been in this business for nine years.  He previously sold shoes to earn income.  

Being a member of Faulu Kenya has benefited Jeremiah because he is able to save money and access business loans.  He is a hardworking and dedicated business man who hopes to grow his business in the future.   Jeremiah has requested a loan for 50,000 Kes to buy a laptop computer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 41-year-old woman from Jabalia Refugee camp. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. Eman's husband has a small accessories and cosmetics store.

Eman took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband could purchase a larger amount of accessories and cosmetics to increase his profits and be able to save for a move to a bigger store.

Eman's husband appears in the picture here instead of her, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: G.s. Las Mojarras Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Las Mojarras está conformado por tres personas muy luchadoras y que cada día buscan como salir adelante. Irvin José tiene su negocio que es compra y venta de cerdos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad inicio por su Mama por esfuerzo propio ya que necesitaba mantener a su familia y su hijo de 6 años a su cargo siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable pues siempre está pensando en mejorar la económica de su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cerdos grandes para poder venderlos y comprar comida para entregarlos muy alimentados.
texts.en:
The “Las Mojarras” (The Tilapias) group is composed of three very tenacious people who seek ways to get ahead in life every day.  Irvin José is a pig merchant.  He’s been in this line of work for over 6 years.  

He started thanks to his mother and with his own efforts because he needed to support his family and his 6-year-old son in his care.  He’s always been a very responsible man because he’s always thinking of improving his home’s economy.  

The reason for the loan request is to buy adult pigs to sell and to buy feed for them so that he can sell them very well fed.

loans.use: to buy adult pigs to sell and feed for them.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TAYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia Antonia tiene 36 años de edad; la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de panes, la socia tiene una pequeña panadería ella tiene un horno y elabora panes y los vende, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de insumos tales como harina, manteca, levadura, leña para el horno y otros; ala socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la copra de insumos para la elaboración de panes.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Antonia, 36, is a member of the “Señor de Tayancani” communal bank.  She lives in Ocongate District in Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and three children.  She alternates her household chores with the sale of bread.  She has a small bakery and an oven and she makes bread that she sells.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients like flour, lard, yeast and firewood for the oven, and others.  She needs the loan to buy bread making ingredients.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan because it allows her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life.  She commits to make her payments according to the established timetable.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo José de 35 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de María está ubicado en su propia casa, ella tiene un puesto de comida, que  es muy concurrido por las personas que desean servirse un delicioso platillo nocturno, siendo su especialidad los Juanes y el Tacacho (Platillos típicos de la selva peruana), con los cuales se ha hecho muy conocida entre sus comensales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo esta afición, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes al mismo tiempo. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un restaurante, donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que invertir bien el dinero si quiere que su negocio progrese. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en: María is 43 años, simple and hard-working.  She lives in her own home with her husband, José, 35 and they have 3 children who they support.  Maria works out of her home selling prepared food, and has steady clients who enjoy her cooking, especially dishes such as "Juanes y el Tacacho" (typical cuisine of the Peruvian Amazon).  Maria loves cooking and has been selling prepared foods for two years, striving to satisfy her customers even when many must be served at the same time.  She hopes one day to open a proper restaurant to better serve her clients.  This is her fourth credit from MFP, which has helped her business to prosper., and she is very grateful to all who support her endeavor  She will use the 1,500.00 soles to buy an inventory of ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make prepared foods

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a dairy farmer from Litein Town in Rift Valley, Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years. He employs two farmhands. His mixed farm produces tea, maize and milk which he sells locally. Farming is his only source of income.

Wilson has made a loan request of 45,000 KES in order to buy a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him pay school fees for his 3 children who are currently attending school. His major challenge has been unreliable artificial insemination services which affects his milk production. He would like to build a dairy unit in the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in car maintenance since 2009. He is a hard working man, liked by most of his clients. Mohamad is recommended by most of his clients and because of their interest in his work, he requested a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to update his machines by buying an air compressor that is necessary to do an important part of his business. Mohamad is planning to expand his garage and to attract new customers. He is a self-developing man who is motivated to improve and develop his social and financial situation.

loans.use: To buy an air compressor

loans.name: Banco Comunal La Esperanza Group

texts.es: La Señora Kenia Lizett es la presidenta del banco comunal la Esperanza. Reyna Del Socorro, Candelaria, Bernabela, Tomasa Antonia, Audelia, Silvia Elena, Azucena, Santos Ramona, Yadira Del Socorro, Normalina y Rosa tiene diferentes actividades económicas.  Lizett se dedica a la venta de raspados y sopas. Hace más de 1 años que tiene este medio de vida, que con tanto esfuerzo ha obtenido. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de leche para la elaboración de sus raspados, hielo entre otros.
texts.en: Kenia Lizett is the president of the communal bank "La Esperanza."  The members Reyna Del Socorro, Candelaria, Bernabela, Tomasa Antonia, Audelia, Silvia Elena, Azucena, Santos Ramona, Yadira Del Socorro, Normalina and Rosa all have different economic activities.  Lizett has a business selling shaved ice and soups.  She has had this business for more than a year, and she acquired the business through a lot of effort.  The loan she requests is to buy milk to make her shaved ice, and to buy ice and other products.

loans.use: to buy products to make her shaved ice desserts, including milk, ice and other items

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Nimfa works hard to support her family. She has a carinderia (local eatery) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. Nimfa is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Nimfa has been sustaining her business activities with her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren is 49 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger or traditional Mongolian tent in a part of Ulaanbaatar that lacks basic infrastructure.  His daughter attends a local high school while his wife helps him run his public transportation business. He started this business in 1996 using a new Korean minivan. He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote lines which lacks official bus services. He leased a new minivan in July, 2010 and still owes three million Mongolian Tugriks on the vehicle. Dorjsuren is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 Tugriks to finish his payments. This will allow him to expand his transportation business and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay off the remaining debt on a minivan.

loans.name: Virginia Amable

texts.es:
La Señora. Virginia es socia del banco comunal Eugenio Espejo, vive por la parroquia de Baños, en este  lugar hay  fuentes de aguas termales y muchos sitios para visitar, una variada  gastronomía típica del lugar, su gente es amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones del sector.

La Señora. Virginia tiene 40 año, está separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 23 y 21 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente y su segunda hija estudia en una universidad de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Doña Virginia labora como empleada privada, esta actividad la desempeña hace un año y labora de lunes a sábados todo el día. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa y lleva en esta actividad 21 años.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños para continuar creciendo en su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Eugenio Espejo” communal bank.  She lives in Baños Parish.  There are many thermal springs here and lots of places to visit.  It has a varied cuisine that’s typical of the place.  Its people are kind and maintain the culture and traditions of the region.

Virginia is 40 years old, separated and has two children who are 23 and 21 years old.  Her oldest son is married and independent and her daughter is going to the city’s university.  She does not own a house; she lives in a family member’s house.

Virginia works as a private employee.  She’s had this job for a year and works all day Monday through Saturday.  In her free time she sells clothes and has been doing this activity for 21 years.  

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children’s clothes to continue growing in her business.  Her goal is to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massa is 46 years old and lives in an airport community. She is married and has two children between 12 and 13 years old. For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal. Some problems she faces is during the rainy season. She borrowed money from her friend to started her business. She learned the business from her aunt. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. Her plans is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Marites has a retail shop that sells coconuts & bananas. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

Marites is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 56 years old and married with seven children.

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Margarita has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 22 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains, charcoal and livestock.

Margarita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward has been extracting stones from quarries in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. He is 58 years of age.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy tools for his quarry so as to increase production and efficiency in his business.

In the future, Edward hopes to expand his business by buying more land for the quarry business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy tools for his quarry business.

loans.name: Bambu Kuning Group

texts.en:
Nurmah is married with three children.  She is pictured in the photo wearing the white headscarf.  She has been selling "pecel" (vegetables in peanut sauce), fried snacks, and cakes for the last fifteen years around her neighborhood.  So far it's been going well and the income can meet the needs of the home. Her husband is self-employed.  Two of their children are in high school.  School is important for the children because she herself only attended through elementary school.  

As there are no competitors in her neighborhood, she hopes the business can always go smoothly and the profits grow. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she will use it to buy more ingredients to grow the business. She wants her family to always have enough income for their day to day living expenses.

The other group members have businesses which include selling lunch boxes of rice, chicken, etc., swimming pool maintenance, making handicrafts, and selling mobile phone minutes.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients to make and sell "pecel" (vegetables in peanut sauce), fried snacks, and cakes.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah, a 44-year-old married father of eight, has been operating a butcher business for eight years. His main challenge is uncertain weather conditions which affect sales, thus leading to some losses. His business goal is to have a ranch, and his personal goal is to educate all of his children. Noah intends to use this loan to buy animals to sell ahead of the festive season.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows to sell.

loans.name: Masasuli S H G Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Masasuli SHG Group in Western Kenya! 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rebecca and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Rebecca is the facilitator of the Masasuli SHG Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Masasuli SHG Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Rebecca takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Rebecca had a very good maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Rebecca was only able to harvest 14 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Rebecca will educate her children.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Olga tiene 20 años de realizar su actividad comercial.Combinando la atención de su casa en las primeras horas de la mañana,luego después del medio día hasta las 7 pm atiende el negocio.

 En un inicio fue una de las tiendas pioneras en su comunidad,pero actualmente ella enfrenta una competencia fuerte que ha logrado superar produciendo uniformes para los niños de educación prescolar de una institución privada,mejor atención,facilidades de crédito.

 También en algunos momentos ha enfrentado falta de capital, esto lo logra superar con el apoyo económico que le brinda fundación mujer.

 Este crédito le permitirá atender demanda de época navideña y financiar la compra de materia prima para la producción de uniformes para el curso lectivo que inicia en febrero.
texts.en:
Olga has had her retail business for 20 years. She divides herself between taking care of her home in the first hours of the morning and running the business from noon to 7p.m.
At first it was one of the pioneering stores in her community, but now she faces strong competition. She has been able to beat competition by making uniforms for preschoolers from a private institution and by offering better service and credit facilities.
She also has occasionally faced lack of capital and has overcome it with the financial support provided by Fundación Mujer.
This loan will allow her to meet the demands of the holiday season and to purchase supplies to make uniforms for the schoolyear which begins in February.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, home products and personal use products in order to stock up for the holiday season.

loans.name: Matu

texts.en: Matu is 33 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and her husband is a business man. They have three children between 3 to 15 years old. For the past five years now, Matu has been selling slippers. She has more customers and makes more profit since she sells quality slippers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She  hopes to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Kantutitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Viviana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de api, venta de comida, venta de verduras, venta de papa, taller de llantería, venta de gasolina, tienda de barrio.

La señora Viviana,  indica que es el primer ciclo que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de api que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de harina y azúcar) que adquirirá de La Paz y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en la feria. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The “Kantutitas” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Viviana.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: api [a thick purple corn drink, traditionally served at breakfast, and flavored with sugar and cinnamon] sales, food sales, vegetable sales, potato sales, tire repair shop, gasoline sales and neighborhood store.

Viviana indicates that this is the first cycle she’s worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from one of the promoters.  She currently has a business that she’s had for years selling api.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital; she will buy flour and sugar in La Paz and after making the api will sell in at the street market.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Gloria Narcisa

texts.es:
Gloria Narcisa tiene 42 años de edad es viuda tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y los nietos en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz de ciclo corto. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para  la compra de abonos, líquidos, urea, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos agrícolas sin ningún tipo de problema.

El sueño es poder comprarse un carro. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema hasta el momento.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Gloria Narcisa, 42, is a widow with three children.  She lives in Ventanas--a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios--with her children and grandchildren.

Gloria is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias.  The members of the community bank operate farming businesses.  They grow maize, rice, beans, etc.  

Gloria grows maize for a living.  She buys what she needs in Ventanas and sells whatever she has to sell there, too.  Gloria is applying for a loan to buy the supplies--manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc..--she needs for the farm.  Your help will allow her to continue her business.

Gloria would like to buy a "carro" [probably a cart, but not clear].  

When she can spare time for them, she likes long walks.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a buys and sells fruits in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Susanita dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Tailoring materials

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsevar was born in 1980 in the Lachin region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). After completing his military service, he had to support his family instead of continuing his education. Two years ago Elsevar rented a very small shop to do phone repair. He has been busy with repairing mobile phones as well as with the selling phone accessories. Unfortunately he lacks enough funds to develop his business more. 

He has applied for a loan of $1000 to expand his shop and to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To expand his shop and to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara S. A. has turned her cooking skills into a steady source of income for her and her two children - Rudy (19) and Wilki (15). After suffering a severe injury while working in an industrial Free Zone near her home in San Pedro de Macoris, she lost the use of her left arm, but began cooking and selling home-cooked meals to families in her community to support her family financially. This loan will go towards purchasing new equipment and more food to increase her production and lead her to greater profits, which will help her save up enough to one day purchase a prosthetic limb.

NOTE: Clara and four other micro-entrepreneurs are part of a solidarity group designed by Esperanza to create a social network and accountability system. Clara and every other member in her group will receive an equal share of this $1,200 loan to develop their own businesses to support their families. They also provide ongoing advice for each other and help one another make payments on their loans. This group-lending method has proven to be a highly effective way to ensure accountability and support.

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils, additional pots and pans, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es:
“I have had my business for 1 year, but there are many things I need. I would like to buy more merchandise and a vitrine to display it. I hope not to have to close my business, since it what my family and I live from. I am asking for $1,200.00 to buy merchandise and a vitrine.” .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo mi negocio desde hace 1 año pero me hacen falta muchas cosas, me gustaría poder comprar más mercancía y una vitrina para acomodarla, no quisiera tener que cerrar el negocio ya que es de donde vivimos mi familia y yo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar mercancía y una vitrina.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a vitrine

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Herman is a dairy farmer and occasionally works administering medication to cattle in his community. These two activities generate the income to support his wife and four children, ages 9, 6, 3 and 1. He lives in the village of Tahari in Achacachi, two hours from the city of El Alto.

He will use this loan to purchase an additional dairy cow to increase milk production. He qualifies to receive this, his first loan with IMPRO/Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hernan es productor de leche y eventualmente trabaja como dosificador de ganados por toda su comunidad. Estos son sus ingresos principales con que mantiene a cuatro hijos de 9, 6, 3 y 1 año de edad y esposa. Vive en la Comunidad de Tahari – Achacachi (Ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito que solicita sera invertido en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Putri Widi

texts.id:
Nyoman Putri Widiani is a widow with 2 children, and needs more attention this time. To bare the responsibility not only as a mother, but also as a father is a very heavy burden. Nyoman Putri Widiani husband died of sickness. To fulfill household needs, every day Nyoman Putri Widiani works as a building laborer. Besides that Nyoman Putri Widiani also raised 1 fattening pig as savings for her children, since those 2 are now in Grade school. The capital to buy feed and feedstock is obtained from Dinari for Rp 1,700,000 (about US$200). Capital spending to buy feedstock was Rp 300,000 (about $35), the rest to buy animal feed and additional household expenses. Until harvest Rp600,000 (about $70) was spent, including feed. Gross income was Rp 1,200,000 (abot $140), nett Rp600,000 (about $70). From that she likes to raise 3 more fattening pigs. Her hope is to get the loan from Dinari could continue, so that her 2 children could go to higher education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Nyoman Putri Widiani janda dengan 2 anaknya yang saat ini membutuhkan perhatian yang lebih banyak. Memikul 2 tanggung jawab dalam keluarga selain sebagai ibu juga harus bisa menjadi sosok seorang ayah sangatlah berat. Suami Nyoman Putri Widiani meninggal karena sakit. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya tiap hari Nyoman Putri widiani bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan. Selain memiliki kesibukan sebagai buruh Nyoman Putri widiani memelihara 1 babi penggemukan untuk tabungan anaknya karena 2 anaknya sekarang duduk di bangku SD. Modal yang didapat untuk membeli bibit dan pakan didapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.700,000,-. Modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli bibit sebesar Rp.300,000,- sisanya untuk modal pakan juga untuk tambahan pengeluaran rumah tangganya. Modal yang dikeluarkan sampai panen sebesar Rp.600,000,- ini sudah terhitung dengan pakannya. Penghasilan kotornya sebesar Rp.1.200,000,- jadi bersihnya Rp. 600,000,-. Dengan hasil yang di dapatnya ini Nyoman Putri Widiani ingin memelihara 3 babi penggemukan lagi. Harapan Nyoman Putri Widiani supaya pinjaman dari Dinari dapat berjalan terus supaya dapat menyekolahkan ke 2 anaknya kejenjang yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use:
To buy pig feed & feedstock

Membeli pakan dan bibit babi

loans.name: Saumaleula

texts.en: Saumaleula is a married and the mother of two children. She is a long-term participant in SPBD’s loan program, because she makes repayments regularly and follows the program’s rules and policies very carefully and honestly. She has applied for a new loan to buy ingredients for her popular popsicle-making business, and to repair the roof on her house and its bathroom. She is happy with the support she has received from our loan program because it has helped her achieve a big improvement in her family's living standards. She hopes to remain in the program for a long time and continue the improvement she has achieved in recent years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her popsicle-making business and for home improvement

loans.name: Rosa Iris

texts.en:
Rosa is a twenty-nine year old mother of four.  Her two boys and two girls range from four months to seven years old.  Her two eldest children attend school.  Rosa operates her own luncheonette where she serves freshly prepared chicken, salads, squeezed juices and other traditionally prepared Dominican dishes.

With her loan Rosa plans on stocking more of the meats, fruits and vegetables with which she prepares her meals.  She hopes that as she has more foodstuffs available, she can serve more food daily and build a larger business with a greater number of customers.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for the preparation of Dominican dishes

loans.name: Critóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal is 35 years old and his wife Nancy is 31. They have been married for 12 years and two beautiful 11 and 6 year-old children has been the result of their union. Both children are in elementary school.

Cristóbal dedicates himself to the cultivation and sale of all types of vegetables. His work day begins very early, due to the fact that he must leave his house at 3 A.M. every day to get himself to the Abasto Market with the purpose of marketing his cultivated products. The market is an hour away from the city of Itá. Once he sells all of his vegetables he returns home at around 9 A.M. to work in the field.

Thanks to his hard work and effort of 15 years in this line of work, Cristóbal has been able to raise enough money to build his own home and buy himself a truck that he uses for the transport of vegetables to their sales destination.

For this year his big project is to open a chicken business in his home (a place where cooked chickens are sold and ready to eat). This way he will be able to obtain greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Cristóbal tiene 35 años y su esposa Nancy tiene 31 años. Están casados hace 12 años y fruto de la unión han nacido dos hermosos hijos de 11 y 6 años respectivamente. Ambos niños van a la escuela primaria.

Cristóbal se dedica al cultivo y venta de todo tipo de hortalizas. Su día de trabajo comienza muy temprano debido que debe trasladarse todos los días a las 03:00 am. hasta el Mercado de Abasto de la ciudad capital (queda a una hora de la ciudad de Itá), con el fin de comercializar sus productos cultivados. Una vez que vende todas sus hortalizas el regresa a su casa alrededor de las 9:00 am. para trabajar en su chacra.

Gracias al trabajo y esfuerzo de más de 15 años en la profesión ha logrado reunir el dinero suficiente para hacerse de casa propia y comprarse un camión que utiliza para el traslado de las hortalizas hasta los puntos de venta.

Tiene como proyecto para este año abrir una pollería (negocio en donde se venden pollos cocinados y listos para comer) en su casa y así obtener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase of tomato seed, lettuce, fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is single with a daughter who is grown. He is from Simferopol, Crimea. Valeryi sells sportswear in the local train station market. This market is always busy with clients. Valeryi offers a nice selection of merchandise for sale and arranges it beautifully in his kiosk which attracts many potential customers. Valeryi has been in this trade for 13 years. He has about $10,000 in inventory. His monthly income is about $800.

Valeryi is requesting a loan of $500 for a two-month period. He is planning to purchase 20 jackets from wholesalers in Odessa. One of his business plans is to open a second vending facility and hire a sales person to work as a market vendor in the same market. With increased sales and profits, Valeryi will be able to open an additional vending kiosk and improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: Purchase 20 jackets from wholesalers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth Y. is a trader who sells provisions and soft drinks. Her husband sells fish. The couple has 5 children. Business is doing very well and she wishes to increase sales and expand her business. She is asking for a loan of $625 to buy more sacks of rice, oil, milk, Milo, soft drinks and other products for her store.

loans.use: To buy more rice, oil, milk, Milo, soft drinks and other products for her store

loans.name: Catherine's Inoth Group

texts.en:
Catherine is married with three children. She owns a small poultry business, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Catherine now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwanaid and Aisha, who sell fruit and clothes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for a poultry business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Fatou S. is an old woman who has been selling crafts for over 30 years. The crafts she sells are all made by village women. Her main customers are tourists from Saint-Louis, Senegal.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Fatou S. est une vieille dame qui s’adonne au commerce d’objets d’art depuis plus de 30 ans. Ses objets sont entièrement des produits de la nature fabriqués par des villageoises. Sa principale clientèle reste les touristes venant de saint louis su Sénégal.

loans.use: Making crafts to sell to tourists

loans.name: Jacqueline Gaby's Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline, Silvia and Marlene belong to the Medalla Milagrosa Village Bank and live in San Juan de Miraflores.

Jacqueline lives with her husband. She has 4 children, 2 over 18, one 5-year-old child and a 10-month-old baby. She has an Internet business she has been running with her husband for the last 6 years. She now has 4 machines.

Marlene lives with her husband and has 4 children. She has had a cellar at home for 3 years and her business gradually grew.

Silvia is single and has 2 children. She started 3 years ago with a chifa restaurant and 2 years ago she implemented a poulterer’s as well.

Jacqueline, Silvia and Marlene are soliciting a 2000 soles loan. Jacqueline wants to strengthen her engine's power and purchase printer ink for her printers. Silvia wants to purchase merchandise for her microenterprise and Marlene wants to implement and improve her commercial premises.

Jacqueline aims at finishing building her house and extending space for her business. Silvia wants to have a well stocked shop with lots of products to attract more customers to enable her children to go to university. Marlene wants to have a store of her own and invest for her children studies.

loans.use: Jacqueline, Silvia and Marlene are soliciting a 2000 soles loan. Jacqueline wants to strengthen her engine's power and purchase printer ink for her printers. Silvia wants to purchase merchandise for her microenterprise and Marlene wants to implement and improve her commercial premises.

loans.name: Youssouph

texts.fr:
Youssouph S. is an experienced elder, active and involved in wood sales. He would like the loan to improve this business. He is located on the outskirts of Ziguinchor and has much experience with this business sector.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Youssouph S. est un vieux actif qui s'nvestit dans le commerce du bois . Il veut ce prêt pour renforcer son activté. Il habite la banlieue de Ziguinchor, il a une grande expérience du secteur.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Raquel Armanda

texts.es:
Raquel has worked selling vegetables at the Municipal Market of Santiago Sacatepquez for more than 13 years. She is considered a very responsible women and a hard worker. She applied for this loan in order to buy more vegetables, taking advantage of the season and, in this manner, increasing her income and profits. She would also like to have a greater variety of products which will also help her to earn more. Her greatest desire is to provide for the education of her children. Raquel has two children, one that is 13 years old and one that is 16, who are currently in school. She separated from her husband three years ago and does not receive any economic support from him. Raquel is the only person that is providing income for her family.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

Raquel ha trabajado en la venta de verduras en el Mercado Municipal de Santiago Sacatepquez por más de 13 años. Es considerada como una mujer muy responsable y tabajadora. Este préstamo lo ha solicitado por que quiere comprar más verduras, aprovechando que ahora es muy buena época para hacerlo, y de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos y ganancias. Quiere tener también mas variedad de productos, esto le ayudará a ganar más. Su mayor deseo es sacar adelante los estudios de sus hijos, tiene dos hijos, uno de 13 años y el otro de 16, los dos están estudiando actualmente. Ella se separó de su esposo hace 3 años, y no cuenta con ayuda económica de él, Ella es la única que lleva los ingresos económicos de su familia.

loans.use: Increase variety and quantity of vegetables that she sells / Comprar mas cantidad y variedad de verduras para su venta.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stone quarry equipment

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan for three members and Mrs. Leap C. is the group leader. Leap is 48 years old and a vegetable grower. She started her work in early 2008 behind her home and will sell her vegetables after 3 months' time when they are grown. Leap has two children whom are married and have left home. She lives with her husband Mr. L. Kun, 43. Leap lacks capital for increasing her vegetable crop. So she decided to request a loan of US$100 to purchase fertilizer to use for her vegetables.

Mrs. Chreup D. is 40 years old. She is working in her village growing vegetables. Chreup needs to ask for US$50 to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables.

Mrs. Nun L., 29 is also a vegetable grower. She seeks a loan of US$25 to buy fertilizer for her vegetable crop. They all live in Kantang Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: These women would each like to purchase fertilizer to grow their vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
La señora Genara, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso D. la provincia D. Yungay.

Ella tiene 48 años, D. su matrimonio ha tenido 5 hijos y que con el apoyo D. su esposo que es empleado público también ha podido educar a sus hijos e iniciar su negocio, debido a que su mayor dificultad fue no tener un trabajo con el cual ella pudiera apoyar a su esposo, es por esta razón que inició su negocio en el campo ferial D. Yungay en el stand Nº 13, donD. día a día venD. sus productos D. ferretería, comenta que ha crecido mucho porque inició su negocio con s/.1000.00  y ahora comenta que tiene invertido en toda su ferretería un monto aproximado D. s/ 100 000.00, ella viaja hasta la ciudad D. lima para poder abastecerse D. sus productos o D. lo contrario hace los pedidos desD. la ciudad capital.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, el cual cancelará en 8 cuotas, comprará tubos, chapas, candados y accesorios D. agua y desagüe.

Ella menciona que le gustaría capacitarse en cuestiones D. crecimiento D. negocio así mismo agradece al movimiento Manuela Ramos, por haberla apoyado en el crecimiento D. su negocio.

loans.use: compra de tubos, chapas, candados, accesorios, etc.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Mrs. Tho M. is a villager in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Met Sao, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they face a small problem because their field is infertile, so Mrs. Tho M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive.
