She is 56 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker and the other is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene 33 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos y vive junto a su conviviente quien lo ayuda mucho, sobre todo en su chacra. Se dedica al cultivo de maíz y arroz, como también cría ganado, este arduo trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 3años y lo que le gusta es cuidar bien sus cultivos y a sus animales, para que por su buena apariencia sean comprados a un buen precio. Y como sus productos, una vez en el mercado, son muy requeridos por sus clientes, le va bien. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, habiendo sido responsable en sus pagos anteriormente. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más granos para sembrar y abonos (guano y urea) para que sus productos crezcan fuertes.
texts.en:
Joel is 33 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his partner who is hugely helpful to him, above all on their farm. Joel grows maize and rice and raises livestock. He's been doing this difficult work since he was 3 years old. The thing that pleases him most is taking good care of his crops and animals since a good appearance might fetch a better price. And since his products, once in the market, are in much demand by his customers, he's right to take care. This is Joel's second MFP loan, having been responsible in repaying the first loan. He will use the funds to buy seeds and fertilizers (guano and urea) so that his products grow strongly.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers for farming business.

loans.name: Sahorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sahorn R. is a villager in Trapaing Ktom village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a successful pig breeder and wants to expand her business.  Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more piglets and pig feed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Roeung Pho, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Mrs. Sahorn R. is 31 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Kodjo Edem

texts.fr: A. kodjo edem habite le quartier d’adidogomé, il a une boutique qu’il apelle EZEK dans laquelle il fait le commerce de matelas, cousins, appareils electro menagers, il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite son premier crédit d’un montant de 500000 pour augmenter son stock avec des matelas coussins et appareils electro ménagers. il est marié et père d’un enfant.
texts.en:
Kodjo Edem A. lives in the Adidogomé district. He has a shop that he calls “EZEK” where he does commerce in mattresses, cushions, and household appliances. He has never been a recipient of a loan from WAGES and is requesting his first loan in the amount of 500,000 francs. The loan will used to increase his stock of these goods. He is married and a father with one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mattresses, cushions, and household appliances

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana cuenta con sus 26 años, estuvo separada de su pareja por 3 años, pero hace uno año que han retomado su relación, tienen tres hijos que están viviendo en su casa. Tras la decisión de retomar su vida de pareja y por el bienestar de sus hijos, ella su esposo se han proyectado en sembrar diversas chacras, alquiladas en su mayoría, adicional a una chacra de platanales que tienen. En las otras tierras siembra piña, donde el trato con los dueños es que las ganancias se repartes en partes iguales, lo que le permite solventar los gastos básicos de la familia. Juntos trabajan desde las 8 de la mañana y durante todo el día en las chacras, tienen la esperanza que siguiendo el mismo ritmo y ahora que tienen conocimiento de los micro-créditos, podrán sembrar con su propio dinero y obtendrán mejores ganancias. Ana ha sido invitada hace poco tiempo a conformar un banco comunal, y el ser parte de ello la hace muy feliz. Se compromete a pagar todas su cuotas en las fecha fijadas. El dinero que solicita es para comprar 100 plantitas de plátanos, cada bolsa le cuesta 2.50 soles, con el resto adquirirá fertilizantes para el abonado de su chacra de plátanos.
texts.en:
Ana is 26 years old and was separated from her partner for three years but a year ago they got back together. They have three children who live with them in their home. After they decided to get back together and for the wellbeing of their children, she and her spouse decided to sow a number of fields, leased for the most part, in addition to a banana plantation they own. On the other lands, they sowed pineapple where the agreement with the landholders is that the profits will be equally shared, which allows them to pay for the family's basic needs. They work together from 8:00 A.M. and during the entire day in the fields. They hope that by following this pattern, and now that they are aware of microloans, they will be able to sow with their own money and draw greater profits. Ana has recently been asked to join a community bank and she is very happy to be a part of it. She is committed to repaying her loan on time. The loan will be used to buy 100 banana seedlings, each bag of which costs 2.50 soles; the rest of the loan will be use to buy fertilizers to improve their banana farm.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy banana seedlings

loans.name: Ohemma

texts.en:
Ohemma N. sells ladies’ dressing bags in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2002. She is married with two children and received her senior high school diploma. Her husband is a driver. Ohemma is responsible for paying utility bills and buying food.

Ohemma’s loan will be used to buy more ladies' bags for selling. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' bags for selling

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. Jorge Chávez S/Nº - Caserío El Porvenir, Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella. Motivada por su espíritu emprendedor, con el  primer crédito de S/. 300.00, inicio su  propio negocio de Venta de comida y bebidas gasificadas (gaseosas), dando alimentación diaria a sus  pensionistas y clientes esporádicamente, donde ella siempre los atiende con su carisma y buen trato . En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio en un ambiente ubicado en su  misma casa, està contenta con lo que hace y tiene 02 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 que cancelará a un  plazo de 06 meses, comprará  paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes marcas, sabores y tamaños e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas, como arroz y azúcar en kilos, verduras y  pollos vivos; parte del dinero lo utilizará también comprando mas mesas, sillas, y accesorios para brindar un mejor servicio. Se siente muy feliz, ya que sola supo salir adelante con sus hijos y gracias a Manuela Ramos que la apoyo bastante, cuenta con su negocio donde ella misma toma las decisiones de sus ingresos y egresos.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank. She lives in the El Porvenir settlement, Bellavista District, San Martin Department. She is single, 42 years old, and the mother of 4 children, one of whom still depends on her economically. Motivated by her enterprising spirit, with her initial loan of 300 soles, she began her own business preparing and selling meals and soft drinks daily providing food for her customers with her customary charisma and good service. Currently, she continues with this enterprise which she undertakes from her own home. She is happy with her work and has been working with the communal bank for two years. With this 2000 sol loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she intends to purchase various brands of soft drinks in a variety of flavors and sizes as well as raw materials in bulk, such as rice, sugar, vegetables, live poultry, etc. for the preparation of her meals. A portion of the funds will be used to buy tables, chairs and accessories to offer still better service. She is very happy that she was able to raise her children alone and, thanks to Manuela Ramos who helped her quite a bit, she now has a business in which she herself manages all decisions regarding income and expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for meal preparation.

loans.name: Zukhrakhon

texts.en:
Zukhrakhon lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan, along with her husband and three children. She started her clothing sales business 10 years ago with the prime goal of helping her husband with the family costs. The business has proved to be a good match for Zukhrakhon as she loves sales and is a proficient saleswoman. All through these years, Zukhrakhon has managed her business with much effort and dedication. The business has also helped her provide education to her three children. In order to keep the business growing, she needs a loan of 2000 Somoni to purchase seasonal clothing. She plans to repay the loan within 8 months. Zukhrakhon and her family need your support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase new clothing for kids for the spring season

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is fifty–five years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Abena is a trader. She trades in game meat. She procures the bush meat from hunters in her community and nearby communities. She supplies to local restaurant operators in her community. Abena has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure game meat in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy game meat

loans.name: Kuña Tekorory Group

texts.en:
The women of this committee are all neighbors and live in the same district, San Miguel. The group has been with Fundación Paraguaya for almost two years and is in its fourth loan cycle. The women meet every week to pay their loans and resolve problems if someone cannot pay. At these meetings they also have many other activities, including the weekly raffle of a gift that goes to one of the women. The group has savings of 850,000 PYG.  

The members are:
1  Lourdes F. – food sales 
2  Serviana M.	 – purse sales
3  Maria M. – small grocery store 
4  Feliciana C. – clothing sales 
5  Norma M. – merchandise delivery 
6  Maria Cardoso – small grocery store 
7  Rosa Cardoso – food sales 
8  Isabel Benitez – small grocery store 
9  Maria V. – bedding sales 
10  Antonia M. – clothing sales 
11  Rossana C.	 – beverage sales 
12  Mirna D. – food sales 
13  Lilian E. – clothing sales 
14  Maida D. – clothing sales 
15  Cinthia V. – jacket sales

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet B. is from the village of Labuyo in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 37 years old. Juliet is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet does manicures and pedicures for local community members. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase business supplies. This loan will be Juliet's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy business supplies

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar P. M. es cliente de Fundación León 2000, pues es un buen cliente nuestro. Oscar tiene situado su negocio en su humilde vivienda. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues él un hombre con muy buenas intenciones, pues desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para salir adelante, pues su única preocupación siempre ha sido que su familia obtenga lo necesario. El financiamiento será destinado para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, jugos, refrescos, y gaseosas. El deseo de Oscar es ampliar su negocio y proveerla de muchos productos diarios.
texts.en:
Oscar P. M. is a client of Fundación León 2000 and is a good client of ours. Oscar's business is located in his humble home. For more than 5 years he has been working in this business. He is a well-intentioned man and ever since he was young he has had to work in order to get ahead in life. His only concern has always been to provide for his family’s needs.

This loan will be used to purchase sweets, bread, cookies, juice, soda and other beverages. Oscar’s dream is to expand his business and provide it with many everyday products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Komadia 2 De  Sogola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  KOMADIA  2 est composé de dix  femmes mariées âgées de 37 ans, ayant en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux  dans le village de SOGOLA, commune urbaine de BOUGOUNI, région de SIKASSO, république du Mali. 
Par des relations de voisinage ces femmes se sont connues.  
Afin de faire une bonne activité hivernale, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui  elles sont à leur cinquième prêt agricole et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter 12 sacs d’engrais dont 4 sacs de complexe céréales et 8 sacs d’urée pour faire 4,5 hectares d’arachide, 5 hectares de petit mil et dix  petites dabas pour l’entretien des cultures. Les intrants agricoles et les dabas seront tous acheter sur le marché de BOUGOUNI. La production totale attendue par le groupe KOMADIA 2 est de 3,375 tonnes d’arachide graine et 7,5 tonnes de petit mil. Une partie de cette production sera destinée à la consommation familiale et l’autre partie sera vendue en gros et au comptant aux commerçants de BOUGOUNI. 
Après le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, le groupe compte faire un bénéfice de 300 000 FCFA en fin de campagne qui sera  utilisé dans l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
The KOMADIA 2 group is composed of 10 married women of about 37 years of age, having on average 4 children and living in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children and husbands in the village of Sogola, township of Bougouni, Sikasso region, Republic of Mali. The women met because they are neighbors.

In order to have a good rainy season business, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their 5th rural loan, all the preceding loans having been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan they expect to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer (4 sacks of cereal mixture and 8 sacks of urea) in order to grow 4.5 hectares of peanuts, 5 hectares of a local grain called “little millet”, and 10 little hand hoes to care for the crops. The agricultural inputs and the hoes will be bought at the market of Bougouni. The total expected production of the Komadia 2 group is 3.375 tons of shelled peanuts and 7.5 tons of “little millet”. Part of this harvest will be consumed by the families; the rest will be sold wholesale or retail, to the business-people of Bougouni.

After reimbursing the interest on the loan, the group expects to make a profit of 300,000 F CFA at the end of the growing season. This will be used to clothe the children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: agricultural inputs and small implements

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel A. B., tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en el barrio Pablo Calero, Ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Miguel desde hace 30 años , se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo ya que carecen de fertilizantes , los planes hacia futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para lograr mejorar el cultivo  y poder estar en mejores condiciones y poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Agradecido con Afodenic es su octavo ciclo en préstamos los cuales ha sido para mejorar su negocio  y el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Comprar abonos para aplicar a la siembra

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Choeun C. is a youngest man 21 years old and married father. He was married to his wife for years ago and they have no child. He is currently owned a medium size of farmland that was inherited from his grandparents since he is still not married. He cultivates a various crops to earn a living. He also plants rice, fruit, and other vegetables which he will harvest and sell his matured productivities to buyers during the past three months after he grows. His wife stays at home to hold housework and also works on the farm actions. Recently, Choeun C. faces a small problem that he lacks some farming supply. This obstacle, he is therefore applying for a loan to purchase a cultivating machine which he uses to plow his farmland. In addition, he will rent out a new machine to other farmers for fees.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine which he uses to plow his farmland

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 41 años y 4 hijos, Maria se dedica a la curación de enfermedades referidas a los huesos como torceduras, fracturas, es Huesera actividad que aprendió de su padre,  actividad que realiza todos los días en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de camillas y vendas.
Los sueños de Maria son terminar de construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Anabella Community Bank. She lives with her partner, is 41 years old, and has four children. Maria helps to cure people who have bone injuries such as sprains and fractures. Her father taught her how set bones and she practices this profession every day out of her house. Maria needs a loan for 2000 soles so that she can purchase beds and bandages. Maria's dream is to finish construction on her house and to provide her children with the opportunity to obtain a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beds and bandages.

loans.name: Paula Alicia

texts.es:
Paula   es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata.
Paula es casada,  donde vive queda cerca un paradero de carros de la línea 8 de Villa María del Triunfo, ella en la puerta de su casa vende desayunos y dulces todos los días a la gente que pasa y trabajadores de la empresa de transporte.
En Finca ella pudo capitalizarse y crecer en su negocio, ella aprendió a trabajar, a tener ahorros para los tiempos difíciles.
Paula necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de gelatina, cebada, linaza, leche, todo compra al por mayor.
El sueño de Paula es tener una dulcería en su casa.
texts.en:
Paula is a member of the Communal Bank “Mar del Plata” (Sea of Silver). She is married and lives near a taxi station on the #8 route along the Villa María del Triunfo. Outside the front door of her house, Paula sells breakfasts and sweets to passersby and workers at a nearby transport company.

As a FINCA client, Paula learned how to manage and grow her business, work hard, and save money for difficult times. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy ingredients in bulk such as gelatin, barley, flax, and milk. Paula hopes to open a candy store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gelatin, barley, flax, and milk

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria Elena C. C., tiene la edad de 57 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio, ubicado en La Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como comerciante, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen tres hijos, todos ya casado e independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que ella inicio los trabajos agrícolas con el apoyo de sus padres , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no tiene una camioneta propia para poder trasladar las frutas y en ocasiones las plagas han afectado el cultivos ya que carecen de insumos necesarios para ser una buena fruta  agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su primer crédito ya que lo va a invertir en insumos y fertilizantes y poder lograr una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Maria Elena C. C. is 57 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Caralampio, located in La Concepción Masaya. She lives with her husband who works as a shopkeeper to support her with the household expenses. They have three children, all of whom are already married and independent. Her plans for her family are to improve their quality of life. Maria Elena began her farming work with the support of her parents. The biggest difficulties that she faces are that she does not have her own little truck to transport the fruits and that on occasion, pests have harmed the crops since they lack the supplies necessary to produce a good crop. She is grateful for the institution for the approval of her first loan, which she will invest in supplies and fertilizers so that she will be able to achieve a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer to improve the harvest

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan D. est célibataire et âgée de 39 ans. Elle réside avec sa nièce dans le quartier Kangaré de Sélingué troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonna l’école au lycée et s’engagea comme serveuse dans un bar restaurant de Bamako (capitale du Mali).  Après des années d’activités, elle épargna et commença le commerce de boissons alcoolisées qu’elle achetait du Burkina Faso et en Côte d’ivoire pour ravitailler les bars  restaurants de Bamako. Lors d’un de ses voyages elle fit la découverte de la  potentialité  de Sélingué (une ville touristique et propice à la pêche) et décide d’y investir, en achetant une parcelle qu’elle construit en bar il y a de cela 8 ans. Aujourd’hui le bar a quelques chambres pour l’hébergement des étrangers.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle intégra  le programme crédit  de Soro Yiriwaso depuis huit  ans. Après deux prêts de groupe, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et son prêt précédent fut bien remboursé.
Elle compte acheter, trente caisses de boissons alcoolisées (bière, Guinness…) à Bamako et réparer les chambres pour améliorer le service d’hébergement.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110.000 FCFA  qui servira à  payer l’intérêt du prêt  et investir les reste dans son entreprise. 
Son ambition est de construire d’autres chambres et piste de danse pour faire du bar un hôtel.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan D. is 39 years old and unmarried. She lives with her niece in the Kangaré neighborhood in Sélingué (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For social reasons, she quit high school and got a job as a waitress in a restaurant bar in Bamako, the capital of Mali. After working several years, she saved money and started her own business, buying alcoholic beverages in Burkina Faso and Côte d'Ivoire, and reselling them to bars and restaurants in Bamako.

During one of her trips, she recognized the economical opportunity of Sélingué (a touristic town, which lends itself to fishing) and decided to invest there. She bought a lot where she built a bar eight years ago. Today, the bar offers a few rooms for travelers.

Looking for complementary financial resources, she's been a member of the loan program of Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, for eight years. After two group loans, she's seeking her second personal loan. The first one was repaid without problem.

She intends to buy 30 cases of alcoholic beverages (beer, Guinness, …) in Bamako, as well as to repair the rooms to improve the boarding service. She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 110'000 (ca US$ 250), to be in part used to repay the loan, and in part invested into her business. She ambitions to add more rooms and a dance floor in order to turn the bar into a hotel.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 30 cases of alcoholic beverages and to repair rooms

loans.name: Rosa Eligia

texts.es: Rosa Eligia tiene 46 años de edad. Vive en su propia casa ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que son por lo que trabaja duro. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de especies. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y ha tenido la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ya que le han brindado la ayuda suficiente para salir adelante con su negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia para seguir manteniendo los estudios de sus hijos. Con el paso del tiempo fue aumentando sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra  leña, azúcar, saborizantes entre otras cosas. El sueño de Rosa es mejorar cada día su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Eligia is 46 years old. She lives in a house she owns, and has 2 children in her care for whom she works hard. The business she dedicates herself to involves making and selling specialty items. She has dedicated herself to this activity for 7 years, and has had the opportunity to work with the Fundación León 2000, which has provided enough help for her to get ahead in her business. She started the business in order to support her children in continuing their educations. Over time, she augmented the number of products she stocked. The financing that she requests is for working capital, to buy lumber, sugar, and condiments, among other items. Rosa’s dream is to improve her business each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Zyra Mae

texts.en:
Zyra Mae B. is from the village of Roxas Avenue Externsion, Iligan City. She is 24 years old. Zyra Mae is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Zyra Mae owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zyra Mae has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zyra Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zyra Mae is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Zyra Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Siguitemasson Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Siguitemasson sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Timpana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers. 
Ces femmes ont intégré  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter,  4 sacs de 100Kg de riz paddy devant être étuvé avant la vente, 8 sacs de mil qui seront transformés en couscous, une grande quantité de beurre de karité et des habits d’occasion (friperie). La plupart des produits sont achetés dans les environnants et sont revendus sur place à Timpana et au marché de Dioïla à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000FCFA par personne. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Siguitemasson group are married women who are, on average, 41 years old with 4 children. They live in large traditional households with their husbands and children in the village of Timpana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali. They know each other through familial and community relations. They run businesses selling various items. These women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more durable. They are on their sixth solidarity (group) loan, and all the previous loans were repaid properly. With this loan, they intend to buy 4 100-kg bags of paddy rice to be steamed before being sold, 8 bags of millet that will be turned into couscous, a large quantity of shea butter, and second-hand clothing. The majority of their products are bought in the neighbouring areas and are re-sold on-the-spot at Timpana and at the market in Dioïla to a clientele composed of women and men. They foresee realizing a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA per person. A portion of the profits will be reinvested in their businesses, and the remainder used to pay for the daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel has been married to her husband Arnulfo for eleven years now. They have a 9 year old child. She grew up on a farm because her parents were farmers and is thankful she was taught how to farm properly. Right now, she helps her husband till their rice field. Maribel also needs additional capital for the farm, and that’s why she applied for a loan of PHP5,000 from CEVI. She will use this loan to buy farm products like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla, 64, is a rice farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She needs farm inputs to operate her rice field, but she lacks capital. That's why she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will enable her to provide the supplies needed for her farm. Perla is the mother of seven children. Rice farming is the only way she can provide for the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: Farm inputs

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is a 33-year-old rice farmer. Her husband is a farmer also and they work together to earn an income to accommodate their daily needs. The income that she makes from her farm is really helpful in ensuring the supply of food for their family. The one beside her in the photo is her youngest child. She really would like to increase her harvest but she needs a small amount of money to buy all the farming necessities like fertilizers and farm supplies. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 18,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. The loan will mean she can increase her harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Cusisiña Group

texts.es:
El centro focal D. Panamericana se caracteriza por acoger a socias que se encuentran en Zonas nuevas D. L. ciudad D. El Alto, generalmente migrantes D. primera generación.
Es el caso D. L. asociación “Cusisiña” vocablo en aymara que quiere decir “Feliz / Alegre”, cuenta con 9 integrantes y están ingresando a su segundo ciclo.
Los negocios D. las socias son: venta D. quinua, tejido D. mantas, venta D. verduras, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. pescados, tejido D. ropa D. bebé, material D. construcción.

L. señora Juana A., D. 25 años D. edad, casada con un hijito D. 7 años, tiene el negocio D. tejido D. mantillas y ropa D. bebé.   Aprendió D. una vecina, quien L. contrató durane un tiempo, luego elL.  hizo un esfuerzo con el esposo y compró una máquina D. tejer para realizar su propio trabajo y tener sus propios clientes. Cuando se le consulta que le llevó a tejer ropa D. bebé y no otra, elL. responD. que para tejer para adultos requiere D. mayor capital y por eso teje para bebes.  Actualmente su crédito es por Bs. 1000.- que invertirá en lana y para el siguiente crédito elL. espera comprar otra máquina e incursionar en L. elaboración D. chompas para adultos.
texts.en:
The Pan American Community Center is known for the hospitality of its members who live in the newer areas of the city of El Alto, generally populated by first-generation migrants. Such is the case with the association named “Cusisiña” (the Aymara word that means “happy” or “joyful”), which has nine members who are starting their second loan cycle. The businesses of these members incluD. selling quinoa, weaving blankets, selling vegetables, selling groceries, selling fish, weaving baby clothes, and selling construction materials.

Sra. Juana A. is 25 years old, married, and has a seven year old son. She has a business in which she weaves blankets and baby clothes. Juana learned this traD. from a neighbor for whom she worked for some time. Later she maD. an effort to convince her husband to buy a weaving machine so that she could produce her own items and have her own customers. Upon receiving requests, Juana started making baby clothes and nothing else. She says that she does not produce adult clothing because it requires more capital, so she sticks to weaving clothes for babies. Juana’s current loan is for 1000 BOB, which she will invest in wool. For her next loan, she hopes to buy another machine for the possibility of making sweaters for adults.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Nidia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esta Sra. se llama Nidia del Carmen O. Mendoza, tiene 49 años de edad, soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas, el marido es obrero y trabaja en una empresa donde se produce Azúcar, ella tiene cuatro hijos, tres mujeres y un varón, ninguno de ellos depende de ella. 

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de Veinte y Siete créditos, los que le han servido en su gran mayoría para realizar compra de mercadería, vale mencionar que en los Veinte y Seis créditos  otorgados anteriormente, ella ha sido muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Nidia del Carmen Oporto Mendoza, 49, is single; she is a tortilla merchant. Her husband is a laborer employed by a sugar refinery. She has four children; three girls and one boy, none of whom still depend on her. He has had twenty-seven loans with our institution that, for the most part, have been used to buy merchandise. It is important to mention that she has been very responsible with her obligations in all prior twenty-seven loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business (Corn, Firewood, Lime powder)

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie F., 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Allan F., a seaman, they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been selling cold cuts of meat for quite some time now.

Lanie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 9,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of her usual products to be incorporated into her current stock inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her childrens' education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying more quantities of her usual products to be incorporated into her current stock inventory.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva G. is a happily married woman with four children who are in school. She is 46 years old and lives in Tombo, a rural area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone, where she sells medicines. Eva has been in this business for 10 years and loves this trade more than any other type of trade.

She joined LAPOSL in 2008 and has taken out three previous loans which she used to expand her business. Eva needs a new loan of 1,500,000 Leones to enable her to buy more medicines in the hope that she will earn a reasonable profit that will improve her life forever.

loans.use: To buy medicines to sell

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is married to builder and they have one child. Her child goes to school. Agatha takes care of additional family members.  She owns a stall in Makerere University selling biscuits, sweets, children’s reading charts, envelopes and cigarettes. She wants to use this loan to buy more biscuits, reading charts, envelopes and boxes of cigarettes. Besides owning a stall in Makerere University, she also acts as a cleaner in Mary Stuart Hall.  Her major customers are students of Makerere University. Agatha works six days a week. Her major business challenge is the seasonality, mainly when students break off for holidays.  She aspires to live a better life.  Agatha joined MCDT because it was near her place of work and residence. She lives in and rents a two-room house where she stays with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, reading charts, cigarettes and envelopes

loans.name: Victoria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Victoria es soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva vida lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones en temas de familia.
Victoria tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende mochilas, maletas, la atención en su negocio son todos los días durante todo el día, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada 15 días o dependiendo de la demanda. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de mochilas y maletas. Victoria esta ahorrando en su Banco Comunal para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria, age, 32, is single and has two children. Victoria belongs to the Nueva Vida Communal Bank. What she likes the most are the trainings on family. Victoria has a store in a rented location. She sells backpacks and suitcases. Her business is open all day everyday. She gets her products in the city of Lima. She travels there every 15 days, depending upon the demand. She will use the loan to buy backpacks and suitcases. Victoria is saving in her communal bank for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy backpacks and suitcases

loans.name: Sara Biviana

texts.es: La Señora Sara Biviana tiene 54 años de edad. Actualmente es una mujer casada. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento. Su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general su negocio se ubica es su vivienda, Sara tuvo dificultades ya que su casa de habitación está ubicada en un lugar muy distante por lo que perdió muchos clientes, siempre está pendiente de los que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materia prima para satisfacer la demande a de sus clientes. El sueño de Sara es de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Sara Biviana is a 54 year old married woman who sells general merchandise out of her home. This is not the first time she has received a loan. Sara has had difficulties because her house is in a distant location, which has caused her to lose many customers. Nonetheless, she always makes the effort to provide what they request.

This loan will be invested in merchandise to satisfy the demand of her customers. Sara dreams of improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem T. is 48-year-old married mother who currently lives in the territory of Kompong Tom Province, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. She is hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and other ceremonies. Her husband works with her at the same business. This couple has two devoted children who are students at the local public school. The family is concerned that their current income is insufficient to meet their needs. Nhem T. wants to invest in the business of selling beds to provide another part of revenue for the family. Because of a lack of capital, Nhem T. is applying for a loan to buy wooden beds in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.use: To buy wooden beds in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma D. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 33 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Wilma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Wilma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise, as well as fertilizer

loans.name: Balimaya  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Balimaya IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Missiritou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA T. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,2 hectare de haricot et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA environ en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Balimaya IV group are married women who average 35 years of age and 2 children each. Most live in polygamous families in Missiritou, one of the villages of the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops grown are, among others, pearl millet, peanuts and beans. This is their second planting loan and the preceding loan has been fully repaid. With this new loan, DJENEBA T. plans to pay for planting supplies, small tools and labor costs to maintain around 1.2 hectares of beans and peanuts. The crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui after the harvest to a clientele composed of retailers and consumers. They expect to make a profit of approximately 45,000 CFA at the end of the crop year.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, planting supplies and small tools

loans.name: Clemencia Victoria

texts.es:
Clemencia Victoria R. M., tiene  43 años.  Es viuda y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Maribel y Dostin. 

Clemencia es una socia de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Clemencia se dedica al comercio, tiene una tienda que vende productos de primera necesidad. Realiza sus compras cada semana en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en Ventanas en el recinto

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra productos comestibles para ampliar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es mejorar el estado económico de la familia y expandir en negocio para servir a las personas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos

Le gusta pasear con su familia.
texts.en:
Clemencia Victoria R. Mora is 43 years old. She is a widow and she lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 2 children, Maribel and Dostin. Clemencia is a member of the rural community of San Jose de los Amarillos, located in the region of Recinto de los Amarillos, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. The group is made up of 23 members and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they seek from the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Clemencia's occupation is commerce. She has a store that sells items of every day use. She makes her purchases every week in the city of Ventanas and she resells them in Ventanas en el Recinto. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of grocery store items to restock her business. She sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to improve the family's finances and to expand her business to better serve her clients. She faces challenges such as pests and blights in the plantations. She enjoys spending time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of grocery store items for her business.

loans.name: Omungyenyi Kwetungura, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
T. Swibu belongs to the Omungyenyi Kwetungura, Ntungamo Group. Hard-working Swibu has operated a garment sales business for the past seven years from Rubaare trading centre. By selling clothes in monthly and weekly markets in the area, he earns 500,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis. 

What has inspired him most in the business is having noticed the prevailing market in the area from local people. It is for this reason that he wants to get this loan to improve his financial prospects in terms of restocking his business with attractive materials and more bales of clothes. He earns additional income from farming and the ownership of a retail shop.

With these modest earnings, he has been able to make the best of the bad bargains that occasionally hit his garment sales business. Swibu happily reveals how he is able to educate his four-year-old child who is attending kindergarten. He is looking at business expansion in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials and bales of clothes

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Mrs. Sean N. lives in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She was born in 1955. She and her husband, Mr. Khea Koch, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family.

Her problem is that her rice field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Sean N. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will hire a plow machine to plow her field and a farm laborer.

Mrs. Sean N. has three children. Two are laborers and one helps with the parents’ business. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia N. lives in Kawempe, a neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (niece and nephew).   

 Flavia has a business selling bananas.  She has been in this business for 9 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Flavia   sells her products at the market, wholesale and retail.    Flavia has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.     

The main business challenges for Flavia include transportation, thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transportation costs and also educating her children up to university.   Flavia lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Jeff

texts.en:
Jeff M. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old. Jeff is single. To make a living, Jeff offers transportation services. Jeff has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeff joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeff is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jeff from GDMPC. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en:
Rufo R. Jr. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 52 years old. Rufo is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Rufo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rufo has been engaged in his business for over 17 years and earns approximately 45000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Rufo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rufo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. He is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Rufo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Nadija

texts.en:
Nadija S. is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Nadija owns and operates a boarding house in the local community. Nadija has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nadija joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nadija is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials to expand her services. This will be the first loan taken out by Nadija from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials to expand her services

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Isabel, nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, su actividad es la elaboración y comercialización  de pan,  tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar.  Es una persona trabajadora y responsable en su hogar vive en la casa de su padre, ella corre con los gasto de la casa en la cual esta construyendo dos piezas para tener mayor comodidad, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material de construcción como ser ladrillo, cemento, pintura, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in the city of Santa Cruz.  She’s a baker.  She has two school aged children.

She is a hard working, responsible person in her home.  She lives in her father’s house.  She pays household expenses. She is adding on two bedrooms in order to have more comfort.

The money from the loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: bricks, cement and paint.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty T. is currently in the business of selling wax and beans at the market.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Betty is 31 years old and is married.  Her husband is a farmer. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a clinic.

loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.en:
Carmen Rosa, age 51, has a cooking business. She prepares food and goes from door to door selling cooked lunches. She prepares the lunch meals for $0.90 each and sells them for $1.50 each. She has two grown children, whom she was able to raise thanks to the money generated from this business endeavor. Carmen Rosa works from 9 a.m. until 2 or 3 p.m. She is unmarried and lives in a cement house in a suburban area in Guayaquil called Orquídeas. 

Carmen Rosa plans to use her $1,000 loan to buy a new stove ($600), rice ($200), and other ingredients for her lunches.

The main difficulty she faces in her business is transportation. In the future, her goal is to buy a van to help her distribute her food.

loans.use: To buy a new stove, rice, and other necessary ingredients for her cooking business

loans.name: Ramona De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona P. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de pan.
actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace más de tres  años. Se a sabido ganar sus clientes por su buen trato y la buena calidad, sabor y porción de sus panes.
gracias a su negocio este le permite percibir ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares, doña Ramona tiene una hija que reside y trabaja en los Estados Unidos, le apoya ecomicamente pero esto no le es ningún impedimento para dejar de trabajar ya que siempre a sido independiente ademas le permite mantenerse ocupada todos los dias.
texts.en:
Ramona P. has been making and selling bread for more than three years. She has won over her customers by treating them well, by the quality and flavor of her bread and by its portions. 
Her business allows her to have income to cover the family's expenses. Ramona has a daughter that lives and works in the United States. Her daughter helps her economically but she does not think this is an impediment for her to stop working since she has always been independent. Her business also allows her to keep occupied every day.

loans.use: Purchase flour, cheese, lard, margarine, soft drinks, yeast, sugar and wood.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: A. Aya is currently in the business of selling local drinks such as passion fruit juice. She borrowed a loan to stock more local drinks to sell.  A. is 20 years old, married to a hotel manager, and has 1 child who is currently in school. In the future, with the extra profits from her business A. hopes to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: dried fish vending and fish and salt vending. Her husband George, who is 38 years old, works as a carpenter/laborer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 7 to 13 years old and are currently going to school.  Joy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Joy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to use as additional capital for fish vending so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Joy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ruth Julieta

texts.es:
Ruth, tiene 53 años de edad, tiene un hijo, nació en la ciudad de Cusco y actualmente vive en la misma ciudad. Ruth es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que se dedica a la confección de ropa en maquina de tejer. Ya son 25  años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ruth en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de costura como por ejemplo hilos, telas y otras cosas más.

Ruth pertenece al banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ruth, 53, has a son.  She was born in the city of Cusco and still lives in the same city.  Ruth is a hard working, enterprising woman who manufactures clothing using a knitting machine.  She’s been in this business for 25 years now and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  On this occasion, Ruth needs a loan to buy sewing supplies like thread and fabric, among other things.

Ruth is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Inti Pakareq” communal bank and she is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means.  At the same time, she commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies like thread, fabric and many other things.

loans.name: Dembagnouma. Group

texts.fr:
Dembagnouma est un regroupement de cinq femmes mariées  qui ont en moyenne 38  ans 3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à KABOILA II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
KADIA D. fait le commerce de fruits tels  les oranges dans ce groupe de femmes Dembagnouma de KABOILA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  2 chargements de charrettes d’âne en orange. Elle s’approvisionne dans les vergers des villages environnants de Sikasso.
Elle les revend au  marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Dembagnouma is a group of five married women who average 38 years of age and average three children each.  They live in polygamous families in Kaboila II, a district of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.
They are on their first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Their goal is to better satisfy the needs of their customers.
In the women’s group Dembagnouma, Kadia D. sells fruits such as oranges. 
With her loan, she plans to buy two wagon loads of oranges.  She gets her supplies from the orchards in the villages surrounding Sikasso.  
She sells her fruit, for cash, at the Médine market in Sikasso and within the family to a clientele of men and women. 
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 35,500 FCFA.  A part of this will be used to pay the loan and interest, and the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy oranges

loans.name: Mariela Iraida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre, esta ciudad es conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época.

La señora Mariela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la secretaria del banco y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 9, 5 y 2 años de edad,  los dos mayores están en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.

Tiene un bazar en su casa donde vende todo tipo de productos como bisutería, ropa, zapatos y artículos para el hogar. Ella en su local también elabora manualidades en fomix, decoraciones para fiestas, muñecas de trapo, entre otras cosas que vende, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, nos cuenta que tiene varios años con su negocio y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar artículos de bazar y productos para elaborar sus manualidades. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el segundo ciclo que se formo el banco y ella es la secretaria del mismo. 

Su meta es incrementar más su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabi, the members of the communal bank named “Women September 13" meets every two weeks. The city was known many years ago as the city of the royal tamarinds, for the great quantities of these fruit during those times.

Mariela is a founding member of the communal bank. She is the secretary of the bank and she enjoys it because the interest rate is lower than with other credit organizations. She is 31 years old, married, and from her marriage she has three children, aged, 9, 5, and 2 years old. The elder children are in school. Her husband is a security guard. 

She has a general store from where she sells all types of products, such as jewelry, clothing, shoes, and household items. She also makes foam crafts in her store, including decorations for parties, dolls, and other items that she sells. She works every day from 8am to 7pm. She says that she has many years in the business and it has gone very well. 

This loan will be used to purchase general merchandise and materials to make her crafts. She has been with her communal bank since its second loan cycle and she is the secretary. 

Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise for resale and materials to make crafts

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Lidia  Hernández Sánchez, vive en la localidad de Ángel albino corzo, es madre soltera con una hija de nombre Kendra Yojari  de diez años que cursa el  cuarto de primaria.

         El préstamo solicitado lo invirtió en la compra de mercancía como  son: azúcar, galletas, aceite, frijol, entre otros,  en esta actividad lleva   tres años y ocho meses lo que nos comenta que le va  bien a pesar de las temporadas.

         Se inspiro por su hija ya que fue madre soltera  y para sacarla adelante tenía que tener algo de lo que pudiera trabajar y lograr solventar sus gastos  generados en su hogar.

         Su deseo es que con el tiempo logre ahorrar para trabajar y así tener como comprar su material  de lo que utilizara para comenzar a construir su estética, para seguir trabajando y ganar su propio dinero para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the locality of Angel Albino Corzo, and is a single mother with a daughter named Kendra Yojari, 10 years old, who is in her 4th year of primary school.

The loan Rosa requests will be used to purchase merchandise such as sugar, cookies, cooking oil, and beans, among other things. She has been engaged in this activity for 3 years and 8 months, and she says it's going well, though a bit on and off.

Rosa, as a single mother, is motivated by her daughter.  To advance Kindra, Rosa had to have something she could work at to cover the costs generated by the household.

Rosa's desire is that over time, she will be able to save from her earnings and thereby, be able to buy the material she would need to begin to build a beauty salon, so that she can work there and earn her own money to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: El Señor Luis se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Lo que pretende con el préstamo es comprar calzado, ropa en general, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos y otros productos. El cuenta con la experiencia en la en este negocio pues tiene más de 5 años de poseerlo, Luis se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy emprendedora y le gusta mucho su actividad. El quiere generar ganancias para su bienestar y la de su familia y así poderles dar una mejor calidad de vida a futuro. Sueña con aumentar su inventario cada día mas pues se encuentra muy feliz de tener este medio de vida.
texts.en: Luis sells general merchandise. With his loan he plans on purchasing shoes, general articles of clothing, perfumes, skin lotions, personal care regimens and other products. He has experience in the field as he has been in business for 5 years. Luis has been known to be a very enterprising person who greatly enjoys his work. He wants to increase his earnings for his improved welfare and that of his family. He wants to provide them with a better quality of life in the future. He dreams of increasing his inventory more each day. He is happy to have this business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, general articles of clothing, perfumes, skin lotions, and other products.

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg is 54 years old and lives with her husband in a house in Dornod province, Mongolia. 

She manages a vegetable and fruit trading business with the help of her husband. She started her business at a rented booth at a local market in 1995. Since then her business has been quite successful, which allowed her to make her booth into small store. She is planning to expand and continue her business in the future. 

She is a polite and friendly woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skill. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase an abundant amount of vegetables and fruits in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase an abundant amount of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Norma Yolanda

texts.es:
Norma de 41 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Su esposo es comerciante vende artículos varios. Y tienen dos hijos de 17 y 13 años. Tiene una tienda.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás cuando su esposo viajaba mucho por negocio y ella se dedicaba a cuidar niños un día decidió abrir una pequeña tienda. Actualmente lo realiza con el esposo y uno de sus hijos. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería para poder surtir su negocio y así incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro desea adecuar su vivienda terminarla de construir.
texts.en:
Norma, 41, lives in a periurban zone in La Perimetral in Guayaquil.  Her husband is a merchant; he sells miscellaneous items.  They have two children who are 17 and 13 years of age.  She has a general store.

She started some time ago when her husband used to travel a lot on business and she cared for the children.  One day she decided to open a small store.  She currently runs it with her husband and one of her children.

With help from the loan she wants to buy more merchandise to stock the store and increase profits.  In the future, she’d like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell like oil, bedspreads and comforters.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Maria Mercedes ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual pago puntual mente fue para invertir en su negocio, pero por problemas de salud de su esposo, cerro la tienda. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para remodelar los acabados de su casa del interior y exterior, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y que es una pintura especial para proteger las paredes del calor y la humedad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que recibe de su pensión gubernamental que recibe y que con el ingreso de su esposo pagaran los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Mercedes has already repaid a previous Kiva loan on time. The funds were invested in her business, but due to her husband’s health problems, she was forced to close her store.

Maria is requesting a loan to remodel the interior and exterior of her house. She does not have the funds needed to buy materials and special paint to protect the walls from heat and humidity. Maria plans to repay the loan using the income she receives from a government pension. Her family’s expenses will be covered by her husband’s income.

loans.use: to remodel the interior and exterior of her house.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She also earns income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 23,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase a fishing net, gasoline and other materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Mercy has been in her business for 16 years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net, gasoline and other materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 34-year-old married man, the father of two children. He works in providing entertainment for teenagers, children and adults. He opened his entertainment games shop in April 2010, and it's all because he felt that it's the only safe place to gather such customers away from bad habits.

Houssam is a father and he cares a lot about the future of his children. That's why he works hard to improve his business through increasing his income to cover all their expenses and needs. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy three X-Boxes and three TVs which will help in increasing his income and improving his social and financial situation.

This is Houssam's seventh loan cycle with Al Majmoua. All his previous loans have helped a lot in adding machines to his business and expanding it; at the same time he is a borrower in good standing.

He hopes to continue expanding his business, and hopes to open other branches in the future.

loans.use: To buy new X-Boxes and TVs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia, tiene la edad 58 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo. Ella con el crédito va comprar materiales para la confección de ropa. Ella cuenta con la experiencia como costurera desde hace varios años, ella cuenta con varios clientes  que le encargan trabajos y quiere brindarles a ellos un mejor servicio y  acabados de buena calidad. Ella también quiere generar más clientela para así obtener mayores ganancias de su proyecto de costura. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old, married, and lives with her husband.  With the loan she is going to buy materials for making clothing.  She has several years experience as a seamstress. She has several customers who commission work from her. She wants to serve them better and do good quality finished work. She also wants to generate more clientele so as to make more profits from her sewing.  

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She had not had other loans from state-owned banks, and FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan more easily, and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials

loans.name: Aingaul's Group

texts.en:
Aingaul is the leader of this group. She is 41 and married to a veterinarian. She and her husband have a daughter and a son, both of whom attend school. Aingaul works as a cleaner at school; she also sells milk products to earn additional money.

The family has been engaged in cattle breeding for five years, starting out with an initial investment of 6,000 KGS.
