With the profits gained from reselling cattle, Aingaul was able to purchase furniture to improve the family’s living conditions. She plans to use this loan to purchase two more cattle for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, Aingaul wishes to open a grocery store. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Janbolot

texts.en:
Janbolot, 40, is married. Together with his wife he brings up four daughters and a son. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her family. The younger daughter is preschool age. Janbolot’s wife takes care of her and the other children study at school. Five years ago Janbolot sold a potato harvest and with an initial investment of 20000 soms he started to breed cattle. Reselling cattle after fattening them he earns about 4000 soms per month. This profit made him able to build a summer kitchen. He also purchased furniture and improved the family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase a horse for breeding. In the future Janbolot wants to increase the number of cattle and provide his children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for breeding

loans.name: 4 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Minh works in agriculture growing rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale. She is 33 years old and she is married with 1 child. Minh is the group leader of the 4 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives with her child in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2004, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes to remodel her house. She wants her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with one child in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. 

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past two years; in addition, she also owns a retail shop. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where demand is low during the rainy season. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 10,000 KES loan she wants to purchase vegetables for her vegetable stall. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Roel has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

Roel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Roel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Jamadah

texts.en: Jamadah wants a loan to buy maize produce for sale.  29-year-old Jamadah hails from Kyenjojo District in Uganda and is a father of five children. He lives with the children and their mother in a semi-permanent house. He got money from his father to start up his business, which has grown over eight years. His dream is to educate his children and he wishes to acquire a motorcycle to ease on transportation.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Aladin

texts.ru: Aladin yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Bala Bakhmanli vmeste so svoyey  drujelubnoy semyoy. Aladin jenat i imeyet 2 detey.  Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi. 11 let nazad on nachal zanimatsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en: Aladin is an Internally Displaced Person from the town of Fuzuli, now living in Fuzuli Region, in the village of Bala Bakhmanli, together with his loving family. Aladin is married and has two children. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle. He first started raising cattle 11 years ago.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rabassiburkindi Group

texts.fr:
Mme Salamata est la responsable du groupe RABASSIBURKINDI. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Il a 4ans. Il ne va pas à l’école d’abord. Elle 1 personne en charge.

Mme vend des condiments depuis 4ans. Elle est la responsable du groupe et c'est elle qui tient les tomates, une autre membre du groupe a levé sa main sur la photo. Salamata s’approvisionne au marché dans un village environnant.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de gombo, une caisse de tomate et un sac de sel.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle a pour ambition d’agrandir son commerce et d’acheter un motocycle.
texts.en:
Salamata is the leader of the RABASSIBURKINDI Group. She is married and has a four-year old child, who does not attend school yet.   She also supports one additional person.  

Salamata has been selling condiments for four years. She is the group leader, she is holding tomatoes in the photo. Another group member raised her hand for the photo. Salamata buys her merchandise at the market in a nearby village. Her customers are women. 

She wants to buy two bags of okra, a case of tomatoes, and a bag of salt. 

With the profits, she would like to improve her family's living conditions.  Her long-term ambition is to increase the size of her business and to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of okra, a case of tomatoes and a bag of salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fashion clothes and hand bags for her business

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon is 43 years old and his wife, Mit, is 44 years old. They live in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have three sons and one daughter. One of their children is married and lives in a separate home, one is a garment worker, and the other two are in school.

Muon and his wife have been farming for ten years. They grow vegetables. Muon is asking for his first loan in the amount of $700 in order to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

Photo: Muon is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La señora Elvira tiene un taller de costura donde elabora vestidos y arreglos en general. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como  telas , hilos, forros, cierres, botones, etc. Elvira es soltera y tiene tres hijos .Vive en casa como  cuidadora ubicada en la zona  de Miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz. Elvira se encuentra muy feliz por los créditos otorgados anteriormente –fueron cinco, todos pagados en su totalidad - ya que le ayudaron a tener más ingresos y mantener su familia. Esta es la tercera vez que desea que su solicitud sea enviada a kiva.
texts.en:
Elvira has a dressmaking workshop where she makes dresses and general clothing repairs. The loan she needs is to purchase basic materials such as cloth, thread, linings, zippers and buttons, etc.

Elvira is single and has three children. She lives in a house located in the Miraflores zone of La Paz as a caretaker. Elvira is very happy with the loans made to her previously. She has had five loans and has paid all of them in full. They helped her to obtain a greater income and take care of her family. This is the third time that she has asked for her loan to be sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, linings and zippers to continue with her business making clothes and general clothing repairs.

loans.name: Ivania Patricia

texts.es:
Doña Ivania, es una madre , trabajadora, sigue laborando como conserje, y apoyando a sus hijos con los estudios, a pesar que ahora tiene mas responsabilidad, al no estar su padre.
Ella vive junto a su mama, teniendo su cuarto aparte, pero su objetivo es, tener su propio terreno, por ahora quiere comenzar  un anexo de cuarto, dando mas espacio, ella ha venido mejorando su pequeña casa, al darle mantenimiento y cambio. Con este nuevo prestamo comprara materiales de construccion como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, y comenzar la obra, a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Ivania is a hard-working mother, who is still working as a janitor, and supporting her children with their education. This is in spite of the fact that she now has more responsibility, as their father is not there. 

She lives with her mother, and has a separate room, but her aim is to have her own property. For now, she wants to begin adding a room, to provide more space. She has been gradually improving their small house, maintaining it and making alterations.

With this new loan she will buy construction materials, such as cement blocks, sand, and steel, and will start the work in the near future.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for adding a room to her house.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es: Luz Adriana siempre ha tenido la vocación de servirles a las personas, y es por esto que decidió estudiar enfermería. Anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa, pero a Luz Adriana no le gustó mucho trabajar para esta empresa puesto que allí no sentía la vocación de servirle completamente a las personas, pues interesaban más los fines comerciales que el servicio a las personas. Es por esto que decidió retirarse y seguir trabajando como independiente. Luz Adriana actualmente ofrece el servicio de enfermería a domicilio, y así siente que les ayuda más a las personas. Sus clientes manifiestan que sus servicios son excelentes comparado a los servicios de los hospitales, por esto siempre acuden a ella en vez de acudir al hospital. Luz Adriana siempre ha tenido el sueño de poder impactar en la vida de las demás personas, y por esto quiere llegar a más personas con sus servicios de enfermería, pues muchas veces requieren de sus servicios y por la dificultad de su desplazamiento no puede aceptar el trabajo. Es por esto que Luz Adriana aspira a comprar una moto para utilizarla como medio de transporte para su trabajo, sin embargo, la moto cuesta COP $3.000.000 y solo tiene COP $1.000.000; por esto, Luz Adriana espera que un préstamo le permita acceder al dinero que le hace falta para comprar la moto y poder así seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de más personas que adquieren su servicio.
texts.en: Luz Adriana has always felt a calling to serve people, and for this reason she decided to study to become a nurse.  Previously, she worked for a company, but Luz Adriana didn't really like working for this company, because she did not feel that she was able to serve people as she would like.  In the company, they were more about making profit than serving people.  For this reason, she decided to leave this position and continue to work independently.  Now, Luz Adriana offers nursing services in people's homes, and in this way she feels that she can help more people.  Her customers state that her services are excellent compared to the services offered in the hospitals, and so they always seek out her services instead of going to the hospital.  Luz Adriana has always had the dream of being able to impact the lives of other people, and for this reason, she wants more people to be able to take advantage of her nursing services.  The problem is that many times people need her services, but because of their location she is not able to accept the work.  For this reason, Luz Adriana wants to buy a motorcycle to use to get around for her job.  However, the motorcycle costs 3,000,000 Colombian pesos, and she has only 1,000,000 pesos available for this purchase.  Therefore, Luz Adriana hopes that with a loan, she will have access to the money she lacks to buy the motorcycle, and in this way she will be able to continue to improve the quality of life of the people who need her services.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so that she can offer her nursing services to more people

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 34 years old single with 3 children living in Hioma, Uganda.  She owns a grains produce business and the business has enabled her to sustain the family since she is the sole bread winner.  She faces challenges in high price fluctuations and inflation. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business dream is to expand her business to new markets.  Betty needs the loan facility to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: buy groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Jose Concepción

texts.es: Don José es originario de Ticuantepe de familia agricultora, desde hace muchos años también labora como mecánico en un taller otro ingreso mas para poder cubrir con los diferentes gastos que presenta el hogar, su esposa es ama de casa no trabaja debido al alto índice de desempleo en nuestro país tiene 3 hijos que están en la escuela a quienes desea verlos realizados con una carrera profesional por eso el trabaja día y noche para poderles pagar sus estudios. Para seguirle dando mantenimiento a su cultivo solicita su octavo  crédito para comprar abono, urea, completo e insecticida; al comienzo esta labor le fue un poco difícil por la falta de financiamiento pero hoy en día encontró su alternativa de progreso con AFODENIC, sus planes a futuro es sembrar mas manzanas de piñas para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
José is originally from Ticuantepe from a farming family.  For many years, he has also worked as a mechanic at a workshop to earn more income to meet his household expenses.  His wife is a housewife and does not work because of the high rate of unemployment in their country.  He has three children that are in school.  He would like to see them in professional careers, so he works night and day to be able to pay for their schooling.  

To continue mantaining his crops, he is requesting his eighth loan to purchase manure, fertilizer, and insecticide.  At the beginning, this work was difficult because of a lack of finances, but since he found AFODENIC, his plans for the future include planting more apples and pineapples to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman, 44 years old with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.

Teresita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy equipment like new fishing nets and tackle.

Teresita has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment like new fishing nets and tackle

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: My house is on the corner where a bus loads passengers going into the country side.  I have been in business for 9 years.  I am proud to say that I have sent my 5 children to school running this store.  My main line of business is basic grains.  Since the farmers catch their bus here, I know many of them well and we have done business together for many years.

loans.use: Buy inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy shares in the stock market.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz Vasques owns and operates a small grocery stand on the street corner next to her home. She lives there with her husband and their six year old son. Her business is one of the main sources of household items, cooking supplies and food staples in her barrio in Villa Navarro outside Hato Mayor. Luz is even able to afford an extra employee.

This loan will give Luz the capital to replenish her store with canned food, rice, beans, bread, plantains, candy, and beverages. She has a refrigerator to keep perishable items and ample space to store a larger inventory so she can offer more goods to her customers.

Luz is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group. She and the four other members of her group will receive shares of this $1,000 loan to develop their small businesses. They have gone through business traning together and have proved to have good ability and commitment to conducting their work and supporting their family. They will make each repayment together and investors in this business will receive an update on not only the progress of Luz, but that of her group as well.

loans.use: Replenish inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase 2 blowdryers and one hair dryer and improve her salon

loans.name: Ann Muthoni

texts.en:
Anne Muthoni is a 38-year-old married woman and she is blessed with two children. She lives in Ruai town in the outskirts of Nairobi city. Anne started her business in the year 2005 after staying at home for a long time as a housewife. She detested this condition and she candidly explained how she would depend on her husband for entirely everything, including money to buy sanitary towels, which she hated.

One day in the year 2005 Anne borrowed Ksh 5000 (USD 75) from her husband to enable her to start selling cereals. Her husband was more than willing to give her the money, which she used to rent a stall in Ruai town. From the remainder, she bought stock of a variety of cereals, including beans, maize, green grams and rice. From here she started off her business, and it has been in operation ever since. Her business has continued to grow and has enabled Anne Muthoni to take her children to better schools. The income has enabled her to give her family a decent life. Her business also helped to restore her dignity, and she is therefore happy with herself.

Anne now intends to expand her business and is therefore making a request for a loan of $750. With the loan, Anne will purchase a weighing machine, sieving wire mesh, and a variety of cereals to stock her business. Some of the cereals she intends to purchase include a variety beans, maize, rice, flour, green peas, green grams and chicken feed. For Anne, this will translate into higher income, and she will be able to support her family, and particularly to meet her personal needs. She also hopes that soon she will employ a helper and in so doing, will create employment opportunity for at least one person in her community.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cereals including beans, maize, green grams and chicken feed

loans.name: Loas

texts.en: Mrs. Loas K., age 29, sells clothes in the market, earning about $5 per day in revenue. Her husband works as a moto-taxi driver, also earning about $5 per day. They have two children who are students. In order to meet her customers’ demands for more fashionable clothing, she would like to borrow $300 to increase her inventory. This will increase her revenue in the long term and allow her to better finance her children’s education. Mrs. Loas K. was not home at the time this photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead on his moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Tuti

texts.ru:
Tuti H. has been a business woman for over 7 years, and her business is the main source of income for her family. In her family, 5 people do not work and depend on her income (husband, son, son's wife and 2 grandchildren). Tuti needs financial assistance because she wants to purchase shoes wholesale for her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Хаитова Тути занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 7 лет и ее бизнес является основным источником доходов в семье. В семье имеет 5 иждивенца (невестка, 2 внука, муж и сын). На данный момент она нуждается финансовой поддержке и хочет оптом приобрести товар у оптовиков по низкой цене.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of shoes

loans.name: Natalia Maria

texts.es:
Natalia Maria is 46 years old and completed some of her education. She has 5 children but only 2 of them still depend on her. They live in the district of Moche in the Trujillo province. Natalia has a business from her home, preparing and selling breakfasts and set lunches, as well as sodas and beers. She began by selling typical potato dishes, but her clients suggested she add other items to the menu. She is part of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante, (always forward), from whom she received her first loan to set up a small kitchen where she could prepare and serve her meals. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will fix her refrigerator, and buy 3 tables and chairs to improve her business. Her dream is to modernize her restaurant.

La señora Natalia María tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta el segundo año de secundaria. Tiene 5 hijos pero solo dos dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. La señora Natalia tiene su negocio instalado en su domicilio, prepara desayunos, almuerzos (menú), vende cerveza y bebidas gaseosas. Ella se inició vendiendo papa a la huancaína (comida típica) pero sus propios clientes le sugirieron que preparará otros platos y así empezó a variar el menú. La señora Natalia ingresa al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” invitada por una vecina en este grupo obtiene su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles con los cuales compró una cocina pequeña y platos. Con este préstamo de S/.1,300.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, arreglará su refrigeradora y comprará tres mesas y banquitos (asientos) para mejorar su negocio. La señora Natalia sueña con modernizar su restaurante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TABLES AND CHAIRS FOR THE SMALL RESTAURANT SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME, AS WELL AS REPAIR HER REFRIGERATOR.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Mrs. Beatriz belongs to the “Nuestro Senor de Martha” Comunal Bank. She dedicates herself to the sale of clothes of all qualities in the back alley of “Huaylas,” Huaraz district, Huaraz province, Ancash region. Beatriz makes the most of the patron saint festivals in the different districts of the region in order to sell her products. With this loan of 1,700.00 soles, which she will pay back in 8 installments, she will buy 2 dozen wool pants, 2 dozen ensembles of cotton for children, 2 dozen wool sweaters for women and men, 3 dozen shirts and 3 dozen jackets for women and men. Beatriz is married and doesn’t have any children (the past year she was expecting but she miscarried.) Her husband is a driver and owner of a truck. Both are saving for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Beatriz pertenece al banco comunal Nuestro Señor de Martha. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de toda calidad en el callejón de Huaylas, distrito Huaraz, provincia Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Beatriz aprovecha las fiestas patronales en los diferentes distritos de la región para vender sus productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 8 cuotas comprará 2 docenas de pantalones de lana, 2 docenas de conjunto de algodón para niñas y niños, 2 docenas de chompas de lana para damas y caballeros, 3 docenas de poleras y 3 docenas de casacas para damas y caballeros. Beatriz es casada y no tiene hijos (el año pasado estuvo esperando un bebe y al nacer falleció). Su esposo es chofer y dueño de una camioneta tipo combi. Ambos están ahorrando para el futuro.

loans.use: To purchase clothes (wool pants, sweaters, jackets, etc.)

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali G. is 32 years old, is married and has two children. He lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Ali has his own sweet shop and bakery. He started his business two years ago. He has two employees. He decided to apply for a KIVA loan in amount of $725 from the Normicro Beylagan Branch. He plans to purchase new equipment for cooking sweets.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment for his bakery

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana M. is an exemplary, hard-working young woman from the city of Saltillo, Coahuila. Owing to the precarious economic situation in which she was living, she and her sister had to start working when they were small, and as time went on they were successful. She now has a restaurant business, where 2 members of her families help her attend customers and do other chores.

Because of her efforts, Diana had some savings which she was going to use to remodel her commercial space, but her mother became ill and since there was not enough money for the hospitalization and medicines, Diana had to use her savings to take care of her mother.

Now she needs a loan of $1,125, which will be repaid in 6 month, to again take up her remodeling plans. With your contributions, Diana will be able to reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Diana M. una joven ejemplar y trabajadora de la ciudad de Saltillo, Coahuila debido a la precaria situación económica en la que vivía fue que ella y sus hermana estuvieron que empezar a trabajar desde muy pequeñas, con el paso del tiempo han prosperado y ella ahora tiene un negocio de venta de comida, donde 2 de miembros de su familia la ayudan en la atención y labores de este.

A base de esfuerzo Diana tenía algunos ahorros que destinaria a la remodelación de su local, pero su madre enfermo y al no contar con dinero suficiente para la hospitalización y medicamentos que necesitaba tuvo que emplear ese dinero en la atención de su madre.

Ahora requiere un crédito de US $1125 que pagara en 6 meses para retomar los planes de remodelación. Con tus contribuciones Diana podrá realizar sus metas.

loans.use: Remodel her restaurant.

loans.name: Tusekile

texts.en:
Mambo (hello) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Tusekile M.. She is married and has three children ages 13, 17, and 20. She has one dependent, a niece who lives with her.

In 2007, Tusekile established her liquor store business. Tusekile requires a loan to purchase a deep freezer to refrigerate beer and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals, but not to the sticks, although I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola, Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer to refrigerate beer and soda.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a business owner from the town of Novyi Rozdil in western Ukraine. She is married, and she has four children under the age of eleven. Mariya began selling clothing at the market about three years ago, and she currently has a nicely-arranged and well-designed kiosk where she sells a variety of women’s clothing. She has approximately $3,000 worth of inventory on hand, and she sells approximately $2,000 worth of clothing each month.

Unfortunately, one of Mariya’s children recently experienced some medical problems. As a result, the family had to pay rather significant medical bills, which ultimately depleted much of Mariya’s business' available cash. In order to purchase new inventory, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 Ukrainian Griven ($1,075). With the loan proceeds, she will be able to purchase summer clothing so that she will be prepared with inventory for the new season.

loans.use: To prepare for the upcoming season by purchasing summer inventory

loans.name: Chuichojojche Group

texts.es:
This group of women come from Chuichijojche, a community located in the high mountains of the Nahuala municipality, which is covered by plantations of corn, bean, wheat and potato. Nahuala is know for its winters, where heavy rain and thick clouds fall over the municipality.

The Chuichijojche group has been working together for five years. This creates a very special dynamic within the group, creates an environment of trust, and it also sees to it that the years don't pass in vain. You notice this trust in the cheerfulness of the group at the repayment meetings. This positive feeling which is abundant in this group is based in the most essential foundation - the responsibility. This group has been able to stay together for such a long time because they are responsible women who pay on time.

All of the group members sell traditional Guatemalan dresses. They sell fabrics, long skirts, traditional hand-woven and embroidered blouses and hipbelts. The women sell their goods at the main markets of the plain, such as Solola, Xela and Totonicapán. They already have regular buyers. A few of them work as street traders or tend to clients in their homes. The women not only have assigned buyers, but also have craftspeople who sew for them on demand. Many of them also already have a group of craftswomen they buy from directly.

The group members believe that the credit has supported them because they can purchase more typical clothing wholesale and thereby increase their profit. They all think that without the loan they wouldn't be able to get ahead. Because of this they are excited about breaking the taboo of coming together for a group loan.

The biggest challenge facing this group of women is coping with both their businesses and also their domestic chores. Many say that looking after their children and husbands and also keeping up with the housework is an additional job.

The Chuichijojche group is a cheerful and united group. They have already made a lot of progress over the last five years and it's because of this that we should support them so that they can continue fighting.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

P>El reto más grande para este grupo de mujeres es el de lidiar con sus negocios y los quehaceres de la casa. Muchas argumentan que atender a los niños y al esposo y tener la casa ordenada es un trabajo aparte.

El grupo Chuichijojche es un grupo alegre y unido, ellas ya han venido saliendo adelante desde hace cinco años es por eso que nosotros las deberíamos de apoyar para que así puedan seguir luchando.

Este gran grupo de mujeres provienen de Chuichijojche, una comunidad ubicada en las altas montañas del municipio de Nahuala, donde las lomas están cubiertas por plantaciones de maíz, fríjol, trigo y papa. Nahuala es conocida por sus inviernos, donde fuertes lluvias y densas neblinas recaen sobre dicho municipio.

El grupo Chuichijojche ha venido trabajando junto desde hace cinco años. Esto crea una dinámica muy especial dentro del grupo, crea un ambiente de confianza, esto se debe a que los años no pasan en vano. Esta confianza se hace notar cuando las integrantes del grupo se ríen constantemente durante las reuniones de repago. Este sentimiento positivo que abunda en este grupo yace en la base más ensencial, la responsabilidad. Este grupo a podido permanecer tanto tiempo juntas porque son mujeres responsables que pagan puntualmente.

Todas las integrantes de este grupo son vendedoras de trajes típicos de Guatemala. Ellas venden cortes, faldas largas, huipiles, blusas tejidas a mano y bordadas, rebosos y fajas. Las señoras salen a los mercados principales del altiplano, tales como Solola, Xela, Totonicapán a vender. Ellas ya tienen sus compradores listos, muy pocas son las que venden de manera ambulante o que esperan a los compradores dentro de sus casas. Las señoras no solo tienen su compradores asignados, pero también tienen las artesanas que les tejen a su disposición. Muchas, ya tienen un grupo de artesanas que les compran directamente.

Las integrantes del grupo creen que el crédito las ha ayudado porque ellas pueden comprar más ropa típica al por mayor y así incrementar las ganancias. Todas piensan que sin el préstamo ellas no podrían salir adelante. Es por eso que ellas se animaron a romper el taboo de unirse a un grupo de créditos.

El reto más grande para este grupo de mujeres es el de lidiar con sus negocios y los quehaceres de la casa. Muchas argumentan que atender a los niños y al esposo y tener la casa ordenada es un trabajo aparte.

El grupo Chuichijojche es un grupo alegre y unido, ellas ya han venido saliendo adelante desde hace cinco años es por eso que nosotros las deberíamos de apoyar para que así puedan seguir luchando.

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing.

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
This young Ziguinchor woman is a highly reputed dressmaker. She is requesting this loan to purchase sewing materials and fabric to prepare her ready to wear apparel. The demand for her products is strong during summer vacation in Senegal.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

Cette jeune ziguinchoroise est une coutriére trés réputée. Elle demande ce financement pour acheter de la mercerie et des tissus afin de confectionner des prêts-à-porter. La demande est forte avec la période des grandes vacances au Sénégal

loans.use: Expand dressmaking activities

loans.name: Paen

texts.en: Mrs. Paen C. is a villager in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province. She is 39 years old and married without any children. She and her husband, Mr. Bo Virak, are fishermen who catch fish, but only small numbers because they do not have enough equipment. Additionally, Mrs. Paen C.'s boat does not have an engine, making it difficult for her to go fishing. In order to catch more fish and make the boat faster, Mrs. Paen C. asks for a loan to buy a boat engine. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a boat engine to gather more fish.

loans.name: Zuhura's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Zuhura J. is 21 years old and divorced with a 6-year-old child. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Zuhura now looking for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling firewood, coconuts and fish.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en: Mrs. Sita K. is a 42 years old woman that lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Her husband's name is Thulo Kancha, and his profession is farming. She has three sons all of which are engaged in raising cows for work. Mrs. Sita and her children have been selling cow’s milk for the past seven years. They are running their business under the bridge of Baghmati river. She already owns 18 cows and hopes to own more in the future. She has been selling cow’s milk in local neighborhoods. Cow’s milk has become a delicacy in Nepal so demand for milk is becoming increasing high. Her request for the first loan of $205.00 to buy medicine and food grains for the cows in order to keep her cows in good health.

loans.use: To buy medicine and food grains for cows

loans.name: Helida

texts.en:
Helida A. O., a 30-year-old resident of Rongo, Kenya, has operated a dressmaking business located on a side street off the main market for five years. The soft hum from four sewing machines fills the air of the shop, and the tin walls are hung with fashion patterns and a variety of colored cloth. Three other women also work in the shop – Helida is currently training two of them.

Her enterprise is doing well, and twice a month she travels to Nairobi, which is about six to eight hours by bus, to purchase the cloth and materials she needs.

Helida is requesting a loan to purchase two more sewing machines, thereby increasing her total to six, as well as sewing supplies. In the future, she hopes to move to a bigger building in order to keep up with the expansion of her business and the demands of her customers.

Helida, married with three children, also supports two orphans and her grandmother. She uses the profits from her business to pay for school fees and living expenses. Helida is a dedicated businesswoman committed to the continual expansion of her dressmaking shop.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines and sewing materials

loans.name: Naseem M. Latif Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is a 51 year old woman that resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 30 years. Her husband, M. L., runs a grocery shop in the community. She is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Naseem baji buys quilts from a famous city named Multan and resells them to different shops in Lahore. She has 20 years of experience in this business and works to meet the financial expenses of her household. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a loan to buy more quilts in order to expand the business.

She is a group leader of a few more women in her locality. Mahmooda baji is requesting a loan to buy chips for resale. Khalida parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy materials (clothes, colored thread and sketches) to embroider clothing for display in her boutique. Razia baji is requesting a loan to buy scissors and tools for her barber salon. Munawar baji is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics for her parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy more quilts for resale

loans.name: Salehe

texts.en: Salehe R.  is a Tanzanian businessman. He runs a café in the Vingunguti area outside Dar es Salaam city shopping center. He has been in the business for more than four years now. He requests a loan of Tshs 1,200,000/= to expand the business so as to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to boost his business

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mom Soeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 18 members, is located in Kokor Pir village in Kampong Cham province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Srey Mom S. is the village bank president. She was selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand by purchasing more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Mr. Heng Hay, is a coconut seller. Mrs. Srey Mom S. is a 38-year-old mother of a child who is too young to work or study.   

Nine members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo Z. est une jeune femme de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient depuis quelques années au marché d’Avetonou, une baraque dans laquelle elle étale divers produits. Pour mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, et gagner plus d’argent, Adzo souhaite avec ce crédit approvisionner sa baraque
texts.en:
Adzo Z. is a young woman, 43 years of age, married, and the mother of two. For a few years now at the Avetonou market, she has had a stall in which she displays various goods. To do better in responding to customer demands, and to earn more money, she would like to use this loan to supply her stall.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Señora María Isabel Martínez M. tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña María tiene dos hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de electrodoméstico. Hace mas de siete años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio vendiendo granos básicos pero con este negocio no logro mucho ingresos por lo que decide establecerse con la venta de electrodomésticos además enfrenta su mayor desafío como lo es la competencia  ya que necesita invertir una gran cantidad con el objetivo de obtener la mejor calidad en productos. Los propósitos de Doña María son de obtener otro establecimiento por que así conseguiría más ingresos. Sus deseos son que su negocio logre prevalecer a pesar de la difícil situación económica. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 14.900 cordobas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Isabel M. M. is 52 years old and is married. Mrs. Maria has two children who study. Her economic activity is selling household appliances. For more than seven years she has worked on this business, having started selling basic grains, but because that business didn't leave her much profit, she decided to establish herself selling household appliances. In addition, she faces her greatest challenge which is competition, and she needs to invest a great quantity with the goal of obtaining a better quality of product. Mrs. Maria's goals are to obtain a new locale because that would increase her profits. Her wish is that her business is able to prevail in spite of the difficult economic situation. The quantity she requests is C$ 14.900 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Ccechcca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca pertenece al Proyecto Wari, las socias son D. la comunidad D. Tambillo que se ubica a una hora D. la ciudad D. ayacucho, las principales actividades D. la comunidad son la agricultura y  la crianza D. animales.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, animales, carne, abarrotes en general, comida, panes y la agricultura.

Como es el caso D. Victoria que es casada, tiene 4 hijos, Victoria tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, en su banco aprendió mucho a través D. las capacitaciones que recibió, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. mas mercadería para surtir mas su negocio. El sueño D. Victoria es tener una tienda mayorista y ser feliz con su familia.

Por otro lado Yolanda es casada, tiene 2 hijos D. 16, 10 años, Yolanda venD. comida en su casa, Yolanda inicio poco a poco, su préstamo será invertido en comprar arroz, azúcar por sacos, los sueños D. Yolanda son tener un restaurante, tener mas clientes y ahorrar para los estudios D. sus hijos..

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 500 soles, 900soles, haciendo un total D. 4,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra trigo, cebada, maíz, animales menores, azúcar, arroz.
texts.en:
The Santa Cruz D. Ccechcca community bank is a part of the Wari Project. The members are from the community of Tambillo, which is located an hour from the city of Ayacucho, Peru. The main activities in the community are agriculture and raising livestock. The members carry out different businesses such as selling grains, animals, meat, general groceries, food, bread and agriculture.

This is the case of Victoria, who is married and has four children. She runs a small shop out of her home selling groceries. At the bank, she learned a lot through the training she received. Her loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to better stock her business. The dream of Victoria is to have a wholesale store and be happy with her family.

Another member is Yolanda, who is married and has two children, ages 16 and 10. Yolanda sells food out of her home .She started little by little, and her loan will be used to purchase rice and sugar by the sack. Yolanda's dreams are to have a restaurant, have more clients and save for her children's education.

The members need different amounts of the loan, such as 200 soles, 500 soles, 900 soles, for a total of 4,800 soles for the community bank. The loans will be invested in the purchase of things like wheat, barley, corn, small animals, sugar and rice.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items like wheat, barley, corn, small animals, sugar and rice for the members' various businesses.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi A. works as a trader in Siwdo, selling goods such as yams, tea and bread. She has three children and has been employed as a trader for four years. Asi uses her income to pay for the expenses of her family, such as providing proper food and nutrition for her children. She will use this loan to purchase additional goods for resale. Asi plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: Vor

texts.en: Vor S. is married and lives with her young child in Kampong Cham province. She cooks food for garment workers and earns approximately US$2.50 each day, and her husband works in construction. Vor S. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction materials and cement mixer for her husband. She believes that these purchases will allow them to increase their income and be able to better support their large family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana K. is fifty-six years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children, four sons and one daughter. According to her, one of her children is in the university while the others are in senior high and junior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Susana is a petty trader. She trades in charcoal and also sells provisions on a table top. She supplies the charcoal to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to sell in other towns. Susana procures charcoal from nearby communities. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure charcoal and provisions in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
la sra. Elsa Marina R. tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, que dependen de ella al 100%.
uno de ellos esta en la escuela y la otra en el colegio.
Elsa se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, almuerzos, desayunos, baleadas, chicharras, pan con frijoles, burritas de carne, pollo frito etc. tiene 05 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual le genera ingresos para mantener su familia.
Elsa necesita el prestamo para comprar pollo ,carne de res,frescos,arroz, frijoles, aceite, verduras para preparar sus comidas, ya que ahora tiene mucha demanda y no le ajustan las comidas que prepara.
su sueño es tener un restaurante completo para poder atender bien a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina R., 40, is a single mother with two dependent children. One goes to elementary school, and the other one goes to high school. She sells sweets and food such as tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, lunches, breakfasts, baleadas (Honduran tortillas filled with mashed, fried beans and other ingredients), chicharras (fried pork rinds), bread with beans, meat burritos, fried chicken, etc. She has been in this business, which generates income to support her family, for five years. She needs a loan to buy chicken, beef, soft drinks, beans, oil, and vegetables to prepare her meals. She does not have enough food to meet the current demand. Her dream is to have a full restaurant to be able to giver her customers good service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tortillas, soft drinks, vegetables, pastas, salsas, chicken, pork, beef, cabbage, fried pork rinds, lemons, spices, salt, oil, shortening, beans, bread

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
27-year-old farmer, Annie G. Ompod wishes to improve the quality of her harvest. She and her husband have been tilling for a very long time already and they both want to make their farm more productive to increase their family income. Currently, they are tilling a 1-hectare farm that they inherited from their parents. They want to buy another hectare of land in the future.

Because they are needing additional capital to run their business, Annie G. applied for a loan worth Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy certified seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that this move will help improve their harvest.

CEVI helps small business grow. According to Annie G., she received not just loans but insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and certified seeds

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar T. lives with his wife and two teenage children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His two children stay with their grandmother in Nalaih, a nearby town, where they both go to a local high school.

Batbaatar had worked for a local police station as a police officer for many years. He has recently quit his job due to poor salary and now drives a cab in the city. His wife also helps in his cab business.

Their living conditions are not very good; thus, Batbaatar decided to send his two children to their grandmother until he gets his old house renovated. He says that he works hard to renovate his old house. Once the house renovation is done, he is looking forward to bringing back his children and living with them together.

Batbaatar requests a loan to repair his car for his taxi business and the rest of the loan will be used to purchase a computer.

loans.use: To repair his car for his taxi business and to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bedsheets and resell them to different customers

loans.name: Diana Fernanda

texts.es:
Diana vive en Cuenca  en el centro de la ciudad; tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y este año ingresa al primer año de Psicología Clínica en la Universidad Estatal de Cuenca, vive en casa de sus padres por lo que aun es dependiente de ellos, su casa es propia.

Diana trabaja vendiendo productos Herbalife (son productos de medicina natural) algún tiempo ya  y le va muy bien, tiene muchos clientes, nos dice.

Es su tercer ciclo trabajando con la fundación y le ha sido de mucha ayuda por lo que le han permitido emprender con un negocio productivo y así empezar a independizarse y valerse por si misma.

El préstamo que realiza en la fundación lo va a invertir en la compra de  productos herbalife que le hacen falta e incrementar  un stock más surtido de estos productos naturales para sus clientes.

Su meta para el futuro es culminar los estudios para ser una profesional y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana is 21 years old, single, and lives in central Cuenca. She will be starting her first year at the State University of Cuenca, where she will be studying clinical psychology. She still lives at home with her parents because she is still financially dependent on them.

Diana has been selling Herbalife (natural medicines) for some time now and is doing very well. She tells us that she has many customers.

Diana is now working on her third loan cycle with the Foundation. The assistance she received enabled her to start her business so that she can become productive, independent, and self-reliant. She will use her loan to purchase more Herbalife products so that she can increase her inventory and provide her customers with a better selection.

Her goal for the future is to complete her studies so that she can become a professional and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of Herbalife products

loans.name: Seyamoy Group

texts.en: Seyamoy is the leader of this group, whose four members each want to take out a loan for improving and expanding their business; They are requesting a group loan of 30000 Afghani. Seyamoy wants a loan for her tailoring business. Razya wants a loan for her bakery. Nasreyn wants a loan for her husband who has a fruit store. M. Hasham wants a loan for his medical business. They are very thankful to Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Isabel es soltera, tiene 35 años y 1 hija, Isabel vende cosméticos por catalogo que ofrece a amigos y familiares, además vende lencería que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lencería.
Isabel sueña con ampliar su negocio, tener otros negocios y una tienda grande.

loans.use: Para la compra de lencería.

loans.name: Hogla

texts.es:
Hogla es socia del Bancomunal Avancemos Juntos, es conviviente, tiene 40 años y dos hijos de 13 y 9  años, que esta estudiando en al escuela estatal.
Hogla es de la ciudad de Pucallpa el oriente del Perú,  desde que llegó a Lima se puso a trabajar en las ventas ayudando a una amiga a vender productos de belleza por catalogo y vio que resultaba, se inscribió como vendedor, le iba bien con las ventas, la empresa vio como sus ventas crecían y que era buena pagadora y fue promovida como líder de ventas, Hogla ahora maneja un grupo de vendedoras.
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para la compra de cosméticos. 
En Finca Perú ella prendió a ser puntual y a apoyarse entre compañeras, 
El sueño de Hogla es tener una casa en un lugar más accesible a una avenida, por que  ella vive en la última casa del cerro.
texts.en:
Hogla is a member of the Avancemos Juntos Communal Bank. She is 40, has a life partner, and has two children. The children, 13 and 19, attend the state school. Hogla is from the city of Pucallpa in eastern Perú. Since she arrived in Lima she started working in sales. She was helping a friend sell beauty products by catalog. She saw the results, and she signed up as a sales person. Sales went very well for her. The company saw how her sales grew and that she was a good payer. She was promoted to leader of sales. Hogla now manages a group of sellers. She needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy cosmetics. In Finca Perú she learned to be punctual and to be supportive among colleagues. Hogla’s dream is to have a house in a place that is more accessible to a street because she lives in the last house on the hill.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics

loans.name: Carmen Alvarado

texts.en:
Carmen has a stall in the El Bisne Market in Chinandega. Since Carmen sells meat to her customers, her stall or “tramo” is located near all the other meat sellers. Carmen is requesting a loan to buy a cow that she will butcher. After she butchers the animals, she sells the meat by the pound. She has been working in her meat stall for the past 6 years.

Before she began selling meat, Carmen had many other jobs, but she was always working for someone else. Now with the loans she has her own business which allows her to support herself and offer quality services to her customers.

loans.use: To buy a cow to butcher

loans.name: Santa Ines Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Ines está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Ines Asunción A.  quien cultiva una pequeña parcela de tierra con maíz, frijoles, hortalizas y cítricos como naranjas. Ella aprendió  este oficio desde niña ya que sus padres también eran agricultores. 

De la misma manera sus compañeras  Gloria Elena G. M., Filomena Susana R. S. y Olga del Socorro G.  R.  cultivan la tierra que les vio nacer y crecer. Garcia cultiva maíz, trigo y frijoles, R.  cosecha cítricos como mandarinas, naranjas y limones y G.  R.  cultiva jocotes una fruta de gran de manda en Nicaragua especialmente en semana santa, esta se come generalmente con sal y vinagre  o se hace en almíbar.
texts.en:
The Santa Ines group includes four hard-working women. One of them is Ines Asunción A., who grows corn, beans, vegetables, and oranges on a small parcel of land. She learned how to do this when she was a child since her parents were also farmers.

In the same way, her friends Gloria Elena G. M., Filomena Susana R. S., and Olga del Socorro G. R. cultivate the land where they were born and grew up. Ms. G. grows corn, wheat, and beans. Ms. R. harvests citrus fruits like mandarin oranges, oranges, and lemons. Ms. G. R. grows jocotes, a kind of plum which is in high demand in Nicaragua, especially during Holy Week. It is generally eaten with salt and vinegar, or made into syrup.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and better seeds

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 40 years old and married with four children. She has a boutique where she sells clothes and shoes, and she's been in business for three years. She requested this loan of 20,000 KES to buy more stock. 

She describes herself as determined and hardworking and her hope is simply to have a stable family. She says that in Faulu (one of Kiva's field partners) she has learned to keep business records, and in the future she would like to be operating a well-established company.

loans.use: buy more inventory for boutique

loans.name: Chhoeut

texts.en:
Chhoeut L. is a 22-year-old resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Chhoeut L. is married with three young children, who are students and dependent on her income. Her husband has been running a taxi service. 

To earn a living, Chhoeut L. gets small pieces of clothing from a garment factory and prepares them as sets for a fee. The cloth is used for turning into furnishings. Chhoeut L. dreams of owning a machine which will allow her to sew cloth for other furnishings to sell. That is why she has requested a loan of $500 to buy a sewing machine. This will help her to increase her income to make sure that her family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta F., 47 years old, manages a small hectare (2.5 acres) of rice farm in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She was happy the last time she harvested her rice farm, because she was able to have a bountiful yield. Currently, she is busy preparing the soil.

Marieta is hoping to receive a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crops well.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through junior high.  Mary sells raw corn and onions at Elmina, which she has been doing since 2003. Her husband is a fisherman.  Mary uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more corn, onions and other food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save to invest in her business and in her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more corn, onions and other food supplies for resale.

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a teenage son, Sergey. She is an entrepreneur from the town of Vodyanoye, where she grows vegetables in greenhouses. Olesya grows early spring tomatoes, radishes and greens for further sale at the markets in her region. Olesya has been in this farming business for twelve years. She has 50,000 UAH invested in her venture. Olesya spends about 20,000-25,000 UAH on seeds and plastic film annually. 

Olesya is seeking a 10,000 UAH loan to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who strives to see her business grow and expand. Olesya has two bigger and two smaller well-equipped greenhouses with drip systems. This business is very profitable for this agricultural region.   

Note: In the photo Olesya is with her husband in front of their greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase 3 rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Corn farming and hog raising are the businesses of Editha. She is 61 years old and is from Surallah, South Cotabato. She's the mother of seven children. She owns two hectares of corn field and one pig. Her business runs smoothly, especially when it's raining. She meets all her needs from her farm business.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase feed and farm supplies. This way she can help provide the needs of her family.

loans.use: feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis S. V., tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos de 22,18 y 9 años de edad, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jorge Luis también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jorge is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children, ages 22, 18, and 9. They are his top priority. He is asking for this loan in order to maintain his fields, specifically for growing coffee. He wants to buy fertilizers. He wants to adequately maintain the coffee crop in order to produce a better quality and be able to get the best price come harvest time. This will be his first loan thorough FEDECOSUR and he is very grateful for their help. Jose has been farming for a number of years. He hopes for a brighter future for his family, for a better quality of life, and to be able to continue to develop as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Javier Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Javier, es un cliente nuevo en el crédito. Aunque se considera antiguo, puesto que su esposa la Sra. Lidia trabajo con Emprender desde el año 2004 al 2007, con crédito en grupo y tambien individualmente, el es transportista de la linea de trufis (servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros), que hace el recorrido desde el centro de la ciudad hacia la zona sur, razón por la cual él figura como titular, ya que tiene mayor accecibilidad a la oficina de Chasquipampa, la esposa tiene un puesto de venta de api y pasteles en la zona de Alto Obrajes, ellos tienen una familia compuesta por dos hijos que estudian en nivel secundario y una niña que tiene un año aproximadamente, y el cuidado de ella lo realiza la señora, es una pareja joven con muchos proyectos e superación, ademas de ser muy responsables. Con el dinero del credito comprara llantas nuevas para su movilidad, Uno de sus deseos es de comprarse una casita. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Although Javier is new client of the loan program, he has been involved for a long time, since he wife Lidia worked with Emprender from 2004 to 2007, receiving group as well as individual loans. He is a minibus operator for the public transportation system, driving from the city center to the southern region, which is a steady job with good access to the Chasquipama office. His wife has a kiosk where she sells api (a corn drink) and cakes in the Alto Obrajes area. They have two children in high school and a one-year-old daughter, who Lidia cares for. They are a young couple with many projects and lots of motivation, in addition to being very responsible. With the money from the loan they will purchase new tires for their vehicle. One of their dreams is to buy a small house. Javier is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence demonstrated by the loan offer.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tires

loans.name: Lesi

texts.en:
Lesi F. is 40 and single with no children.  He owns a business venture, providing clothing alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Lesi has 4 years of experience in this business.  Lesi needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase new sewing machine.  He plans to use the earnings from his business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Lesi joined SPBD.    This is his 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Lesi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz lives in the mid-sized city of Riwind in Pakistan. Riwind is famous for its dairy business. Kaniz is a seamstress and has been in this profession for the last five years. She is an expert in her profession and can stitch designer and non-designer clothes easily. She receives orders from her neighbors and relatives. She has set charges for the stitching and charges Pak Rs. 100 for simple dresses and Pak Rs. 150 for designer clothes. Her earnings allow her to pay the family's utility expenses. 

Her husband, A. R., is a motor mechanic and runs a motor workshop in the main market. He has eight years of experience in this profession and can repair all types of vehicles. 

Kaniz is a regular client of Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. She has successfully repaid three loans to Asasah and now is applying again for a loan to purchase the repairing tools for her husband’s motor workshop.

loans.use: To purchase repair tools for the motor workshop

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en: Herminio Y., 45 years old, is a farmer. He has a 1-hectare farm, which he has tilled for quite a long time now. He has six children. His eldest child is aged 21. As a father, he wants to provide his family with everything they need. He also dreams of growing his harvest to increase their income. He is requesting a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to buy farm supplies. He said, “What I could say about CEVI is that they have a very good program because it really helps the poor in their livelihood”.

loans.use: To buy farm Supplies

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
Siah S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Great. She is 39 years old, single and has three children who range from 5 to 18 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 20 years, Siah has been selling rice and cooking oil at the Jallah Town Market, Capitol Hill, Monrovia, Liberia. She sells in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rice and cooking oil. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future. She describes herself as patient and easy going.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Siah is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.es:
La señora Stephanie vive con su esposo e hijo en anticretico, en la zona Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Stephanie es estudiante y hace labores de casa
El crédito solicitado es para seguir estudiando, y de esta manera poder conseguir un trabajo y ayudar a su esposo.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Stephanie lives with her husband and son in a rented home in the Cota Cota neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is a student and also does the household work. The loan she requests is for her educational expenses, so that she can get a job and help her husband. This is the second time that she has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis conducted by this institution qualified her to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the cost of matriculating in the university so that she can finish her education and get a job.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is from Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years of age and a widow. (Her husband passed away in April, 2010.)  She has four children, three of whom are working and one is still in college. Elizabeth has an eatery in her house which is near a college. She also earns income from renting rooms and has some support from her working son and daughters. Elizabeth has been engaged in this kind of business for 13 years already and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her eatery and room rentals.

In February 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to add to her business capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, savings for future use, and for future business expansion.
 
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya C. is 56 years old and is a villager who lives in Srae Kruo village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from farming she is also a home pig breeder, which helps earn a small income to help support her family. In order to support the rice farming business, Mrs. Ya C. requests a loan to buy two oxen. Mrs. Ya C. is widow with two children who are seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy two oxen.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira A. is from Ambalatungan Santiago City. She is 39 years old. Elvira is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle used in business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the repair and maintenance of the vehicle used in business

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.es:
La señora Eustaquia C. Fernández vive con su hija Teresa Miranda Caraballo que tiene 30 años de edad en Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Alto San Isidro hacia el norte, La señora tiene 58 años de edad es viuda hace un año atrás, de tal modo se quedo sola con su única hija.

La señora Eustaquia y su hija Se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca y papaliza aparte de realizar el cuidado de sus animales; La señora Eustaquia y su hija se apersono a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) mas compra de productos agroquímicos, que nos comenta con este crédito salir adelante mejorando su producción agrícola sembrar en mas superficies y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eustaquia C. Fernández, 58, lives with her daughter, Teresa Miranda Caraballo, 30, in Colomi Segunda Candelaria sindicato Alto San Isidro, towards the north. She was widowed a year ago so is now alone with her only daughter. Eustaquia and her daughter farm potatoes, broad beans, oca and papalisa (Andean tubers) and care for their farm animals. Eustaquia and her daughter came in person to our offices to request funds to buy chicken manure and other chemical farm supplies. She commented that with this loan she intends to improve her farm production and plant larger surface areas thus improving her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Mh 6 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group MH 6. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her mother. She says that her most difficult challenge is to keep working because her family still needs her.  In her free time, she enjoys attending church.  Juana is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and growing her business. She started her business three years ago.  She will use this loan to grow her business and stock more cosmetics, beauty products, and underwear. She will use the profits to help her mother and to improve their home.
 
Juana chose to work with Esperanza due to good loan terms offered.  Her story is representative of others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general.  Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, beauty products, and underwear for selling.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marlon Antonio A. J., es un joven de 29 años casado con dos niños de 9 y 5 añitos, ellos habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, su esposa se dedica a las actividades domesticas, el señor es asalariado y es la fuente de los ingresos de la familia, ellos habitan en una humilde morada, que con las fuertes lluvias de invierno le ha deteriorado aun mas su vivienda, fue con el apoyo de su esposa y el esfuerzo propio que lograron la construcción de su casita, pero ahora solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para la remodelación del baño y la sala, este apoyo les brindara un espacio mas salubre y comodidades, sobre todo para el señor A. de beneficiar a su familia con un ambiente digna  a desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon Antonio A. J. is a Young 29-year-old man. He’s married and has two children who are 9 and 5 years of age. They live in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla. His wife is a housewife and he is a salaried employee and the main source of family income. They live in a humble home which has deteriorated even more due to winter rains. He had managed to build his house with his own efforts and help from his wife but now needs a loan to buy building materials and supplies to remodel the bathroom and living room.
