This help will provide more sanitary and comfortable spaces, especially because Mr. A. so wants to provide a proper home for his family to develop in.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For bathroom and living room remodel.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey P., who lives in Prambei Mom village in Takeo province, was born in 1945. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory. Srey is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Tob, is a cattle middleman who is able to earn a large amount to support his family.

Since her husband’s business is going well, Srey wants to try to expand. She would like a loan to buy three more cows to sell.

loans.use: To buy three cows

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in Bwaise, a neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, two of whom are in school.  Harriet has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothing materials and threads. She also generates additional income through selling second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include transportation, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and also educate her children up to university. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and threads.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M. is from the city of Sta.Cruz Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Letecia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40000 PHP from GDMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP that will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Letecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Catarino

texts.es: Catarino M. R. de 60 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar. Catarino posee un pick up, en el cual se dedica  a hacer viajes a diferentes partes del departamento de La Libertad, mismo lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa. Él transporta frutas, muebles, personas y todo lo que se le solicita, la zona en la cual él se colocada a diario es muy buena ya que es cerca de un mercado, en el hay una gran fuente de trabajo para él. Catarino solicita un préstamo con el enorme deseo de poder brindarle mantenimiento al pick up y de esta forma brindar un servicio más seguro y de esta forma contar con más trabajo para sostener su hogar.
texts.en: Catarino M. R. is 60 years old.  He lives in La Libertad department with his wife who takes care of the housework.  Catarino has a pick up truck in which he makes journeys to different parts of La Libertad department.  He transports fruit, furniture, people and anything else which he is asked to.  The area in which he is based every day is very good since it is close to a market where there is a great source of work for him.  Catarino is requesting a loan as he really wishes to have  maintenance work done on his pick up.  He hopes that he will thereby be able to provide a safer service and have more work to support his household.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay for maintenance to his pick up truck

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 48 years old. Gelinda is married and has 2 children, aged 24 and 21. To make a living, Gelinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gelinda also raises pigs and manages a sari-sari store. She hopes to be able to sustain her businesses.

Gelinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gelinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Cesar Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 22 years old.  He lives in the town of Tambogrande.  Tambogrande is located in a more tropical region of northern Peru.  It is primarily populated by small farmers who raise animals and have fruit plantations. Raul lives with his parents, brothers and sisters.  He has no children and is unmarried.

Raul raises animals on a property near his parents home.  He has a herd of 12 sheep, as well as a number of pigs and turkeys.  Raul also works as a factory worker, earning 21 soles per day.  Between these income-earning activities, Raul is able to help support his family and earn funds for his future.

This will be Raul’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for his animals.  He hopes to be able to purchase balanced feed, which will accelerate and promote the proper growth of his animals so that he can sell them at the best price.  Raul is a very hard worker and is well respected in the community.  He is proud to support his family and earn his own living.

loans.use: To purchase feed for sheep, pigs and turkeys.

loans.name: Malka Irina

texts.es: Malka en Villa del Carmen tiene un negocio llamado Ferreterìa Malka, donde vende materiales para construcciòn,  bloques y calados fabricados en la misma ferreterìa, la cual iniciò 3 años atrás, en un local familiar y con lo producido por su negocio,  adquiriò el lote, construyò su vivienda y logrò ampliar el volumen de ventas, hasta generar cuatro empleos directos: dos bloqueros y dos transportadores. Malka  ademàs tiene ademàs dos carrertllas  que se encargan del domicilio, de los materiales para construcciòn que compran sus clientes. Su crediKiva es su primer financiamiento, con la fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, con èl comprarà cemento, arena, para la venta y elaboracion de bloques y calados que tiene encargados. Su negocio maneja ventas promedias de $220.000 COP diarios, un margen de ganacias del 10%. Malka es una emprendedora y valiente mujer  que  vive con un hijo menor de edad (5 años) y una sobrina,  ya que es madre jefe de familia, por eso su sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirla en la mejor ferreteria de su sector ,  pues quiere ayudar mucho en la superaciòn de su familia especialmente de su pequeño; aunque tiene un gran desafio pues en èpocas de lluvias se retrasan los pedidos no duda que vendran tiempos mejores  de prosperidad para su negocio y su familia.
texts.en: Malka has a business in Villa del Carmen called "Ferreteria Malka" (hardware store), she sells building materials, concrete blocks made at the store, which started three years ago as a family business selling what was produced, she bought the land, built a house and was able to increase sales volumes and create four job opportunities for two block makers and two handlers.  Malka also has 2 wheelbarrows that help transport the materials her clients buy.  This credit is her first loan with Kiva, through "fundacion Mario Santo Domingo", with it she will buy cement, sand and make blocks for pending orders.  Her business has daily average sales of $115 USD (220,000 Colombian pesos) with a gross margin of 10%.  Malka is a brave entrepreneur that lives with her five year old son and a niece, she is the head of the family and her dream is to expand the business until it becomes the best hardware store in the area, she wants to help her family get ahead, particularly her son, she has a big challenge ahead because during raining season orders get behind but she knows better times will come for her and her family.

loans.use: Buy cement and sand to make and sell concrete blocks.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “SANTO DOMINGO”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ricardo; El socio tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 4 años de edad; El socio se dedica  a la artesanía, le socio tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de artesanía en el centro comercial Inti Pakareq, el atiende su stand desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche de corrido, el socio se dedica  ala bisutería, el realiza trabajos en alpaca, y cordones de fantasía, el hare aretes y collares, también brazaletes. El socio requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como alambres de alpaca, hilos, alicates delgados, piedras de fantasía, pinis, cuarzos y otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.

Los otros socios se dedican a prestar servicio de moto taxi, artesanía, venta de ropa, librería, abarrotes, una de ellas es docente, otra socia se dedica a la atención de su restaurante pollería. 

El socio valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Santo Domingo"; The bank is located in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

One of the members is Ricardo; he is 44, has a partner and two children ages 15 and four; the member sells crafts at a stand in the shopping center Inti Pakareq, he works at the stand from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. with no break, the member works with beading and makes crafts in alpaca, jewelry strings, earrings and necklaces, as well as bracelets. 

The member requests a loan to buy materials such as alpaca, thread, plyers, beads, stones and others.  

The other members provide goods and services such as taxi, crafts, clothing, bookstore, groceries, one of them is a teacher and another one has a chicken restaurant.

The member values the loan and commits to make the payments according to the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: Invest in buying materials

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del Grupo Mujeres en Marcha, residen en la colonia Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de Danlí y son mujeres que se conocen muy bien entre si, cada una posee su propio negocio en el cual tienen buena experiencia en la administración de los mismos.
En la actualidad las Sras. Antes mencionadas no cuentan con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas sus negocios y necesitan un credito para salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Rosa Elena R. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales y hamburguesas.
Actividad que lleva a cabo los días jueves y viernes de todas las semanas, sus clientes son los empleados del aserradero en donde labora su esposo el cual esta ubicado en la ciudad de danlí.
Doña Rosa a sabido ganarse la clientela por la higiene, sabor y tamaño con que elabora sus nacatamales y hamburguesas.

la sra. Eda Ventura C. Zelaya se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de cosméticos y enchape de Oro, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace tres años y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, ya que la demanda del producto es muy buena y sus clientes día a día son mas.
Doña Eda anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de pulpería y a la vez a la venta de Cosméticos y Enchape de oro, pero se vio obligada a quitar el negocio de pulpería porque las ventas cada día iban bajando, además alquilaba local y casi no le dedicaba tiempo ya que era atendida por un familiar y mientras mas tiempo pasabas mas perdidas tenia.
La Sra. Cáceres, sale a vender su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes Barrios, Colonias y empleados de diferentes fábricas de tabacos.
se a sabido ganar los clientes por la amabilidad con que les atiende y por facilidades de pago que les brinda.

la sra, Blanca Lidia G. se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo.
Doña Blanca es una mujer que se a sabido ganarse los clientes por las facilidades de pago y por el buen producto que vende.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres en Marcha group live in the Nueva Esperanza development in the city of Danli. They are women who know each other very well. Each one has her own business and has good experience in running it.
These women do not currently have the sufficient working capital to stock their businesses more, and so they need a loan to get ahead. The following is a description of their different businesses:

Rosa Elena R. makes and sells nactamales and hamburgers on Thursdays and Fridays every week. Her customers are the employees of the sawmill where her husband works, which is located in Danli city. Rosa has gained customers for her food's cleanliness, flavour and portions.

Eda Ventura C. Zelaya is a merchant, and she mainly sells cosmetics and gold-plated jewelry. She has done this for three years, and it is notable that during this time she has managed it well because the demand for her products is very high and she has more customers every day.
Eda previously had a grocery store on top of her cosmetics and jewelry business, but she had to leave her grocery store because the sales were getting lower every day. Furthermore, she was renting the store and had almost no time for it; it was attended by a family member, and the more time that passed the more losses she had. Mrs C. goes out to sell her product door-to-door in different neighbourhoods and developments, and to employees of different tobacco factories. She has gained customers because of her kind service and the easy payment options she offers.

Mrs. Blanca Lidia G. sells clothing and new shoes. 
Blanca is a woman who has gained customers because of the ease of payment she offers, and because of the quality of her product.
She will use this loan for the purchase of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: the purchase of bread for hamburgers, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mustard, tomato sauce, ground beef, spices, condiments, salt, chicken, corn, banana leaves, vegetables, cosmetics and gold-plated jewelry, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Jocinter Auma

texts.en:
Jocinter Auma is a 32-year-old modest woman from Kisumu city and is married to Mike Juma, a businessman. They have three children aged 2, 5 and 12 years old.

Jocinter operates a baking business, preparing mandazi, a traditional donut-like breakfast food taken together with tea. She has been operating this business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. Jocinter is taking out her first loan, which she will use to purchase baking flour, cooking oil and other ingredients. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock and to provide for her family's basic needs. Jocinter's dream is to build her own residential house just to improve the family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy G. is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling as retail to his neighbours. Sammy's major challenge is the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sacks of sugar and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sacks of sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene  31 años, es casada y junto con su familia vive en la Comunidad de San Isidro de Chicon a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Urubamba, Cusco – Perú. En la comunidad de Chicon las personas se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura. Leonarda tiene pequeñas chacras donde siembra tubérculos, verduras y frutas, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros pequeños animales que sirven para el consumo de la familia o para vender. Leonarda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar comida para los animales como pastos y vitaminas. 

Leonarda pertenece al banco comunal “Los Dinámicos de San Isidro de Chicon” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 31 years old, married, and she lives together with her family in the community of San Isidro de Chicon, located 15 minutes from the city of Urubamba, in Cusco, Peru. In the community of Chicon the population is dedicated to farming and agriculture. Leonarda has some land where she grows tubers, vegetables and fruit. She also raises small livestock such as guinea pigs, poultry, pigs, and other small animals that are for the family's consumption or to sell. Leonarda requires this loan to purchase feed for her livestock, such as hay and vitamins.

Leonarda is a member of the communal bank named "Los Dinamicos de San Isidro de Chicon", in association with Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner). She is thankful for the opporutnity provide to her by this means and she is committed to making payments at the established times.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed such as hay and vitamins

location.town: San Isidro de Chicon- Urubamba - Cusco

loans.name: William

texts.en: 35 year-old M. William has had his retail shop for two years.  He sells soft drinks and other essential household commodities, like sugar, soap and bread. He operates this business in Kitale trading center-Mukono. Before he began this business, William, who is happily married with 4 kids, was running a pig husbandry business. He still runs this business, though he doesn't accord as much attention to it because he has someone else who tends to it. He also has a banana sales business.  Hardworking William says that his monthly income from the retail business generates shillings 650,000 as profit. With this loan, William says he is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es: Albertina tiene 43 años D. edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo mayor D. edad, Vive en casa propia en L. zona rural del distrito D. Morrope. Solo cuenta con el servicio D. luz, no D. agua. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado D. 50 familias. Albertina se dedica a L. venta D. chicha, una bebida típica D. Peru hecha D. harina D. maíz. Realiza esta actividad desD. hace 10 años en su propio domicilio. Aprendió L. actividad D. sus padres, es decir conoce a L. perfección el rubro. Cuenta con clienteL. ya establecida en su comunidad y sus alrededores. Su negocio muestra muy buena rentabilidad debido a que el costo D. producción es muy bajo. Adicionalmente al negocio D. chicha, cuenta con animales vacunos, caprinos, porcinos y aves D. corral que venD. a negociantes y al público en general para generar ingresos adicionales. Ha aumentado L. demanda para L. chicha en esta temporada D. verano. Albertina desea invertir en L. compra D. más insumos para aumentar su producción y sus ventas D. L. bebida. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles. Albertina es muy trabajadora y responsable. Ha manejado otros préstamos y demuestra puntualidad en cumplir con sus obligaciones. Posee un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Albertina is 43 years old, single, and has one grown-up child.  She lives in her own home in the rural part of Morrope district where she has access to electricity but not water.  Her community is small and consists of approximately 50 families.

Albertina's business is selling chicha, a traditional Peruvian drink maD. from corn flour.  She has been in this business for 10 years and works from her own home.  She learned the business from her parents which means that she knows the work perfectly.  Albertina has an established customer base in her own community and the surrounding area.  Her business is very profitable because her production costs are very low.

In addition to her chicha business, Albertina also owns cattle, goats, pigs and poultry which she sells to traders and to the general public in order to make additional income.  Demand for her chicha has increased during the summer season and Albertina would like to invest in buying more supplies in order to increase her production and sales of the drink.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Albertina is very hard working and responsible.  She has had previous loans and shown herself to be punctual in making her repayments.  She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha' (a traditional, corn-based drink)

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu M. is a 29-year-old business woman. She is married and has one girl child aged 9. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives and she opted to assist with their schooling. 

In 2004, Kadiatu established a local food business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and empowered to assist her husband in providing livelihood for their family. 

She opens her business six days a week and eight hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Kadiatu requires this loan in order to purchase local food for her business. "This loan will help boost my savings for my children's education," said Kadiatu. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy local food for her business

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en: Nicholus is 28 years old and single. He has been selling shoes for five years so as to earn a living. He has managed to sustain his business because of his hard work. He hopes to open other branches of his business in the future. Nicholus joined a group under Faulu Kenya to get financial support. This is because the group members guarantee each other loans. He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Sattor

texts.ru: Саттор проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него 7 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам он занимается растениеводством. Арендует участок земли, где сеет рис и выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 25 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Sattor lives in Shahrituz. He is 50 years old, married, and has seven children. His wife is a housewife, and his son is in the Russian Federation. He is a farmer. He rents a plot of land ground where he grows rice and vegetables for sale. He has been doing this for 25 years. He is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad, tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposo e hijos, contando con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Pacasmayo, que se encuentra a una hora aproximadamente del departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Luz es ha la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, aceite, azúcar, huevos, etc), su negocio está en su propio domicilio desde hace varios años, al encontrarse su negocio en su casa puede atender a cualquier hora, lo que le permite diferenciarse de otras tiendas y así pueda obtener más ingresos para sus  gastos personales.

El crédito solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual lo destinará para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos una vez que sus ventas aumenten.  El sueño de Luz es tener más adelante una tienda más grande que le genere mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y lo logrará con su trabajo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Luz is a 44-year-old mother.  She owns her house where she lives with her husband and children.  It has water and electricity and is located in Pacasmayo District which is about an hour from La Libertad Department.  This zone is farming, livestock raising and tourism area.

Luz’s activity is selling basic need items (rice, milk, oil, sugar, eggs, etc.).  Her store is located in her house and has been open for several years.  Since it’s located in her house she can tend to it at all hours which differentiates hers from other stores and she can obtain more income for her personal expenses.

She asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy larger amounts of merchandise to enlarge the store with other products once her sales increase.  Luz’s dream for later on is to have a larger store that generates larger income to improve her quality of life and she will accomplish this with her work and dedication.

loans.use: to enlarge her store and to buy stock items for it.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Teresa de Jesús de 68 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y prendas. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 30 años comenzó con la ayuda de la madrastra de su esposo y luego siguió por si sola con el cual saco adelante a sus cinco hijos.

Ella utilizará el crédito para la compra de mercadería nueva e invertir más en prendas de oro y plata. Su meta es llegar a trabajar sin necesidad del crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa de Jesús is 68 years old.  She sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and jewelry.  Teresa started her business more than 30 years ago with the help of her husband’s stepmother.  Later she continued on her own so that she could support her five children.  

Teresa will use this loan to buy new merchandise and invest in more gold and silver jewelry.  Her goal is to be able to work without having to rely on a loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and jewelry.

loans.name: Nanumaya

texts.en:
Nanumaya, a 45-year-old married mother of a grown child, age 30, established her cow-raising business in 2000. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. Having already received and repaid five loans from Patan BPW, she used her most recent one to buy a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Nanumaya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Never raised for beef, their milk is used to make curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer). Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk daily, each liter selling in the local market for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Rot

texts.en:
Rot is 54 years old and married. She has 3 children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a hired motorbike driver and also helps her to transport food to her customers' houses.

Rot earns an income by preparing and selling food from her food stall. She has had her stall for 7 years and it is going smoothly. Rot would like a loan to increase the size of her business and produce a greater quantity and quality of food. The loan would be used to purchase fresher vegetables, meats and good quality spices.

Rot hopes that through the loan she will be able to attract more customers and generate a higher income by which to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables, meats and good quality spices,

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a 32-year-old widowed woman who settled down in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She only has one child to care for. She has been engaged in a manicure servicing activity for three years to earn a living. She earns a monthly income of approximately PHP 3,000 from this job. Rosalinda has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase a new manicure set for the service-based activity. She hopes to have more customers, gain more income and apply for insurance for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new manicure set

loans.name: Víctor Daniel

texts.es:
Víctor Daniel es un hombre alegre y trabajador. Tiene 30 años es soltero y vive en casa de su madre, con quien comparte muchas cosas como el trabajo bajo un mismo capital.Víctor se dedica a la venta de comida junto a su madre. Desde muy temprano salen juntos al mercado a hacer compras para después vender. Una vez que el deja a su madre lista en el mercado va a su centro de labores, pues el aparte trabaja en un fabrica hielos. Víctor dice que lo bueno de trabajar con su madre es que puede confiar en que su inversión esta segura, además que puede disponer de su tiempo para trabajar en otros lugares como el trabajo que tiene ahora.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede darse el tiempo para compartir con su mamá quien ya es mayor pero que aun puede de esa manera sentirse útil. Lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que su madre a veces tiene que quedarse sola, pues el tiene que ir a cumplir con el horario de trabajo que tiene en su otro empleo.Este es el tercer préstamo de Víctor con MFP, el grupo que integra es un grupo muy unido y le gusta estar ahí por que le hacen sentir como si fueran uno solo, aun que no se ven muy seguido siempre están preocupados el uno del otro.Con el préstamo solicitado de 1000 soles el piensa comprar ingredientes e insumos para que su madre pueda seguir trabajando pero con mayor cantidad de inversión.
texts.en:
Víctor Daniel is a hard-working, happy man.  He is 30 years old, single and lives with his mother.  They work together selling the food his mother makes.  Early in the morning they go to the market together to buy what they need to sell.  Once his mother is set up in the market, he goes on to the ice factory where he works.  Víctor says that the good thing about working with his mother is that he knows it is a sound investment and leaves time for him to work elsewhere.

What he enjoys about his work is the fact that he can spend time with his mother who is elderly but still wants to feel useful.  What he does not like about his work is that sometimes his mother must be alone because he has to comply with the work schedule at his other employment.  This is Víctor's third loan through MFP.  He is in a very united group.  Even though the members do not see each other often, they are constantly worrying about each other.  He plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy ingredients and supplies so his mother can continue her work with more capital.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for food sales.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana works hard to support her family.  She is single and has a business selling shrimp paste in the Philippines.  Viviana has been in this business for 20 years.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more ingredients of shrimp paste.

In the future, Viviana would like to save money so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients of shrimp paste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell chicken.

loans.name: Carla Germania

texts.es:
Carla tiene 20 años es soltera y vive con sus padres en Latacunga. Carla se describe como una señorita de caracter fuerte y alegre.

Carla trabaja con sus padres en la crianza de animales (cerdos). Es la priemera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crèdito que solicita es para la compra de alimento para sus animales como es el balanceado para chanchos, lo cual ayudarà a que sus animales tengan un buen alimento y asì mejorar su calidad.

Su sueño es terminar de estudiar y tener salud para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Carla is 20 years old. She in single and lives with her parents in Latacunga. Carla is described as a cheerful young woman with a strong character. 

Carla works with her parents raising animals (pigs). This is the first time that she has worked with Fodemi. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy feed for her animals, such as balanced feed for pigs. This will help her animals to be well fed and improve their quality.

Her dream is to finish school and be healthy in order to support her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals, such as balanced feed for pigs.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey has over 20 years experience managing and buying in retail. He and his wife, Jennifer, created a business plan for an educational toy store in 2007 and they were open for operation by 2008. Jennifer is a speech pathologist and spends a few days a week helping at the store. Jeffrey says his toy store, Learn All About It, is currently in a large shopping plaza but still has the mom and pop feel to it. Jeffrey takes pride in having excellent relationships with his customers and with all of his experience in retail is confident about the success of the store.

This is Jeffrey’s second loan from ACCION USA. He will use it to cushion inventory purchasing during the upcoming holidays. Learn All About It has been growing every year and this loan will help free up cash flow as they get into the busy season.

Check out Jeffrey's business website here:
http://www.learnallaboutittoys.com/

loans.use: To purchase inventory for the upcoming holidays.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. She would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of products to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with three children. Susan is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Susan is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 27 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase livestock feed.
 
Susan has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Susan hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a resident of Kitale western Kenya and has been farming for 3 years. She is still single. She produces milk, maize and vegetables for the local market.

Jane has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will boost her dairy business and in turn provide income to buy more dairy cows. She wants to own five dairy cows in the next five years.

She faces the challenge of dairy diseases

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito has been working his one hectare of rice fields since 1988.  He is grateful because it has been 23 years of patience and sacrifice he has made to earn a living.  He is married and has three children.  One of the things he appreciates most is his wife being supportive in his all decisions.  His wife has been raising animals for fattening within their local community.

Warlito would like to educate all his children because he doesn't want them to suffer what he has already gone through.  So, he is aiming to improve his rice production so that he can gain a plentiful harvest every crop season.  He has tried his best to budget his profits but due to the abrupt increase in the price of basic commodities he can no longer afford to purchase some farm inputs.  In this situation, he is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000.  This amount will serve as his hope in achieving his plans to improve his farming techniques, which will enable him to earn a greater income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Jisaidie Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jisaidie Group in Western Kenya! Netty is the facilitator of the Jisaidie group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Netty takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Netty had a good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Netty was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Netty  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Netty will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Jisaidie group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefina; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos como quinua, trigo y cebada, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cebada, trigo y quinua al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “LAS ORQUIDEAS” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to province and department of Cuzco. 

The member's name is Josefina. She is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling dry goods such as quinoa, wheat and barley. Through this business she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to expand her dry goods business. She is asking for the loan to buy barley, wheat, and quinoa wholesale. 

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy barley, wheat and quinoa wholesale.

loans.name: Angeluica

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casada e mae de 7 filhos 3 dos quais ainda frequentam Escola e outros ja trabalham. Fez 3ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.

É comerciante e dona do seu negocio ha mais de 12 anos, vende material de construção onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês e aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) e mais algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para revenda (cimento e areia) para a produção de blocos e vender. O emprestimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende ampliar a sua actividade comercial, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Angeluica was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has seven children; three of them still go to school and the rest are working. Angeluica finished third grade and did not continue because her parents could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her grandchildren, who live with her.

She has had her own business for more than 12 years. Angeluica sells construction materials and earns an income of about 4,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses, saves some through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings) and saves more in her bank account.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Angeluica's second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement and sand) so she can make and sell blocks. The previous loan was for 10,000 meticais and was for the same purpose.

She promises to make her payments on time. She intends to expand her business activity one day, and in order to do that she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for making blocks.

loans.name: Walter Emmanuel

texts.es: Walter, nuevamente se ha decidido a un nuevo préstamo debido a la necesidad de invertir en la siembra de granos básicos y comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesitan como: abono, herbicidas, semilla,  a si podrá obtener buenas cosechas en esta nueva siembra que iniciara. Él considera que los préstamos anteriores le ayudaron porque logro mejorar la forma de vida de su familia y logro que sus cosechas fueran abundantes.
texts.en: Walter has just decided on a new loan due to the need to invest in the harvest of basic grains seeds and to buy agricultural supplies that he needs like: manure, herbicide, and seeds so that he will be able to have a good crop in the upcoming planting season. He believes that the prior loans helped him because he was able to improve his family’s quality of life and he had an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide, and seeds.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her two late sisters’ children.  Fatuma lives in a rental home with access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.  Fatuma has a business selling plastic products in a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years and works 6 days a week.  

Fatuma has requested a 1,500,000 UGX loan from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more plastic for resale.  She generates additional income by selling piped water.  Her main business challenges include customers who default on payment and thieves.  Fatuma’s aspirations are to become wholesaler and to build rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more plastic products for resale

loans.name: Abla Sylvie

texts.fr: Âgée de 39 ans, Abla Sylvie vit au Bénin et a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Abla Sylvie est mariée à un certain Symplice. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abla Sylvie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage.  Abla Sylvie vend du jus de citron et du bissap et de l'eau en sachet  dans sa boutique depuis quatre ans ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants.  Abla Sylvie vend aussi des objets d'électricité.  Abla Sylvie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. La clientèle de  Abla Sylvie devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu,  Abla Sylvie sollicite une deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des sachets, du citron et des feuille de bissap

loans.name: Ramily

texts.en:
Ramily works hard to support three children. She is married and has a  business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy a SANITARY TOILET.

She is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to keep family away from any diseases by keeping surroundings clean.

Ramily is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health problem.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the construction of sanitary toilet like cement, hollow blocks, sand, etc

loans.name: Gloria Honduras

texts.en: My customers know that I will make arrangements to their liking.  They come to my house to order arrangments for weddings, sweet fifteen parties, birthdays, and holidays.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as plastic flowers and lovely baskets

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Paco was born in the state of Guerrero, where his children and the rest of his family reside. However, 8 years ago he decided to visit the capital of Querétaro in search of better employment opportunities, as he was facing many financial difficulties in his hometown. That is how he came to start his own toy-selling business in Querétaro, after a friend offered to rent him a space in a central location. Thanks to the business, he has been able to cover his costs and help his family. He therefore wants to continue to grow.

At this time he is in need of a loan of $200 to acquire a larger quantity of merchandise, thereby increasing his sales and, consequently, his income. You have the opportunity to support Paco. Become an important part of his achievements. He and his family sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Paco nació en el Estado de Guerrero, lugar en la que radican sus hijos y el resto de su familia, sin embargo el hace 8 años decidió visitar la capital queretana en busca de una mejor oportunidad de empleo, ya que estaba enfrentando muchas dificultades económicas en su lugar de origen. Es así como inicia en Querétaro su propio negocio, la venta de juguetes, pues una de sus amistades le ofreció la renta de un local en un lugar céntrico. Gracias a esta actividad el ha podido solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su familia, es por el quiere continuar creciendo.

En este momento el requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS para poder surtir una mayor cantidad de mercancía y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Tú tienes la posibilidad de apoyar a Don Paco, vuélvete parte importante de sus logros. El y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta, her husband and their two children live in a small Somoan village.  Prior to Imeleta joining SPBD, both Imeleta and her husband were unemployed and relied on the help of neighbors and nearby relatives for basic necessities such as food and water.  The women in Imeleta’s village encouraged her to join SPBD.  She did, and with her first loan, she was able to start up a small village store.  Since then, Imeleta and her family have seen small but steady gains in their standard of living.  Also, Imeleta happily reports that the self-satisfaction she has gained as a result of her business endeavors has contributed to a marked improvement in her relations with her husband and children.  She remains grateful to the other village women who have continued to counsel her on running a small business.  Imeleta’s goal is to grow her business to bring in enough income for her to equip her home with water and electricity.  To achieve that goal, Imeleta is seeking further financing in order to expand her shop’s stock of goods.

loans.use: Purchase goods for her shop

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en: Nereah A. is a 58-year old widow.  She lives in Migori, Kenya, with her seven children and four grandchildren. She is a leader of Buchwa women's group, a community initiative that provides home-based care services to people living with HIV/AIDS. She also runs a food kiosk at Achuth market in Bware, specializing in selling the local favorites, chapattis (fried flat bread) and mandazzis (fried sweet dough) served with tea.  She supplements her food kiosk business by buying and selling dry maize and also has local dairy cattle breeds which produce milk for sale. Her daily income has increased by 100%, and she has managed to save a bit of her profits.  She requires US $600 to enable her to move her business to a larger space and a more lucrative location.

loans.use: Expand her food kiosk business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve her store and buy more products

loans.name: Fiel Da Rocha Fernan

texts.pt:
Fiel da Rocha Fernando is not married but he lives with his girlfriend with whom he has 2 children. He works for the government as a clerk. H e joined the credit program in 2005, with the loans he has been able to buy home appliances. His girlfriend has her own small business. With this loan he wants to buy construction material to improve his home. He is able to support his family and the loans have been very useful.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Fiel da Rocha Fernando, solteiro, vive maritalmente com uma mulher com quem tem 2 filhos. Ele e funcionario numa instituicao estatal. E escriturario. Ele entrou para o programa de credito em 2005. Com o valor dos emprestimos nessa altura conseguiu comprar electrodomesticos para a sua casa.A sua esposa faz pequenos negocios, mas ele nao faz negocio nenhum. O emprestimo dele e de consumo. Com o emprestimo actual ele quer comprar material de construcao para poder construir uma casa feita de material convencional, pois que actualmente vive numa casa de pau a pique. Os seus dois filhos estao a estudar.Ele consegue sustentar a sua familia sem ggrandes problemas, pois que o emprestimo tem-lhe sido muito util.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Description

Alba M. is 35 years old, and married to Valentin Caceres who is 41 years old. They live in their own house, with the basic necessities. They have 3 children, two sons and one girl, all teenagers who study at the public school.

Alba has been the owner of a small general store for more than 5 years. She sells items for every day use such as rice, oil, drinks, flour, etc. She runs her business from her home, and her children help her. Her husband has worked for the railroads for more than 20 years and has a monthly salary which helps cover the costs of taking care of and educating the children.

The motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock the business, such as ciders, wines, beer, soft drinks, etc. because the demand for these items is always high at the end of the year. One of the projects Alba has for next year is to open another business, selling clothing, items for the home, office, gifts, etc. There is currently no such shop in the neighborhood and her customers are requesting it.

Descripción: DESCRIPCION necesidad La señora Alba M. de 35 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Valentín Cáceres de 41 años, viven en casa propia, equipada con las necesidades básicas del hogar. Tienen tres hijos aún menores de edad, dos son varones y una mujer; todos ellos son adolescentes y están estudiando en colegios públicos.

La señora Alba es propietaria de una despensa con más de 5 años de antigüedad, vende artículos de primera necesidad como ser arroz, aceite, bebidas en general, harina, etc., su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, que es atendida por ella y por sus hijos. Su marido trabaja como empleado ferroviario hace más de 20 años y tiene un salario mensual, con la que ayuda a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y la educación de sus tres hijos.

El motivo por el cual solicitan el crédito es para la compra de mercaderías en oferta como ser: vinos, sidras, cervezas, golosinas, productos enlatados, etc. ya que en épocas de fin de año la demanda de estos artículos es bastante alta.

Uno de los proyectos de Alba para el próximo año es la de abrir otro negocio, esta será en el ramo de mercería y bazar (venta de artículos varios como ropa, artículos para la casa, librería, regalos, etc.). ya que en el barrio no existe ningún comercio dedicado a esos rubros y sus propios clientes le solicitan este tipo de artículos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER STORE SUCH AS CIDERS, WINE, BEER AND SODAS, AS DEMAND FOR THESE ITEMS IS ALWAYS HIGH AT THE END OF THE YEAR.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more clothing and garments for sale and to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Lourdes Mercedes

texts.en:
Lourdes Mercedes R. M. has a store where she sells food and drinks in the center of Juanjui, San Martin.  She’s rented the space for her business since 1996.  She has a good location next to a small technical university where students come to grab a quick bite to eat, drink, and relax.  She is established in the city and now has many loyal customers.

Lourdes is 45 years old, single and has one child.  Her daughter is very important to her so she saves carefully so she can send her to University.  Lourdes started her business after working in restaurants for many years earning very little money.  She decided she could start her own business and take charge of her life.  She now feels happier and more confident than ever.

A member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas, Lourdes is seeking a loan of $275 to invest in her business.  She will repay the loan over a period of 4 months.  With the loan she would like to buy beer, sodas, and snack foods.  The loan will help her meet the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas and snacks foods

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em K., 53, works as a vendor of grocery products, making an average profit of $2 a day . Her husband, Mr. Sous Ton, 51, raises pigs, earning about $2 a day of profit. They have five children, two of whom work in a factory, typically earning $60 each per month. This couple is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to breed.

loans.name: Austine .

texts.en: Austine T. E. is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. He resides in Benin-City, Edo state, Nigeria. Austine sells men's and women's clothing and shoes and has been in this business since 2005. He needs a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Refija

texts.en:
Refija was born in 1954 and she is a widow. Her monthly income is 600.00KM. She sells clothes at her home.

Refija wants to use this loan in the amount of 1200.00KM for buying textiles and to rent a bench in order to sell textiles at the market and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles and rent a bench at the market.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia Z. D. C. is a busy business woman in the town of Mache high in the mountains of the Libertad region. Her family owns some land where they raise different animals such as pigs, cows, and chickens to sell at local markets. They also own two vans that they use as taxis to shuttle people to and from Mache and the capital of the region, Trujillo.

Julia is 51 years old, married, and has 4 children. She loves working with her family and spending time with her children. She loves building relationships and working hard to improve her family’s future.

A member of the community bank Mujeres D. Mache, Julia is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy feed and vaccines for her animals.

loans.use: To buy feed and vaccines for her animals

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm V., 46, is married and lives with seven of her children in the Kampong Cham province. Working a farm together with her husband, Morm V. typically makes US$1.50 each day. Her family is also supported by two of the children who work in the garment factory and one child who is in construction. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Morm V. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase fertilizer for their farm, a purchase that she believes can bring an increase to her daily income.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en: Mrs. Somaly P. is a grocer in Tie Prumpie Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Somaly P. obtained a loan to start her current business. Because her business is doing well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods in order to expand her business. Her husband, Mr. Ponara Bou, is a construction worker. Mrs. Somaly P. is 39 and is the mother of six children, two of whom help their mother while three others are enrolled in school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 30 years old and married with 2 children, aged 10 and 14. She became a food seller in 2005. Every day she works from 7 AM to 3 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Mwanahawa now hopes for a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, vegetables and bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Абдуллоева Мухабат жительница района Восъе.Возраст 34 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование средние. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей золотых изделий.Она торгует на местном рынке района. Торговля является основным источником дохода ее большой семьи.Так как заработная плата мужа небольшая. Мухабат скупает у оптовых поставщиков золотые изделия и реализует в розницу. На кредит хочет закупить золотые украшения.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabat A. resides in the Vose region. 34-years-old, she is married, has four children, and a secondary school education. She trades in items made of gold at the local regional market. This business is the main source of income for her large family as her husband’s salary is low. Muhabat buys from wholesale suppliers of jewelry and sells retail. She wants to buy gold adornments with this loan, and plans to repay the loan within twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Mrs. Usha T. works as a farmer in Balkhu, Kathmandu. She has five children in school and a husband who works as a painter. She mostly grows seasonal vegetables and sells her vegetables in a local market.
Now Mrs. T. is requesting a Rs 20000.00 loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farm, and plans to use extra profits to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buys fertilizers and seeds for her farm

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. O. sells used children’s clothing in Rongo, Kenya. She has been doing so for 5 years and says that while business is okay, it could be better. Each month, Alice travels into the city of Nairobi twice in order to purchase the clothing she sells. She is only able to buy as much as her funds at the time allow, which usually limits her purchases. She would like to be able to afford to buy larger amounts of inventory during each trip, as it is cheaper to purchase the used clothing in bulk.

Alice is a widow and is the sole breadwinner for her 3 children. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan Schillings in order to buy the used children’s clothing in bulk from Nairobi, thus increasing her inventory and saving her money.

loans.use: To buy used children's clothing

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin A. is 50 years old and married with four children. His wife is a tailor. He sells tailoring materials such as thread, zippers, etc. 

He plans to increase his tailoring materials to meet his customers' demands. He is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Yihya

texts.en:
Yihya is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Yihya has been installing aluminum for 15 years. He works with all kinds of aluminum including for kitchens, windows and doors. Yihya has requested a loan of USD$600 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase household expenses. Yihya has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

The loans have influenced his life in a good way. Yihya is speciA. in his work because he has competitive prices and his clients are his friends. He decided on doing this business because of his knowledge and his experience in this work. When he first started, he faced a lot of competition. In the future, he hopes to improve his family's income.

loans.use: Yihya needs the loan for household expenses.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en: Mrs. Sak H. is a villager in Chhoer Teal village, Kandal province, Cambodia. She and her husband, Mr. Hing Vet, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate vegetables. Their field is infertile and Mrs. Sak H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her soil more productive. She is 38 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom attend the local school while the last is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes inicio el negocio porqué dejo de trabajar como empleada en una empresa y quería dedicarse a una actividad que le permitiera estar mas al cuidado de sus padres y poder brindarles una mejor atención ya que son personas mayores y están a su  cargo, fue por eso que se decidió a poner su negocio de papelería. Comenzó en Febrero de 2002 en la cochera de su casa pero solo duro 3 años y lo cerro porque entro a trabajar como empleada a una empresa y no lo podía atender. Posteriormente lo reinicio en Febrero de 2002 y desde entonces se ha dedicado por completo al negocio y a cuidar de sus padres. Acaba de abrir otra papelería en otra colonia de la ciudad donde le ayuda a su hermana y una vecina,  en su papelería acaba de comprar tres computadoras para tener un tipo  Caber-café y adquirí también otra copiadora por lo que siente que ha ido progresando poco a poco.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $12,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancía y le  servirá mucho para capitalizarse y poder comprar papelería ya que con la compra de las computadoras se quedo  con poco dinero para invertir en mercancía.
texts.en:
Lourdes set up her stationary store because she had left her previous job working for a company, and wanted to dedicate herself to an activity that would allow her to care for her parents, who are quite dependent on her in their old age. Although she ran the store off and on for a while, it has been her only business since February 2002. Since then, she has dedicated herself full time to the store and to her parents. In fact, not only has Lourdes opened a second store in another neighbourhood, with her sister and neighbour helping her run it, she has also bought a photocopier and three computers to help turn the first store into a cyber cafe as well as a stationer's. Little by little, her business is growing. Lourdes needs a loan of $12,000 pesos, which she will pay back in 10 installments, so that she can buy stationary to sell. She is short on capital at the moment. Because of the money she spent on the computers, she does not have enough left over for merchandise. .

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Faiese

texts.en:
Faiese L., 24, is married with 1 child. She has 2 years of experience in a handicrafts business. She sells to the general public, tourists and overseas markets 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Faiese’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase carving equipment like sand paper, a chainsaw and painting materials.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw, sand paper, and painting materials

loans.name: Abdufatto

texts.ru: Абдуфатто в первый раз получил в МикроИнвест займ для продолжения строительства своего дома и тогда он купил строительные материалы. Условия кредитования МикроИнвест ему понравились, и так как он занимается бизнесом, он решил получить займ для его развития. Абдуфатто 51 год, он женат и имеет 5 детей. Бизнес Абдуфатто располагается в самом престижном ресторане города, где он арендует бар. В его баре работает 2 человека (на фото продавец). Абдуфатто надеется что полученный займ способствует развитию его бизнеса и он и дальше будет получать кредиты.
texts.en:
Abdufatto's first loan from Microinvest funded the purchase of building materials for continued construction of his house. He liked Microinvest's loan conditions, and since he has a business he decided to request a loan for its development. Abdufatto is 51 years old, married, and has five children. His business is in the city's top restaurant, where he rents the bar. Two people work at the bar (the vendor is in the picture). Abdufatto hopes that the loan will allow him to further develop the business, and that he will be able to continue to receive loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: María Elpidia

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Brigida M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de refrescos los cuales son elaborados por ella misma todos los días y ofrecidos en su establecimiento en dicho mercado.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas para elaborar los refrescos y de esta manera comercializarlos en su localidad para continuar manteniendo su humilde hogar. Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por esto espera que su crédito sea otorgado.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua Brigida Martinez runs her business selling fresh fruit drinks, all of which she makes and sells herself in the market.

She is recurring to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to purchase fresh fruit with which to make her fruit drinks and sell them through her stand, in order to continue supporting her humble home. She has been a loyal client of Ceprodel and she hopes that her loan will be granted to her.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For ingredients to make fruit drinks.

loans.name: Oyetola

texts.en:
Oyetola F. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. Oyetola has a cassava farm where she produces garri and fufu. To make garri, cassava tubers are peeled, washed and grated or crushed to produce a mash. The mash is placed in a non-water proof bag and allowed to ferment for one or two days, while weights are placed on the bag to press the water out. It is then sieved (or sifted) and roasted by heating in a bowl. The resulting dry granular garri can be stored for long periods. It may be pounded or ground to make a fine flour. Fufu is a thick paste or porridge usually made by boiling starchy root vegetables in water and pounding with a large stick and bowl until the desired consistency is reached. 

Oyetola is requesting a loan of N80, 000 to purchase more cassava to plant for making garri and fufu to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to plant for making garri and fufu to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian A. started her fish sales ten years ago at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo of Ghana. Vivian prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She has a cunning mouth to convince her suppliers to sell her more fish when there is high demand for fish and the supply is low.

She buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them at a nearby stand. She has a big customer base that travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish. They buy from her both the fresh ones and the smoked ones. She is now 38 years old, married, and mother of six children. Currently all her children are in school. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children's educational needs and her business growth. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Provident’.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fish and dried fish

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: C'est un jeune de kolda qui s'est lancé dans la réparation de motocyclettes et la vente de leurs piéces détachées. Il est célibatare mais responsable dans la gestion quotidienne de la maison où il vit avec sa maman. Avec ses revenus il essaye d'aider sa maman et de préparer un peu son avenir. Cependant le manque de moyens ralentit ses activités qu'il aimerait voir se développer
texts.en:
This is a young person from Kolda who got started in the motorbike repair business along with their spare parts. He is unmarried but in charge of the everyday managing of the house, where he lives with his mother. With his revenues, he tries to help his mother and to prepare a little for his future. However, a lack of means is slowing his business, which he would like to see develop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair motorbikes and to sell spare parts

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina O., a 36-year-old mother of three children, owns a one-hectare farm. She helps her husband, Drix O., to till the farm to ensure an abundant harvest for her family. The couple dream of good things for their children. They want to send them to school so that when they get older, they will find better employment and be able to provide for their future families.

Mrs O. is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will help her achieve maximum yield from her farm and a better income for her family. As well as enjoying accessible credit from CEVI, Gina is secured by the CEVI micro-insurance program.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Gái's Group

texts.en:
Gái Thị N. was born in 1963. She lives in Luc Canh village, in the Xuan Canh commune, with her husband and two sons. Her husband is a truck driver. The older son is in high school. The younger son is at home. Ms Gai has a small store at home. She has borrowed via microfinance for two years. This time, she needs 5,886,000 VND (or ~$330 US) to buy goods to sell.
No: 010107010001  

 There are four other fund participants in her group:

Thảo Thị Phan was born in 1981. She cooks for a factory and breeds pigs and poultry. She needs 3,270,000 VND (or ~$185 US) to buy food for them.
No: 010107010003 

 Lan Thị Quỳnh N. was born in 1951. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or ~$280 US) for a small business.
No: 010107010002 

 Nga Thị Phạm was born in 1954. She has two children. She has an electrical shop. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or ~$280 US) to buy electrical goods for her shop.
No: 010107010005 

 Hải Thị Hoàng was born in 1976. She has two children of school age. She wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (or ~$255 US) to buy vegetables to sell at the market.
No:010107010004

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Kansé

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Kansé C. a 31 ans, marié et père de deux enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur C. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’initia  au commerce  de vente d’articles  divers. Actuellement Kansé opta pour une spécialisation en habillement et en alimentation. Il  dispose  de deux boutiques, une  de Prêt à Porter et une Alimentation à la gare routière de Sikasso. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a environ une  année. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel après  avoir remboursé  par  anticipation le premier prêt. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter, 8 cartons de biscuits, 4 cartons de mayonnaise Calvé, 8 paquets de boissons NBB, 3 cartons de savons, 4 casiers de boissons BRAMALI, 3 cartons du thé, 5 sacs du sucre, 5 paquets de bonbons, 5 cartons du lait NIDO, 5 casiers de boissons MALTA, etc. Il s’approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes à Bamako avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement de voyageurs et surtout de routiers.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 350 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kansé C., 31, is married and the father of two children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having tried out several businesses without success, Mr. C. began selling various items. Presently Kansé has chosen a specialization in clothing and foodstuffs. He has two shops, one selling ready-to-wear and one groceries in the bus and truck stop of Sikasso. He is much in demand with his clientele because of the quality of his merchandise.

Wishing to satisfy his ever growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about one year ago. He is on his second individual loan after having reimbursed the preceding one early. With this new loan he intends to buy 8 cases of cookies, 4 cases of Calvé mayonnaise, 8 packets of NBB drinks, 3 cases of soap, 4 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 3 cases of tea, 5 sacks of sugar, 5 packs of candy, 5 cartons of NIDO powdered milk, 5 crates of MALTA drinks, etc. He buys his goods from the wholesalers in Bamako and then re-sells them retail to a clientele composed generally of travelers and especially transporters.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 350,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow his working capital, contribute to supporting his family, and pay the interest on his loan, investing any remainder back into his businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is fifty-four years old. She is divorced and has given birth to six sons. Some are still in school while others are learning trades. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Janet lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. She buys her goods in Kumasi. Janet has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday A. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut and is requesting a loan to purchase more groundnut to sell.  Sunday is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more grounndnut to sell

loans.name: Luzel

texts.en:
Luzel M. lives in the village of Scions, Canitoan, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she sells used clothing (or "ukay-ukay" products) to people who live in her community. She has been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Luzel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and increase her business opportunities. She has applied for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Scions, Canitoan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: So
