She has currently requested a loan to buy clothes like shirts, blouses, skirts, and other garments that are more profitable and sell quickly.

Maria Nieves sees that her business is growing.  She is getting more customers due to the variety of merchandise that she offers.

She feels good about her business, and she considers it to be profitable.  She hopes to continue getting income in order to improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy clothes (shirts, blouses, and skirts, etc.).

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en:
Kieu is married and 32 with two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in Ho Chi Minh City.

Kieu has been running a cafe for the last six months to support her family. Kieu would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of foods, fruit and furnishings for her cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase good quality fruit, foods and furnishings for her cafe.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es:
Melchora tiene 21años, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Vive en pareja con Raúl, ambos se dedican a la venta ambulante de hamacas, sabanas, colchas y demás, haciendo sus recorridos en la zona metropolitana de la ciudad, específicamente en las ciudades aledañas a la capital.
Melchora, al terminar su ciclo básico de la escuela, ya se dedicó a la profesión ya que sus padres se dedican exclusivamente al campo, para que de esa forma pueda ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Es una persona muy sacrificada ya que realiza las ventas casa por casa recorriendo varios kilómetros en su moto. Aprendió la profesión de su hermano ya que antes salía a hacer sus ventas con él y éste le inculco para que se dedique de lleno a las ventas para que así pueda crecer como persona y como profesional.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de hamacas, sabanas, colchas y demás insumos para la venta posterior. Agradece a la fundación y de kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Melchora is 21 years old and lives with her parents in the city of Carapeguá.  She lives with her husband, Raúl and together they sell hammocks, sheets, bedspreads, and other things.  They are mobile sellers and make their runs in the metropolitan zone, specifically in the towns surrounding the capitol.

She is very dedicated and sells door to door, covering many kilometers on her motorcycle.  She learned this line of work from her brother and used to make her sales with him.  This motivated her to dedicate herself to this line of work so that she can grow as a person and professional.

Melchora started this line of work after having finished her first school cycle, in order to help out the family financially.  Her parents worked exclusively on the farm.

She is requesting assistance through Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva, in order to buy hammocks, sheets, bedspreads, and other items for resale.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity they provide.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bedspreads, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Melche

texts.en:
Melche, a a 24-year-old married mother of two who lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family, earns a living selling fruit salad to her community, while her husband runs a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business. Together, they work hard to provide for their needs and save for the future.

Melche has requested a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts and raw ingredients for making fruit salad. She hopes for her and her husband's businesses to grow, and also hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and raw ingredients for making fruit salad.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Primitivo;  El socio tiene 44 años de edad, El socio es soltero, El socio tiene 1 hijo de 20; El socio tiene su agroveterianaria en Calca, el socio trae mercadería desde la ciudad de Cusco al poblado y es el que se encarga de proveer a los clientes todo lo que requieran para mejorar sus cosechas y medicinas para sus animales. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería nueva para implementar su tienda.
El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Calca in the province and department of Cuzco. 

The member's name is Primitivo. He is 44 years old, single, and the father of a 20 year old. He has a farming/livestock supplies store in Calca. He brings merchandise back from the city of Cuzco to the town and gives his customers everything they need to improve their crops and medicine for their animals. He is asking for the loan to invest in buying new merchandise to stock his store.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to making his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying new merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Meshark

texts.en: Meshark, 48 years old, is married and has five children. He describes himself as a social and focused man. For the last one year, he has been in the tailoring business and sells sweaters and dresses to residents in his area. His business challenge is the high cost of material used for sewing these clothes. He will use the loan Kes 10,000 to buy wool and material for sewing new clothes. Meshark hopes and plans to run a boutique in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes materials (fabric) and wool for sewing.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina, tiene 52 años es madre soltera con 4 hijos. Juntos habitan en su propia casa ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua.  Agustina es una mujer llena de talento para los negocios, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde hace 4 años. Nos comenta que cuando su esposo falleció tuvo que hacer frente a las necesidades del hogar, por ello emprendió éste negocio. En la actualidad le va muy bien gracias a la buenas ventas que realiza, también se debe a la poca competencia que tiene, generalmente trabaja con el apoyo de su hija mayor quien le ayuda en la atención al cliente. Ella en un futuro desea ampliar su negocio incrementar más productos como vender comida rápida y la preparación de postres y con el tiempo tener su fuente de soda.
Este es su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de más productos.
texts.en:
Agustina, 52, is a single mother with 4 children.  They live together in a house that Agustina owns in Canayre, a small town in the Llochegua district.  Agustina is a talented businesswoman.  She has operated a business selling beverages for 4 years.  She tells us that she started the business when her husband died and she needed an income to keep the family going.  The business is a success, she says, and generates a good income.  There's not much competition for the business in the neighborhood and Agustina can rely on her oldest daughter to help her with customers.  She wants to expand the business and sell prepared foods, including deserts, and even add a soda fountain.  
This is Agustina's third MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.  She will use the 2,000 new soles loan to buy merchandise that she will resell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man with two children.  He describes himself to be a loyal man. Joel operates a retail business where he provides electronics repairs services. He has been involved in this business for seven years. Joel’s business is located near a chief’s compound and his primary customers are the local residents in his home area. 

Joel will use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts to use in his business.  His business goal is to run an electronics shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to use for electronics' repair.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is 53 years old, married and has been blessed with two children. Raising cattle is what she does to earn a living and she has been in business for 22 years. She also owns rental houses and describes her business as very busy. She is very hard working and through the help of Faulu Kenya, she has learned to save her money for the future. She hopes to add more rental houses and increase her herd of cattle. She requires a loan of 32,298.75 to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride aged 33 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 8 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 10 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay wokers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 52 years old farmer from Gubaan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married with three children. She has been in the farming business for 21 years. This is the main source of her income. Edna is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his rice production. With this loan, She will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and thus she can harvest as many as they can so that they can provide the needs of their children especially the education . In the future,Edna hopes to make her farming business more productive and abundant so that they can provide all the needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy ferlitizer

loans.name: Astring Elkid Giron

texts.en:
I am the owner of my own beauty salon. I had always wanted to have my own salon, and 15 years ago I started working to one day succeed. Now, my salon is frequented by many people, most of whom are women that work on the local government offices and private businesses in the area. My shop is in a location in a central area where security is very good, a fact of great importante to my clients.

By listening to my clients, I discovered other products that they would buy from me, so now I sell handbags, wallets, hair clips, shampoos, lotions, cosmetics, skarfs, and shoes. It makes them very happy that I offer quality in the styles they like.

loans.use: Buy inventory such as genral accessors for woman such as bracelets, hair clips, earrings, as well as hair products in general.

loans.name: Aaaaaaaaaaa

texts.en: eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee

loans.use: dddddddddddddd

loans.name: Ahmad Shah

texts.en:
Ahmad Shah is 45 years old, and has 15 years experience in metal working. He has a metal shop and
10 students. They create metal windows, chairs, doors, etc. He is requesting a loan of $850 so he can purchase more materials and open a second metal shop. This will provide more income and work for himself and his students.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his metal shop

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara has 13 years of experience trading at the open-air market. She is married and has 2 beautiful girls.  They are a very friendly family and help each other in business. Gulsara brings brooms from Uzbekistan in the Andijon districts. She bought the brooms from peasants. Her girls are old enough to help her to prepare the brooms for sale.  Her daughters paint the brooms and dry them under the sun. Gulsara sells the finished goods in her trade place. When she heard about Micro Invest, she became a client and started with a loan of $50. Gradually she could increase her loan to $700.
Today she has a lot of clients. Now Gulsara requests $1000 to increase the volume of her goods.

loans.use: Purchasing of brooms

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Business Description

Segundo has 2 years experience and learnt his trade from a friend who gave him the tools he needed to start his business. He started repairing computers and now he also puts them together and sells them. He works weekdays from 3pm – 7pm. Each morning he teaches IT in a school near his home.

He will use the credit to buy computing material and he will also fit out his home as a shop in order to serve his clients better.

Personal Information

Segundo is single and he lives with his parents and 5 siblings. They are all single and the oldest work. Their house is made of a mixture of materials. Segundo was born with a defect in his hands which meant it was hard to work, but this is what pushed him to continue to work and help his family. His aim is to see his business grow and to have his own shop.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Segundo tiene una experiencia de 2 años con su actividad. Aprendió el oficio de parte de un amigo el cual le enseño. Le facilito herramientas de trabajo con las que inicio su negocio. Comenzó reparando computadoras. Actualmente a mas de repararlas también las armas y las vende. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 3 p.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Por las mañanas es profesor de computación en una escuela cerca de su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de artículos de computación. Además de adecuar su domicilio para poner un local donde pueda darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Segundo es soltero. Vive con sus padres y 5 hermanos. Todos son solteros y los mayores trabajan. Su casita es de construcción mixta. Segundo nació con una mal formación en sus manos lo cual no ha sido impedimento para realizar sus trabajos. Es lo que lo impulsa a seguir a trabajando y ayudar a su familia. Su deseo es poder ampliar su negocio y tener un local propio.

loans.use: To buy computing materials/Comprar articulos de computacion

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives on N.2 Street in the Alto Lima area of the city of El Alto. She sells hamburgers from her kiosk in the evening. The money is earned with the help of her family, as her husband and three children, ages 20,18 and 14 help with preparing the hamburgers.

The credit she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for her business.

This is her first credit with Impro. The evaluation done qualified her for the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha vive en la calle n. 2 de la zona de Alto Lima de la Ciudad de El Alto . Se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas en su kiosco en horas de la tarde. Los ingresos que obtiene ayudan en la manutención de su familia, la cual consta de su esposo quien le ayuda en la preparación de las hamburguesas y tres hijos de 20, 18, 14 años de edad.

El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos para su negocio.

Es el primer crédito con Impro. La evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.

loans.use: Capital for business

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio and his determined family have been through difficult financial times. At one time, he worked in a repair shop/garage. Thanks to his restless nature and self-initiative, he was able to learn a great deal and now – thanks to great effort and sacrifice – has decided to open his own garage. His objective, with the assistance of his wife and children who help and support him in his daily endeavors, is to provide an excellent level of service and to make his small garage the busiest in his native town of Ayaviri. To achieve his goals, he asks for a loan that he commits to repay within eight months. Your generous support will be a wise investment in the hands of this family, giving them the opportunity to prosper with their new project.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Eusebio y su empeñosa familia, desde que formaron su hogar pasaron por momentos económicos muy difíciles; en un principio él se desempeñaba como empleado en un taller de mecánica; gracias a su inquietud, iniciativa, e interés pudo adquirir mayor conocimiento y ahora a base de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio decidió abrir su propio taller y a través de esta actividad brinda un eficientemente servicio a su comunidad en compañía de su inseparable esposa e hijos, quienes lo acompañan y apoyan en su labor diaria.El deseo de este ejemplar padre es implementar su pequeño taller y hacer de este local el más concurrido de su ciudad natal, Ayaviri. Para concretar sus anhelos solicita un préstamo de dinero que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de ocho meses. Tu generoso aporte será una inversión sabia en las manos de esta familia, dales la oportunidad de prosperar con su nuevo proyecto.

loans.use: Establish a small garage and make it one of the busiest repair shops in the city.

loans.name: Sarela Lorenza

texts.es:
Sarela Lorenza is a member of the La Amistad del Dorado communal bank, in the province and district of Moyabamba, department of San Martin. She sells groceries from a space located in her own house. What motivated her to start this business was the desire to continue educating her children, and in addition she enjoys being in contact with her friends and clients.

A loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, will buy various groceries such as different brands of soap, packages of toilet paper, canned fish, liters of oil, so that she can offer them to her clients.

She is 48 years old, has 2 children who are pursuing higher education and who support her, along with her husband, in attending the business. She has always distinguished herself as a hard-working woman, responsible for the work she assumes.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sarela Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal La Amistad del Dorado de la provincia y distrito de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un ambiente ubicado en su propia casa. Lo que la motivo a dedicarse a este negocio eran las ganas que tenía de continuar dando estudios a sus dos hijos y además le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes.

El préstamo, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará diversos abarrotes como cajas de jabón por cada marca, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado, aceite por litros, todo ello para ofertar a sus clientes.

Tiene 48 años, dos hijos que están cursando estudios superiores y quienes la apoyan junto a su esposo en la atención del negocio. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (soap, toilet paper, canned foods, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria De Jesús A. sells juices and clothing in “Lion’s Station” market. She is a highly talented woman, who can make juices of all kinds. Since she was small, she exhibited skill in the kitchen and especial skill blending and mixing natural fruit juices. She is a single mother with one young child. She bears the full responsibility of caring for this child since it is so young.

Maria is applying for a spot inside the “Station” market, which will soon be confirmed. In order to better her equipment Maria has received 6 previous loans from Ceprodel. These she invested in remodeling her current location and also to support her fruit juice and clothing sales.

Both of industries, fruit juice and clothing sales, are very competitive. There are numerous other individuals that sell juice and clothing in the same market.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

Maria de Jesús A. se dedica a la venta de refrescos y también a la venta de ropa en el mercado la Estación de León. Es una dama con un alto talento para la elaboración de refrescos de todo tipo. Desde muy pequeña se ha caracterizado por ser excelente cocinera y en especial una excelente elaboradora de refrescos naturales. Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo al que tiene la responsabilidad de apoyarlo en todas sus necesidades por ser menor de edad.

Solicitó un local en el mercado la Estación, el cual al poco tiempo le fue confirmado, sin embargo, para mejorar las condiciones de su infraestructura ha realizado un total de 6 créditos en Ceprodel que los ha invertido en la remodelación de su localidad, además le han servido para continuar con la venta de refrescos y la venta de la ropa que es un negocio muy competitivo por el hecho de que en el mercado donde ella se ubica se pueden encontrar fácilmente otras personas que venden refrescos y de igual manera otras personas que venden todo tipo de ropa.

loans.use: Purchase of top of the line ingredients for the production of juices.

loans.name: Payanda

texts.en: Payanda lives with his own family in district 14 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and father of four children. He is the only breadwinner in his family. He has a metal shop. He has good experience in this business and he needs to expand his shop, so he has requested an individual loan to expand and make a good monthly income for his family. He wants to support them adequately and enroll his children in a better school. He is happy with all parts of his family.

loans.use: To expand his metal shop

loans.name: Luz 4 Group

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, as everyone in her neighborhood knows her, is 41-years-old. She learned how to cook when she was very young, and has worked in this business for 5 years. She has an inexpensive, very small kitchen in her home from which she obtains profits to support her two children and to purchase products for her business. With this credit, she expects to buy utensils and merchandise for her business. The other members of the group are: Margarita P. V., who sells food; Claudia Imelda R. P., who makes clothing; and Julia G. G. and Jazmin Candelaria R. P., who sell shoes by catalog.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

DOÑA ROSA COMO TODOS LA CONOCEN EN SU BARRIO CUENTA CON 41 AÑOS, DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA APRENDIO A COCINAR Y TRABAJO EN ESTE NEGOCIO DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS TIENE UNA COCINA ECONOMICA MUY PEQUEÑA EN SU CASA DE LA QUE OBTIENE GANANCIAS PARA MANTENER A SUS 2 HIJOS Y COMPRAR PRODUCTOS PARA SU NEGOCIO, CON EL CREDITO PRETENDE COMPRAR UTENSILIOS Y MERCANCIA PARA SU NEGOCIO LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON. MARGARITA P. V. VENDE COMIDA, CLAUDIA IMELDA R. P., CONFECCIONA ROPA, JULIA G. R. Y JAZMIN CANDELARIA R. P. VENDEN ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and merchandise for their businesses.

loans.name: Viv Ansanm Group

texts.en:
L. lives with his two children (ages 8 and 10) in a small community outside Trou du Nord, Haiti. He has been selling fish for the past couple of years, and with this loan he hopes to get a larger variety and better quality of fish. All of his profits will go directly to his children, whether it be for food, school, clothing, etc. He told us that his biggest difficulty is that his children get sick often, and they don’t have money for any type of medical care or even basic medicine. In the future, L. dreams of having a big and successful business.

Haiti is the poorest country in the western hemisphere, and economic development is extremely difficult without access to capital. Esperanza is grateful to all Kiva lenders who make it possible for us to extend credit to these entrepreneurs. God bless!

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Lizarda

texts.es:
Lizarda belongs to the Women with a Future Community Bank, located in Jr. Arenal 1210, in the Calleria District in Ucayali, Peru. She is a widowed 65 year-old mother of 6 children. Her income was not enough to meet the needs of her family, so with a loan from Manuela Ramos, she decided to start a small store selling frozen drinks.

She sells soda from her house, attending the store all day and also taking care of the house. Her children are grown and independent, but she loves when her grandchildren visit her, and she gets distracted by them.

With this loan of $750, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy: sodas of different prices and sizes, and will remoD. her house to make a better business environment.

Lizarda is an example of a working woman who, in spite of her age, keeps moving forward. Since she was young she has worked hard, and it has made her feel more independent. By making her own money, she could take care of her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Maggie Messerschmidt, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lizarda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal 1210, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años, es madre de 6 hijos, es viuda, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Lizarda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega de venta de bebidas heladas.

En la actualidad como todos sus hijos ya son independientes, ella vende sus gaseosas en su casa, atiende todo el día y también se dedica al aseo de su hogar, y disfruta mucho cuando sus nietos van a visitarla, se distrae mucho con ellos.

Con este préstamo de S/.2, 000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: gaseosas de diferentes precios, tamaños, golosinas, y remodelo su casa para tener un ambiente mas amplio.

Lizarda es un ejemplo de mujer trabajadora, a pesar de su edad ella sigue adelante, desde que era joven siempre trabajo, la hacia sentirse mas independiente y así tener su capital para poderlo invertirlo.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yarng

texts.en: Yarng N., 29, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband (pictured above) and three young children. She works as a farmer, making $1 a day, and is supported by her husband who collects palm juice, making $2 a day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Yarng N. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase pig food and to help her raise a pig. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who one day hopes to set up a grocery store in front of her home. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that her business venture will be successful.

loans.use: Purchase pig food

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat R. is a resident of Rudaki district. She's married and has a child. She embroiders cloth. To ensure smooth operation of her business, she would like to take out a loan to purchase beads and threads. She plans to repay the loan within 15 months. Her business brings in a decent income and so she is trying in any way possible to develop it.

Translation from the Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

Розикова Каромат жительница района Рудаки. Замужем , имеет одного ребенка. Занимается вышиванием ткани. Хочет получить кредит для закупки бисера и ниток. Это поможет ей обеспечит себя бесперебойной работой. Погашать кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев. Ее дело приносит не плохой доход , поэтому она старается всячески его развивать.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Agata

texts.en:
Agata is married and has been selling fruit since 2006. Every day, she works from 8AM to 5PM at her business and earns a monthly profit of around US$ 60 from her sales.

Agata is now requesting a loan in order to purchase more fruit for re-sale. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to continue to expand her business and reach out to more customers.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for re-sale

loans.name: Marie-Anne

texts.fr: Dame A. Marie-Anne est née le 04 avril 1955 à Dassa Zounmè. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont à sa charge. Installée à Akpakpa depuis une dizaine d'année, elle s'est très tôt prise en charge à travers une activité génératrice de revenus. Elle achète des pâtes alimentaires  au Nigeria un pays voisin au Bénin, qu'elle vient revendre aux grossistes du marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle a gagné au fil des années la confiance de beaucoup de clients qui ne s'approvisionnent que chez elle. Elle vient solliciter ce prêt pour dynamiser son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marie-Anne A. was born on April 4th, 1955 in Dassa Zounmè. She is married and the mother of four children, three of whom she still supports. Living in Akpakpa now for approximately ten years, she took on the responsibility of earning money very early. She purchases pasta in Nigeria, a country bordering Bénin, which she then resells to distributors in the Dantokpa-Cotonou market. Over the years she has earned the trust of many clients who will not get their supplies from anyone but her. She has requested this loan to revitalize her business.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of 70 boxes of pasta

loans.name: Amirhon

texts.en: T. Amirhon lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. T. Amirhon has been the client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she shown herself as a serious and motivated client. She has gradually increased loan sums and grown her business and personal income.  She has the business growing livestock and producing milk. She dreams to purchase one more milk cow for further milk production to supply to local bazaars. She plans to sells an assortment of milk and sour products such as pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, and curds. Mrs. T. Amirhon asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 4 months to purchase that milk cow.  It will allow her to significantly increase her family income.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Naïda

texts.fr:
Madame Naîda D. a 51 ans,  mariée et mère de 2 enfants vivant dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coepouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Lafiala de la préfecture de Koutiala ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Dès son jeune âge elle fut initiée(par sa mère)aux activitée génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce de vêtements d’enfants. Avec ses trentes ans d’expériences dans le secteur du vêtement, elle maitrise parfaitement les tenants et aboutissants de ce domaine, ce qui lui vaut aujourd’hui dans la ville de Koutiala, une réputation et une notorieté très enviable.  Elle est trés bien sollicitée  lors des céremonies sociales et des fêtes.
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante,  elle decida d’intégrer le programme crédit de l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis  4 ans.  Après avoir correctement remboursés les  4 prêts  solidaires (prêt de groupe) et les 4 prêts individuels, elle est à son 5 eme prêt en individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt,  100 habits pour enfants à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et parfois sur place à Koutiala auprès des grands commerçants grossistes. Elle vend ses marchandises au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle conctituée de femmes et hommes à crédit et au comptant.. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour rembourser les intérets du prêt et élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naîda D. is 51 years old, married, and has two children She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, her co-wife, and their children in the Lafiala quarter in the Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Starting at a very young age, she participated (thanks to her mother) in income-generating activities, notably the selling of children’s clothing. With thirty years of experience in the clothing business, she has perfectly mastered the ins and outs of this field, which has given her an enviable reputation and fame in the city of Koutiala. She is often hired for social ceremonies and parties. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing client base, she has been with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program institution for four years. After having repaid four previous solidarity (or group) loans, as well as four individual loans, she is now on her fifth individual loan. With this loan she hopes to buy 100 children’s outfits in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Sometimes she also purchases outfits on-site in Koutiala from large commercial wholesalers. She sells her merchandise, on credit and for cash, at the large market in Koutiala to both men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which she hopes to use to pay off the interest on the loan and to increase the size of her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's outfits

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 20 años, es natural de la provincia de Azangaro, vive solo, ya que aún es soltero. Es un joven muy empeñoso que se dedica  a la venta de celulares desde hace dos años para cubrir sus gastos, ya que vive de forma independiente en casa de su familia. El quiere progresar y en un futuro contar con un negocio estable que le arroje buenos ingresos, es por eso que necesita del dinero con que le podemos apoyar. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado quiere comprar mayor cantidad de celulares para su posterior venta, y así hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
William is 20 years old, a native of Azangaro province, and single. He is a very hard-working young man who has sold cellular phones for the past two years to cover the costs of living in his family home. He wishes to progress to a stable business that will bring in a good income, and for this he needs your support. He is seeking his first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With this money, he would like to buy a greater quantity of cellular phones to sell, which will help his business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of phones for sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 38-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Hassan has owned a grocery store for ten years. He sells vegetables, chocolate and canned food. Hassan has requested a loan of 800 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.
The loan will help him have more merchandise in his shop. Hassan is special in his work because of his honesty and good behavior with his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started, he faced a lack of cash. In the future, he plans to improve his business.

loans.use: Hassan will use the loan to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ayomi

texts.en: Ayoni E. is 60 years old and married with five children. She produces and sells palm kernel oil. She has been in this business for nine years. She needs a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more palm kernel to produce more poil to sell. She says thanks to all who have made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernel to produce palm kernel oil to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: VICTORIA A.  D. M.  VIVE JUNTO A SU FAMILIA EN LA COMUNIDAD D. VILLA ARRIENDO PROVINCIA  INGAVI, DURANTE 28 AÑOS. LA SEÑORA VICTORIA A. D. M., TIENE NEGOCIO PROPIO D. COMPRA Y VENTA PAPA, CHUÑO Y TUNTA, COMERCIALIZA AL POR MAYOR EN LAS FERIAS D. LA CIUDAD Y PROVINCIA, CUENTA CON 13 AÑOS D. EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO, SU ESPOSO ES PROFESOR TRABAJA EN EL COLEGIO CHORITOTORA. SI BIEN EXISTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO, VICTORIA TIENE UN BUEN TRATO A SUS CLIENTES Y RESPONSABILIDAD Y SU PUESTO D. VENTA SE ENCUENTRA EN LA PLENA PLAZA PRINCIPAL. VICTORIA DESTINARÁ EL CREDITO  PARA LA COMPRA D. MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR. NO TIENE ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS EN EL CENTRAL D. RIESGOS NI EL BURO D. INFOCRED.
texts.en:
Victoria A. D. M. has lived with her family in the community of Villa Arriendo in Ingavi province for 28 years. Victoria has her own business, selling potatoes and dried potatoes, which she sells in bulk at citywiD. and provincial markets. She has 13 years of experience working in this field. Her husband is a teacher at the Choritotora school. There exists a great deal of competition in the market, but Victoria has strong customer relations, responsibility, and a stall in the main plaza. She will use the loan to purchase bulk merchandise. She has no negative history with the Risk Center or Bureau of Infocred.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk merchandise

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna L. is a herbal medicine dealer. She is 70 years old already, widow and has 6 children. Though she is old, she is still strong able to mange a business. She has been a CEVI client for 4 years already. She has a good repayment record and a good market of her business also.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more herbal medicines which she sells to her friends, neighbors and her other regular clients. She started selling herbal medicines last 1989 using her small savings of Php 10,000. 

Now, Benigna still markets her herbal medicine in their town. Because she is a CEVI client, she has access to credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage services that CEVI gives to all their customers.

loans.use: To buy more herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Dawlat

texts.en:
Dawlat is a 21-year-old single man who lives in jalalabad of Ningarhar province, . He is the only breadwinner in a family of eight members. His father was a farmer, but he is now 60 years old and can not working more.

Dawlat graduated from high school last year but was unable to pursue higher education, due to financial problems. His father was very weak, and his family needed someone to support them. Dawlat was brave enough to assume this responsibility and decided to start a small business. He founded a small shop in the city of Jalalabad to sell mobile phones and phone cards. He already had experience in this field, having worked in his friend's shop during his spare time while in school.  

He wants to buy more mobile phone stock for his shop, so he has requested a loan of 50,000 Afghanis from AFSG. He hopes that this loan will bring positive change and benefits to his own and his family members' lives.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones for his shop.

loans.name: María Irene

texts.es:
La señora María R. con gran dedicación labora en su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos y bebidas el cual posee en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde a diario se esfuerza para obtener el capital financiero para subsistir.

Actualmente ella requiere de la compra de la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y por este motivo espera en que Ceprodel le brindará las oportunidades por medio de la obtención de dicho crédito y así saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Mrs. María R., with great dedication, works in her business which is the production and sale of food products and beverages. She is established in the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua where she works every day to make enough money to survive. At this time she needs to purchase the ingredients necessary to prepare the foods, and for this reason she hopes that Ceprodel will offer her the opportunity to get ahead in her business by providing the credit to make this investment.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages and raw materials for food products

loans.name: Herlosita

texts.en:
“In every sacrifice, there is a reward that waits” is the inspirational quote of Herlosita E.. She is 54 years old and married to Hipolito E. who is a farmer in their village. The couple lives in the village of San Isidro, Quirino, Isabela. They have been blessed with four children. Jilbert is the eldest, next is Bernard, the third is Gerald, and Henry is the youngest.

Rice and corn farming is their family’s only source of income. Herlosita always gives her helping hand to her husband in order to provide for their family’s needs. Herlosita assists her husband in their rice and corn fields to improve their family’s income since it currently is not enough to sustain them. She is turning to ASKI for a loan since they lack capital to purchase needed farming inputs such as fertilizer, rice and corn seed varieties, pesticides and herbicides. They will also need money to pay for labor to help during planting season. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 that will be used to support their farming business.

Herlosita hopes she will be able to earn more money in order to support her youngest child’s college education, giving her the opportunity to apply for a better job someday.

loans.use: buying fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Humans naturally have ambitions in life. Just like Annie, who is currently managing a general store in the village of Pieza VillaverD. of Nueva Vizcaya. She is hoping to someday become a successful entrepreneur. She is married to Rolando D. L. and they live peacefully and simply. They are striving to earn a larger income for the future of their family.

Annie is asking to borrow PHP 5,000 from the lenders. This money will immediately improve her business by increasing and diversifying her merchandise. She believes that her business will expand with this financial assistance and with her patience to manage her business well.

loans.use: To diversify merchandise

loans.name: Josefa Nubia

texts.es: Doña Josefa Nubia Z., es una mujer que ha logrado salir adelante con sus ventas de ropa y zapatos  desde hace once años  vende ella inicio con ahorros propios, y ahora esta incrementando mas su negocio con prestamos que Afodenic le ha otorgado. Con este crédito comprara ropa para niños y adultos y zapatos variados. Lo cual espera aumentar las ventas y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es comprar una vitrina grande  y poder poner sus productos accesibles a la vista del cliente. También desea poder apoyar a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Dona Josefa Nubia Z. is a woman who, for eleven years, has managed to pull herself up with her clothing- and shoe-sales business. She started the business with some savings and is now growing the business with loans provided to her by Afodenic. With this loan, she will buy clothing for children and adults and shoes, all of which she hopes will add to her sales and increase her earnings. Her plan is to buy a large display case so that she can better show her customers what she has to sell. She also wants to be able to help her children continue their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: Celerina A. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, married, and has six adult children. Celerina owns and operates a coconut business, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Celerina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Celerina is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase her crop yield. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Rodelie

texts.en:
Rodelie M. is from the village of Paglaum, Dumalinao, ZDS. She is 20 years old. Rodelie is married and has one infant. To make a living, Rodelie is starting a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Rodelie is just starting this business.

In 2008, Rodelie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. Rodelie is requesting a new loan, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rodelie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Samuel Mugambi

texts.en:
Samuel W. has been selling DVDs and tapes for the last five years in Naivasha town. He is 30 years old, married to Ruth Wambaire, and they have two children. Samuel was introduced to KADET by his friend, and this is his first loan with the organization. He plans to buy more tapes and DVDs to sell from the proceeds of this loan. This will increase his stock and enable his customers to have a wide variety to choose from. In the future, he hopes to move into a more permanent place where he can sell his wares both retail and wholesale.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more DVDs and tapes to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa M. de 41años de edad, casada, reside junto con su familia en el barrio Sabana Grande en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad que cursan la secundaria, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada que inicio hace dieciséis años para sobresalir adelante con los gastos de la familia,  comenzó con ahorros y prestamos el cual le ha sido de mucho beneficios por lograr mantener las ventas, este es su octavo ciclo en Afodenic el cual con este comprara pacas de ropa y uniformes de estudiantes ya que se acerca las fiestas patrias de Nicaragua y los padres comprar uniformes bastante. Espera poder tener su propia tienda. Da las gracias a la institución por los logros alcanzados el cual se ha beneficiado en mantener su clientela y ganancias la cual ha sastifacido sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Rosa M. is 41 years old, married, living with her family in the Sabana Grande neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works for a private enterprise and they have two children: a 12- and an 18-year-old, who are in secondary school. She sells used clothing, a business she has been involved with for the past 16 years and which earns her funds with which to help pay household expenses. She began with her own savings as well as loans that have allowed her to maintain her sales. This is her 8th cycle with Afodenic and she intends to use these funds to buy wholesale bales of used clothing as well as school uniforms since Nicaragua's national holiday is fast approaching and this is when parents traditionally purchase school uniforms. She hopes to have her own store and thanks the institution for the growth attained to date which has allowed her to keep her client base and earn profits that have helped her meet her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school uniforms and bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Help Yourself #2 Group

texts.en:
Help Yourself #2 is a group of five borrowers who live in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia. The group leader is B. K., a single 31-year-old mother of three children, aged 5-12, all of whom are in school. B. also cares for three children orphaned in the war. She was unable to attend school because, although she enjoyed it, the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. B. lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa County, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

B. has a retail clothing business, selling slippers, blouses, pants, skirts, headware, etc. She buys clothing wholesale from nearby Guinea and sells at a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades. She has run her business for 10 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic. B. is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of clothing, which sells well in the rainy season. Her dream is to grow her business so that one day she can have the biggest table in the market. With the profits from her business, B. dreams of building her own house and continuing to educate her children.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Amilyn

texts.en:
Amilyn A. used to work as a domestic helper in the United Arab Emirates with her dream to provide for the needs of her family, especially for her child.  After finishing her contract, she decided to return to her family for good and start her own business.  Her husband is employed at the  Evergreen Cereal Company as a delivery man. He is working away from them and he only come home every two months.

Amilyn is now engaged in selling processed foods like longganisa, pork tocino, chicken tocino and other frozen foods.  She is also planning to put up a small canteen near the school campus to be able to improve her business and for them to have a stable source of living.  

Amilyn would like a loan amounting to PHP5, 000  to pursue her business plan.  She wants to start managing her school canteen as soon as she has enough working capital.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N., 30 and her husband, Mr. Chorn Chea, 33, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married since 2000 and have two sons. All of them are still young. 

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to a middleman, who then in turns them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Sopheap doesn’t have enough capital to purchase weaving materials (raw silk and cotton thread), that’s why she is requesting her first loan of $250 to in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en: Ralph D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 26 years old and is single. Ralph owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members using his "habal-habal" (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers). He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ralph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ralph is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lory

texts.en: Lory N. is from the town of Aloran. She is 57 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Lory owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Lory joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use this amount as startup capital for her new business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as startup capital for her new business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: "Doña Martha, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casada con don Bernardo, la pareja tiene tres hijos, viven en casa de la mama de la Sra. Martha, donde ellos ya cuentan con sus propios cuartos. El esposo es cerrajero trabaja con fierro forjado, es muy requerido por su obra fina. La esposa tiene su negocio  en su domicilio, pero  tambien vende ambulando (sin puesto fijo). El crédito solicitado es para comprar más mercaderia, ropa interior y juguetes en la ciudad de Oruro, donde existe una feria grande  por  Navidad y fin de año antes que los precios suban."
texts.en:
Doña Martha is 37 years old. She lives at her mother’s house with her husband, Don Bernardo, and their three children. They have their own separate living quarters. Her husband is a blacksmith who works with forged iron to make his finished products. He operates his business out of their home while she works as a traveling street vendor (without a permanent location).

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise, such as undergarments and toys, before prices go up. She plans to acquire these products in the city of Oruro where a large fair is held for the Christmas and New Year’s seasons.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase undergarments & toys for the holiday season

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza R., 41, was born on February 14, 1968.  She is married to Antonio R. and both are blessed with two children. Born in the province of Masbate, a province just South of Manilas, he now lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite together with her family.

Riza has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow  seven times in the CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she was consistent in paying her loans was because she used all most all the money she loaned to buy and sell various personal products and office supplies to her clients.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 18,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying additional stock and as payment for the monthly amortization of their motorized tricycle.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that when the time comes, they will have the resources to send their children to college. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: additional capital for buying and reselling personal products and office supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence Y. is married and has two children. She has received senior high education.  Florence is an agent for the leading producer of ice cream in the country, Fan Milk. She sells a variety of ice cream products like Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt at Damanboh near Elmina in Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 2008. Her husband is a trader. Florence uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Florence will use the loan to buy more ice cream (Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt) for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more ice cream (Fan Milk and Fan Yogurt) for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase special mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

Juana nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar una vaca.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener ganado mejorado, también dedicarse a la elaboración de bloquetas (material de construcción). 

Lo que más le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que brinda los préstamos
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Calceteras” for two years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. Juana is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She has a fifth grade education and is dedicated to buying and selling small animals.

Juana says the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to increase her operating capital. She is now seeking a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy a cow.

Her dream for the future is to improve her livestock and also start a business manufacturing building blocks. Juana enjoys the loan services provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Liberto

texts.en: Liberto P. is from the village of Colupan Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old, married, and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Liberto owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling hollow block products to local businesses and community members. Liberto has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Liberto joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liberto has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Liberto is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Liberto from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Edit Soledad

texts.es:
Edit Soledad es una mujer proactiva, a sus 27 años es una mujer luchadora, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 11 años, trabaja con EDAPROSPO prosperidad desde hace 5 años, se dedica a la venta de cereales, carne de cerdo y carnero que trae desde Huánuco personalmente o también le envía mediante encomiendas sus familiares de dicha zona, realiza esta operación desde hace 6 años y además hace servicios de lavado de prendas de vestir, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprarse un terreno para construir su propia vivienda ya que vivía en casa de familiares.
El gran sueño de Edit, es mejorar el acabado de su vivienda y tener un negocio grande.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de prendas de vestir para comercializar en campaña escolar. Edit se encuentra muy agradecida por todo el apoyo brindado, porque le ha ayudado  a mejorar su calidad de vida y el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edit Soledad, 27, is a proactive, tenacious woman. She lives with her life partner and their two children, who are 9 and 11 years old. She has collaborated with EDAPROSPO PROSPERIDAD for 5 years. She sells cereals, pork and mutton that she personally brings from Huánuco or that she has her relatives in that area ship her. She has been in this line of work for 6 years and she also takes in washing. With the fruits of her daily efforts she has managed to buy a lot to build her house because she had been living with her relatives. Edit's great dream is to improve the finishings of her house and to have a big store. The latest loan will be used to buy school clothes to sell. Edit is very grateful for all the help she's gotten because it has helped her improve the quality of life of herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of school clothing.

loans.name: Trinidad Susana

texts.es:
La  microempresaria: Trinidad C. B. tiene 35 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos todos menores de edad y actualmente se encuentran estudiando. La microempresaria C. se dedica desde hace 7 años a administrar una pulpería con el fin de aportar a los ingresos de su hogar y en dicho negocio tiene variedad de productos por lo cual cuenta con una muy buena clientela.

La microempresaria C. ya ha sido beneficiada con un préstamo por parte de Kiva el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma, aprovechando este espacio para agradecer a Kiva por la oportunidad de haberla beneficiado con este programa y principalmente a esos  prestamistas que confiaron en ella dándole dicho préstamo.

Sin embargo aun necesita de otro préstamo para ir creciendo poco a poco ya que las ganancias de una pulpería no son las mejores y requiere diversificar más aun sus productos.

Por tal razón esta solicitando para comprar: 2 quintales de Maíz a US 26 cada quintal, 1 quintal de  Frijoles a US 44, 6 cajillas de  huevos a US 5 cada cajilla, 2 quintales de  azúcar a US 35 cada quintal, 2 quintales de arroz a US  45 cada quintal, 80 libras de  carne de res a US  2 cada libra, 2 docenas de café presto a US  25 cada docena, 3 cajas de pasta dental a US 6 cada caja, 100 libras de pollo a US 1.50 cada libra y 12 unidades de leche la lechera a US 3 cada unidad.
texts.en:
This micro-entrepreneur, Trinidad C. B., is 35 years old and married with three young children who are all currently studying. Ms. C. has been running a general store for the past 7 years with the goal of support her family's income. In this business, she offers a wide variety of products, so she has a good, faithful clientèle. Ms. C. has already been granted a loan through Kiva, which she repaid on time and fully, and she would like to advantage of this new space to thank Kiva for the opportunity to have benefited her through this program and she would principally like to thank the lenders that had the faith in her to give her that loan. Despite the success of her last loan, she needs another loan to continue, bit by bit, to grow her income. The profits of a general store are not the best, and she needs to further diversify her products. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy: 200g of corn at $52 US, 100g of beans at $44 US, 6 cartons of eggs at $5 each, 200g of sugar at $70 US, 200g of rice at $90 US, 80 pounds of beef at $2 US per pound, 2 12-packs of pressed coffee at $25 US per pack, 3 boxes of toothpaste at $6 US per box, 100 pounds of chicken at $1.50 US per pound, and 12 cartons of milk at $3 US per carton.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, beans, eggs, sugar, rice, beef, chicken, coffee, toothpaste, and milk

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, su casa está ubicada en un populoso barrio llamado “Villa El Salvador” al cono sur de la ciudad de Lima.

Antes de migrar a la capital del país se dedicaba a criar vacunos en una comunidad de la selva, donde hasta ahora esporádicamente viaja su esposo. Actualmente, María se dedica a la venta de comida rápida (papa rellena) en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años. 
Desde las 5 de la tarde se le encuentra laboriosamente friendo y atendiendo con amabilidad a sus comensales, cada porción la vende entre 1.50 y 2.50 soles, por lo que le está yendo muy bien. Ella se siente muy satisfecha y comprometida con su labor, debido a los buenos resultados que está obteniendo. Sus planes a futuro son de instalar una fuente de soda en su casa, con la finalidad de diversificar los platillos de comida y aumentar sus ganancias.

Este es su quinceavo préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en las fechas establecidas.  Con el dinero que esta vez solicita comprará los ingredientes para la elaboración de sus platillos y por ende atender la demanda de sus comensales.
texts.en:
María, 57, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a densely populated neighborhood, called ‘Villa El Salvador,’ located in the southern part of Lima. Prior to migrating to the nation’s capital, she raised cattle in a jungle community where her husband still sporadically goes. She now prepares fast food (stuffed potatoes) at her doorstep; she has been in this line of work for 8 years. You can find her laboriously frying and kindly tending to her customers from 5pm on. She sells her dishes for between 1.50 and 2.50 soles each so she does quite well. She feels satisfied with and committed to her work thanks to the good results she has attained. Her future plans are to install a soda fountain in her home in order to diversify her menu and increase her profits. This is her 15th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy the ingredients needed to prepare her dishes thereby meeting her diners’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis oriental. She is 39 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena has a sari-sari (variety) store selling both food and daily use products. She has done this for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sope Dabakh Group

texts.fr:
SOPE DABAKH est un groupement de 5 femmes commerçantes. Il est dirigé par Madame Ndondy B. âgée de 35 ans. Et il a été créé, il y’a tout juste 5 mois. Ces femmes se sont regroupées pour développer leur relation et s’entraider.
La présidente Ndondy B. est mère de deux enfants. Elle est commerçante de légumes au marché et gère également une table de légumes chez elle depuis 10 ans. En fait c’est un métier qu’elle a copie de sa maman qui vend jusqu’à présent des légumes au marché central de Thiès. Pour Madame Ndondy B. cette vente est prise pour aider son mari à la charge de la maison régler ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.
Les autres membres du groupement sont :
-Madame Seynabou W. la trésorière vend des tissus Wax, Basin, Khartoum…… Elle est marchande ambulante depuis 10 ans.
-Madame Awa N. née en 1967 vend de l’huile, pâte d’arachide, poudre d’arachide (naflay) depuis 12 ans. Elle fait également la marchande ambulante.
-Madame Maguette W. est marchande ambulante de produits cosmétiques, parfums, sacs, chaussures depuis 4 ans 
-Madame Salimata L. âgée de 39 ans vend des produits cosmétiques et chaussures chez elle depuis 5 ans.
texts.en:
SOPE DABAKH is a group of 5 businesswomen. Its leader is Mme Ndondy B., 35 years old, and it was formed just five months ago. The women formed the group to develop their relationship and to help each other. Ndondy B. is the mother of two children. She sells vegetables in the market, and has also been selling them for ten years from a table at her home. She learned the trade from her mother, who still sells vegetables in the central market at Thiès. She engages in this business to help her husband manage their household and to take care of her famiL.'s needs. The other group members are: - Mme Seynabou W., the treasurer, who has been selling cloth (Wax, Basin, Khartoum……) door-to-door for ten years. - Mme Awa N., born in 1967,has been selling oil, peanut butter and ground peanuts naflay) for 12 years, also door-to-door. - Mme Maguette W. has been selling cosmetics, perfumes, bags and stockings door-to-door for four years. - Mme Salimata L., 39 years old, has been selling cosmetics and stockings from her home for five years.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
El Señor Edwin R. P. tiene 31 años de edad, el vive con su mujer  y una  hija pequeña de casi 1 años. Ellos viven en inmediaciones de ivirgarzama en una zona agrícola del Trópico, Carrasco, quinta sección, municipio de Puerto Villarroel. 

El Señor Edwin R. P. se dedica a la cría de peces, los cuales vende a los diferentes  restoranes en Ivirgarzama y Valle Sacta el vive en un cuarto en alquiler con los servicios necesarios, ya que el esta empanzando recién una vida familiar, el proviene de una familia muy humilde el trabaja todos los días para el bienestar de su hija y su esposa. 

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alevinos para ampliar sus piscinas de peces, y así poder incrementar más sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Edwin R. P. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and young daughter who is almost a year old. They reside in the vicinity of Ivirgarzama, an agricultural area of Trópico Carrasco in the fifth section of the town of Puerto Villarroel.

Edwin raises fish to sell to different restaurants in Ivirgarzama and Valle Sacta. He lives in a rental apartment that has all the basic services for his new family. Edwin was raised in a very humble family and works every day for the welfare of his wife and daughter.

He is requesting a loan to buy fish hatchlings so that he can restock and grow his fish pond. This will allow him to generate more income so that he can offer his family a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish hatchlings

loans.name: Las Canasteras Group

texts.es:
Doña Loida Isabel Z. C. D. treinta nueve años D. edad, es una persona que ha superado criando animales tales como, gallinas ponedoras, cerdos, con este trabajo que ella realiza a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan también superar este grupo está conformado por doce integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, elaboración D. canastas. Las integrantes del Banco Comunal “Las Canasteras”, del Paraje Chocaman Barrio Santa Isabel, Momostenango, están conformados por MUJERES todas se conocen bien desD. hace más D. doce años, el cual

Han decidido solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia, ya que estas personas son D. escasos recursos y es D. gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital D. trabajo, mejorar sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Loida Isabel Z. C. is thirty-nine years old. She is a person who has gotten ahead in life by raising animals, including pigs and laying hens. By doing this work, she has been able to support her family and cover her household expenses. For this reason, she had the idea to form a group of women so that the others can also make progress. The group has twelve members, all of them women, who work in different fields such as raising animals, selling clothing, selling staple goods, and making baskets. The members of the "Las Canasteras” communal bank of Chocaman, in the Santa Isabel area of Momostenango, are women who have known each other well for more than twelve years. They have decided to request a loan from ASDIR so that they can improve their living conditions and those of their families. The members are people with few economic resources, and it is a great help to them to expand their working capital, so that they can increase their sales and their income levels.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila C. is from the village of Sepaloc. She is 37 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Nila owns and operates a general store, selling household items and dry goods in the local community. Nila has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Nila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Nila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nila from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for the business

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mr. L. is an older man and the father of a child who is already married. L. is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for years. His wife works on the farm with him. In addition to this job, L. owns a few ponds where many small fish grow. He estimates he will catch the fish to sell when they come to maturity, but unfortunately they are not very big due to the lack of food. Because he doesn’t have money, L. decided to seek help from Kiva lenders in the amount of $500 to purchase many sacks of fish food to fatten his fish.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fish food.

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABY est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 34 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, mères d’au moins de 02 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité et sont toutes issues du même village.

Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur pouvoir d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution CAURIE MICRO FINANCE. Elles sont à leur deuxième expérience avec cette dite institution et tous leurs prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Madame Aya F., debout à l’extrême de la photo, de noir  vêtue, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, d’ustensiles de cuisine, de téléphones portables, etc. elle s’approvisionne à Nouakchott capitale de Mauritanie. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte renforcer sa marchandise énumérée ci-dessus qu’elle vendra dans son village.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice qui lui permettra de participer aux différents besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The SOPE NABY solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009. It consists of 34 married women. On average, they are 40 years old and have at least two children. They live in nuclear families with their spouses and children. They were brought together by affinity and proximity, and they are all from the same village.
